Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as some make it out to be”
Reviews.Author: Maclock
Reviews.Content: Look, I have stayed in my fair share of hotels, and Hotel Felix is pretty nice. Bid appropriately on Priceline and if you end up there, then you should be happy enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lizlemon86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I got a great deal on this hotel through Priceline, and we have no complaints -- except maybe that the sink is just a little too small to properly fill a glass of water. If that's the biggest issue then you can't be unhappy. Central location (we walked pretty much everywhere we wanted to go... and Portillo's is just down the road!), friendly staff, lovely rooms. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, would be back again”
Reviews.Author: dan l
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms and staff. Nicely furnished. Not the biggest rooms, but in a central location you can accept that. Got a great deal through a search engine and it was worth every dime. For a nice place to stay wit out blowing the budget this is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: HiM8tnce
Reviews.Content: I along with two other friends, had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Felix last weekend. All I can say is WOW! We had two adjoining rooms, one with a king bed and one with a queen bed. The king room was huge! We loved the bathrooms with the walk-in showers. The decor was modern, and so was the bathroom. The sink was shallow, cool looking, but hard to fill a glass of water. We didn't have any problem with noisy guest coming in from a night out on the town, we heard them get out of the elevator, but once they were in their rooms, not a sound! The best were two of their doormen, Charles and Julien! Truly sweet natured gentlemen! They were both great at answering questions, giving us dining suggestions, etc.! We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jaydeeemdee
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 2012. Other reviewers have written long narratives so I'll cut to the high points: Good: -- Clean -- Fair location (about 4 blocks from Michigan) -- Comfortable bed -- Relatively low cost -- Free WiFi Bad: -- Small rooms as noted (about half the size of a typical two queen, or a bit smaller) -- Sink slow-running and shallow (wind up dipping your hands in the pool of runoff water) -- Low price tends to attract obnoxious younger guests (several groups of drunk kids who looked barely old enough to be drinking in the first place) -- Thin walls so you can easily hear said neighbors running through the halls or yelling at 2 am -- $42 parking charge I chose Hotel Felix for a short stay because of the low listed price given the location, but the parking charge cuts down on the difference between other hotels in the area. The room size didn't bother me since (as another reviewer said) I didn't come here to stay in my room, but don't fool yourself -- you're not getting a luxury hotel at a bargain price. The management seems to put a lot of effort into things that don't really affect the quality of the stay -- LEED certification (gets them a tax break but not clear what it does for the customer), trendy wallpaper and mirrors, and the amusing management response to *every comment* on the thread, transparently fluffing themselves and attempting to defuse any criticism, even if legitimate. Dear management, it's great that you're reviewing feedback, but if you really care about your customers, show them by taking care of them while they're staying with you. In sum, it's a fair option for one person or a couple who just need a place to crash, especially if you're on a budget, but next time I'll pay the difference for more space and attention.

Reviews.Title: “OMG”
Reviews.Author: Troy A
Reviews.Content: I booked thru priceline,I am sorry to say this isnt a 4 star hotel!. 1st off They put us on the 12th floor my wife has a problem with heights and elevators.(what they knew about). Walked in the room and it was half the size of my bedroom with no bathtub.(WAS VERY CRAMPED) They upgraded us to a king size room with a bathtub one problem, it didnt hold water wtf lol. And it took them a hour to get it ready for us.So we decided to stroll around Downtown and i was aprouched 3 times by homeless peeps. And this was after the fact they told me i needed my room key to enter the building after 900 pm (MAybe because of the food pantry across the street hell i dont know? but i didnt make me at comfort.And yes ive stayed downtown before. BUYER BEWARE> i was booked for two days, only stayed one.......

Reviews.Title: “Good for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: MommyLovesChanel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed three nights in the Hotel Felix for pleasure. The hotel was clean and modern but quite small in size. The room is fine for business travelers and couples with no children. I'm VERY glad we found a sitter because there is NO WAY we could have squeezed a pack'n'play in that room and still have met fire safety standards... The hotel staff was very polite. I would suggest going DOWN to the front desk if you have an issue however. Each time we called guest services they did not complete the task even after HOURS of waiting--for CUPS or PILLOWS! Easy things... but after going down the desk they were given to us right away. The location was quite good. A few blocks away from the Michigan Ave, near the Cathedral district. There is a whole foods kitty corner from the hotel which is quite convenient. Overall, nice for a quick weekend trip with your sig other or a business trip, but not if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Felix was clean,affordable,good location,and professionable”
Reviews.Author: lloita99
Reviews.Content: When searching on line for hotels I found them very expensive. Felix was perfect for vacationers on the go. Very clean, professional,great location for walking,and affordable. Don't let the name influence your decision-if your looking for a quiet hotel without all the bells and whistles this would be a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Laurence1001
Reviews.Content: As some reviewers have said, the rooms are a little small, but not, as some people say, tiny. My wife and I were quite comfortable in it. Although we were easily able to walk over to Michigan Avenue or the red line subway, it would have nice to have been a bit closer to Michigan. It was quiet, well-kept, and very clean. My wife would have preferred a coffee-maker in the room, but that's what husbands are for--hunting and gathering. I believe we got it through Hotwire; for that price it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but Tiny everything.”
Reviews.Author: KitKatChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. Overall the hotel is OK. The rooms and public areas are clean. My biggest complaint was everything felt cramped. The rooms are SMALL, which at first I didn't think was a big deal since we were hardly in the room anyway.... but then I kept hitting my knee on the bed frame and OUCH! Also, the bed was "queen" size, but it must have been some sort of mini-queen because I'm 5'3" and my feet were hanging off the edge. Other than everything feeling small, everything else was fine. Location is good; plenty of dining options nearby. Paid $23 for overnight parking at the garage across the street. (which is cheap by Chicago standards) I got the room on hotwire for $75 so over all, we were satisfied with our stay. We spent our 2nd night at the Hotel Sax which we enjoyed a ton more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel! Small Rooms but it worked!”
Reviews.Author: QR3
Reviews.Content: I don't want to sound like a broken record but I will agree with everyone. I Pricelined the Hotel Felix and I called the hotel and they would not guantee a room with two beds till day of. Of course when we checked in they told us the Hotel was sold out and we got a room with only one bed. It was a nice little hotel and clean. It had everything we needed for our two night stay. I would not choose it again because of the bedding situation. It was close to everything (bars, restraunts, shopping, ect...)

Reviews.Title: “TINY ROOMS!!!”
Reviews.Author: cieuxclairs
Reviews.Content: The Felix hotel is a boutique hotel, silver LEEDS-certified, right in downtown. Pros: good and friendly customer service at the front desk and room cleaning nice bed with quality linens very hot water and pressure (especially considering itâ€™s a green building) nice black out curtains nice free toiletries (H2O+) good location about 4 blocks from the â€œLâ€� (metro) good and friendly customer service at the front desk and room cleaning dÃ©cor was modern, chic, urban right by a Walgreens and Whole Foods for convenience certified green...stay with good conscience Con: TINY ROOM (there were only very narrow slits on each side of the bed to move around and really no place to sit except the bed...hotel calls it "cozy") sink was very shallow and water splashed everywhere TV was small, very few channels, and 4 of them are sports no free coffee maker in the room no mini fridge only one type of pillow and itâ€™s quite firm no night light switch option on any of the lamps alarm clock wasn't working no trash can (fixed when we asked for one at front desk) valet is $42/day and garage across the street is $30/day (very expensive) We found this deal on Hotwire where they didnâ€™t tell us the name, location, or reviews. They only revealed to us the number of stars and approximate neighborhood. Seeing that it was 4-stars and located in downtown, and that it was super cheap, we booked it. Overall, it wasnâ€™t too disappointing since all our needs were met. But this is NOT a 4-star; maybe 3 or 3 Â½. The main concern was how TINY the room was. Good thing we only used our room to sleep. We came home from our trip and were so happy how much bigger our home bedroom was that we will never take it for granted again. For $61/night, we may book againâ€¦but not for any higher.

Reviews.Title: “What do you want in a room?”
Reviews.Author: ebenezer15
Reviews.Content: WE don't come to Chicgo to stay in our room. The room was new, clean and very adequate for our needs. Close to resturants, bars and the action. We walked everywhere we needed to go. coffee in the lobby in the am was nice a small bar that was less expensive than most in the area and very accomodating. I would rather have smaller and new and clean than huge with scrapped walls and spotted sheets and blankets. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Small and cramped”
Reviews.Author: Ann3278
Reviews.Content: This is not a four star hotel. Three at best. We were given a room with a queen size bed. The bed size is actually a double/full size bed. It's very noisy. We thought people were entering our room when they were entering the room across the hall. The halls are very narrow. You can do better at another hotel for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The service was good, the room was clean, and the location was convenient. For what I paid, it was a very good deal. The hotel restaurant was okay, nothing special, but there were other options nearby . The room was clean, with some amenities, although rather small. Staff members were very nice and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: pats10
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 11am with my wife after an early flight and expected to just be able to leave our luggage but to my surprise we were allowed to check in. That was a great start! We had a small bed which looked to small for me since I'm 6'6". I guess it was a Queen which should have been sufficient, but I guess I'm just used to having a King Bed. Anyway I called the front desk and they upgraded us to a King Size room and they even sent someone up to our room with the new keys! As others have said the beds are very comforatble and the bathrooms are nice. I also have to comment that the gas fireplace in the lobby bar area put off a ton of heat. Very nice. An finally the free coffee in the lobby in the morning was great. I don't think I've ever made the instant cofffee that most hotel rooms have. I don't know if I would say this is a 4star hotel, but for the price you can get it on Priceline it's well worth it. I paid $73 but I would have been happy paying $110+. Just one small compliant. The alarm clock didn't illuminate so you couldn't tell the time when the room was dark.

Reviews.Title: “Sure the rooms are small, but you love each other, right?”
Reviews.Author: BennyReeds
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel several hours early and was greeted by a very friendly gentleman at the desk who allowed me to check in after my early morning of travel (such a relief to have a place to unwind other than a train station). The room was small, as expected from other reviews, so that wasn't a problem for me. I was also traveling alone. I had seen a young family in the lobby when I was checking in, so I was curious how the stay worked out for them...seems to me that there's a definite 2-person max per room, regardless of your size. The bathroom was very nice, and the shampoos/soaps smelled great. Very comfortable bed, and because the rooms are small, the temperature can be adjusted within minutes! I stayed two nights, and the cleaning staff were great about getting to work while I was gone for the day: they noticed that I had used a restaurant's styrofoam cup (Portillos!) to drink water from, so provided me with extra hotel cups in the bathroom, which I thought was very thoughtful...especially since my water had been tasting like a strawberry shake. They were also kind enough to leave the desk cleared (I had removed all of the hotel materials so that I could get some work done). Overall, I had a great experience at this hotel. The staff is super friendly, the accommodations are comfortable, the free coffee in the lobby 7-10am is a nice touch, and I got a great deal on Priceline. My only complaint, since I expected the size of the room, was the level of neighbor noise. Of course I heard horns outside, but hey, it's Chicago. It was just strange to me to be able to hear my neighbors' conversations in the hall, and some of their...early morning rituals. But hey, c'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel”
Reviews.Author: KQC_Mtl
Reviews.Content: Easy walk Lots of restaurants Good service I liked the decor but small rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great Decor”
Reviews.Author: crstina80
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in October for the Chicago marathon. I typically use Price Line for big cities to get a discount and I was able to secure this hotel through them which pleased me very much since I have always wanted to stay here. The location was perfect, just where I always like to stay and the room was impeccable. While small, it was niceley appointed and the hotel itself is beautifully decorated! We also ate in the restaraunt attached to the hotel, Elate, and found the food to be delicious! I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, great location... but not four star”
Reviews.Author: smurerSpringfield_IL
Reviews.Content: We paid only $55 for our room. The location was wonderful. The lobby is fresh, and well done. Breakfast was good, but we wish they had oatmeal. If you like a gourmet spin on traditional breakfast, this would be Heaven. Self-park across the street was reasonable. The room was very clean. On the other hand, the room was very, very small...and with a Queen bed. The staff assistance was mediocre. The fitness center had little to offer. Priceline should have placed this hotel in the 3 star category. We will stay there again, but with the proper expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lyrics97
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised staying at Hotel Felix. As most of the people that stay here, I named a price on priceline and got the hotel at a very cheap price. Most of the reviews I read were very negative, so I was expecting to be disappointed. The room is small, but adequate. It was very clean. (Make sure you don't get a room that faces the construction site next door) The hotel is five short blocks from Michigan Avenue. There are tons of great places to eat steps away from the hotel. The best part of staying at Hotel Felix was the availability of street parking at night.

Reviews.Title: “Round down on the rating”
Reviews.Author: EMinnesota
Reviews.Content: While a nice enough facility and room - the rooms are TINY. Not small. TINY. Crammped. When I checked in I noted it was my first time and I was coming in for a few days of R&R so the largest possible room would be great. The desk clerk noted, "All the rooms are small." Small as in the closet is a cut-out in the wall and the only drawers are in the bed base. I was staying by myself. The only place to sit and relax other than the desk chair is the bed. Nice bathroom (and the one thing of reasonable size). Location is a bit off Michigan Avenue but OK. If you only need a place to sleep, this is an OK option.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, well located. I like this place :)”
Reviews.Author: OBD2142
Reviews.Content: First off, love that this place has silver LEED certification! Thumbs up for doing things right for our environment. Rooms are small but decorated in a hip way. Nice toiletries including qtips and makeup remover pads. Unfortunately no shower caps. Pillows a bit thick. & hard. Staff really nice & helpful. Warning for this and all hotels. Check your alarm clock when you arrive. Mine went off at 2:43am grrrrrrump. Hotel offered free breakfast which I never took advantage of. I was working at merchandise mart & this hotel was a quick 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “"Cozy" but beautiful”
Reviews.Author: alienpilot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on our way to Orland Park, IL to dine at Alinea Restaurant. Although the room is quite small, it met our needs. Like the other reviews stated, due to limited space, there is no bath, just a roomy shower, No counter space in the bathroom, although a few small shelves you can use to store your bathroom stuff. All fixtures are first class and modern looking. The king size bed was extremely comfy! There is no chest of drawers. You will find three drawers under the bed at the end. Very clean room. There is one small upholstered chair. No in-room coffee maker (no room), but they do offer free coffee in the lobby. Flat panel screen TV. Very small desk under the tv (no drawer) for your laptop or counter space. Free wireless or wired internet access in the room (a plus). Standard high price valet service for Chicago ($42 a night with in and out privileges). No in room refrigerator but they were nice enough to deliver one to my room. Awesome view from the 9th floor. Got a complimentary upgrade from a queen to a king. Very friendly and accomodating staff. Awesome cozy lobby with neat fireplace and small bar near it. Great price on "Name Your Own Price" on Priceline. Centrally located. We took taxis to points of interest due to traffic and parking meter issues. Overall we were very pleased with this property!

Reviews.Title: “fun 3-star property”
Reviews.Author: klaine17
Reviews.Content: I rated this property in comparison to other 4-star hotels I have stayed at in Chicago. I Pricelined a 4-star hotel and was booked at Hotel Felix for two nights. I am used to getting chain hotels, and was excited to try a new hotel. I immediately called the hotel upon booking to request a room with two beds as I was traveling with my aunt one night and my college roomies the next. I was disappointed when informed that I was booked in a room with one queen bed -was not really accommodations for two in my opinion. I was told by the hotel that they were also nearly sold out of rooms with two beds, but I could get one of someone canceled the day we checked in. I was annoyed with both Priceline and the hotel. I called the hotel the morning I checked in to make sure there would be two beds and to my relief they could honor the request! Overall, I felt the hotel was a good value for the $76/night I got on Priceline, but I would not have paid the $138 going rate for the double room. There are too many other great hotels in Chicago! Hotel Felix is very nice, but not in the 4-star category with properties like Intercontinental, Westin, or W. The lobby was one of my fave parts of the hotel. It was very modern and cozy, had a fabulous fireplace, and smelled amazing (maybe from spa on 2nd floor?) The lobbyroom bar was fun and convenient with the freezing temps outside! The room (417) was small, but much better than what I was expecting after reading reviews. The beds were fantastic - comfy and great headboards. The decor was simple and modern. The room was very clean, but the painters in the last remodel should have used some painters tape as there was paint on sides of some furniture. The closet was tiny, but had a safe and plenty of room to hang our coats. The bathroom was fine. We could have used a little more space for our toiletries. Also, the water pressure in the shower was not great, but expected since a green hotel. The bath products were great - H2O - and they were happy to provide extra upon request. The staff was pleasant and accomodating once we got to the hotel. The location was great -to we walked to the theater, great restaurants and Michigan Ave. no problem! In summary, I would probably only stay here again if I Pricelined and was only traveling with my husband. It would have been much less stressful to spend a bit more and book at a hotel that can guarantee two beds. Also, while Hotel Felix is very nice, I think Priceline needs to reduce it to a 3-star property, maybe 3.5-star! I am happy that I tried out a new property, and am thankful it all worked out in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: Sara C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days during the week this past December. The furnishings were very modern, and staff was extremely nice! The room was also modern, but very small. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but if you plan to be in the room a lot this may not be the hotel for you. We had breakfast at their restaurant which was great!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy!”
Reviews.Author: Annie8991
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in October and booked thru Priceline. At the time it was a 4 star hotel and now I notice it is a 3 1/2 star which is more appropriate. People are not kidding when they say it is small .. It is "petite.". But this trip I was traveling by myself so it worked just fine ... Comfy bed and the room was clean. Location was good about 3-4 blocks west of Michigan ave. Lobby was small but nice and they had coffee in the morning complimentary downstairs . But it would have been too small if my husband had been with me.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I want to stay there now!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela S
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for 3/2012 and just this morning, tried to talk to the manager and OMGosh! She was rude and down right nasty! Going to see if I can get out of the reservation! Can only image how the the weekend stay would be if she is a crab over the phone! Should have listened to others complaining about management and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: deparker
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice so I know what everyone's talking about regarding the small rooms. The first time I stayed here, I had a tiny room with a tiny bathroom. The furnishings were nice but it was a bit difficult moving around in that room. The second time I stayed here, I received an average size room (which I would consider large for this hotel). I was able to move around the room comfortably and the bathroom was large. Very clean and contemporary furniture. The lobby is cozy and warm with a nice fireplace and modern furnishings. There is a little bar located there where you can grab a cocktail or a glass of wine. I have mixed feelings about the front desk staff. I had a nice person who worked with me but noticed another staff member being a bit terse with another guest. I don't think it compares with the other four star properties rated by Priceline. Think it is more of a 3 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “This......is No Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Maitaiguy101
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend & I travel a bunch, and really enjoy staying at hotels in Chicago for a weekend getaway. We do have favorites, but that's a separate review. On this one friday night, we decided for a last minute shot at a weekend night in Downtown Chicago. The hotel rates in the city, because of a convention and of course last minute booking, were all fairly pricey, so we decided to try "Priceline". We get a room at the "Hotel Felix". Lucky us......or not! I do a little web research, and find that a woman was murdered there a few months back, by some disgruntled boyfriend or other. I don't tell my girlfriend this, because of the obvious reaction she may have. But then I figure that murders probably happen a lot of hotels, and I'm just not in the "Hotel Murder" email list. So here we go. Check-in at 5pm on Friday, November 11. The lobby is small but seems to have charm. Up to the counter, where two gentleman are at the reservation desk. We stood there for 3 minutes until one of them finally looks up and says, "Yes?". Apparently a "Welcome to the Hotel Felix, how can we help you?", is too old school for this modern hotel. There probably is more charm at a methadone clinic check-in. Let's move on. You'll need your key card to get into the elevator, I assume to keep the riffraff out or perhaps a repeat offender. Whatever. Now if you read the reviews, you'll hear about the small rooms. You have to know that small typically might mean no separate sitting room or couch area. Small here means that there was 18" between the end of the bed and the tv dresser cabinet. Getting up in the middle of the night to use the restroom, left me with bruises. If you're not small people, be aware of this. Not even a real closet. The bathroom? The room seemed to be slightly larger than a "Porta-Potty". Now please understand that room was clean, and the tv, lights and water all worked. But at $ 145.00 a night for this room, you can only go to this room to sleep. You have a bed and a bathroom, in a room the size of your red-headed kid's bedroom. It really should be classified a hostile, not a boutique Chicago hotel room. Enough of the room. We decide to have an evening cocktail at the lobby bar. It's about 9:30pm on this Friday night. The lobby bar seats about 10 people, and the lounge area at least 25, so looks comfy. Drinks were fine, but that's where the evening goes south. Apparently employees are welcome at the bar on their day off. On this night, an off work bartender was in with a friend at the end of the bar. The bartender, employee & friend were trading stories all night while drinking. (Not the actual bartender). Them being loud and ruining the dynamic of the room & bar would have been one thing, but every other word out of this loud group was, "F*#K". To the point of being so uncomfortable, that the couple next to us got up and left. We kept on trying to ignore it while finishing our glass of wine. Now you may ask, "Why didn't you just get up and leave?" We kept thinking that the front desk or a manager would intervene and stop the drunkin "F" bombs being used for every other word. The lobby desk is within ear shot of the bar and lounge, and I guess they are just used to it, and didn't seem to be bothered at all by it. I also have to say that we are in are late 40's, and by no means prude or uppity. I am also in the restaurant business, so loud customers and bar patrons, from time to time, are part of the business. You know where to the draw the line with a loud really good customer, and a one time drunk & rude customer. But to have a guy at the bar loud and lewd, that's an employee of the hotel? Totally un-exceptable! This review has been brewing for almost two months, and I finally thought it was time to write this. I don't like to write bad reviews, I do a lot of research on places that I stay and love to write a review on a great experience that I can share with others. This stay was just not right from start to finish. I know we overpaid because of how busy the city was that night, but a guest experience that was so poor, you feel almost ripped off. With that being said, if you can get this room for $ 49.00 a night, by all means stay because it's close to shopping. Don't plan on relaxing in your room, just stay out shopping, eating and drinking, then hope that you can just pass out in your bed from exhaustion! Just bring those kid bumpers for the dresser, so maybe you can avoid the bruises!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Gem”
Reviews.Author: Gary G
Reviews.Content: I decided at the last minute to go to Chicago for a long weekend. I found Hotel Felix and booked it. What a wonderful hotel! Everything was redone and very modern. Hot water right away which is a problem with a lot of hotels. Extremely clean!!! Room was small but had everything I needed, including a 37" flat screen TV. Staff was very helpful and doorman answered all questions and had some very good suggestions. Hotel Felix was in a nice area and walking distanced to almost everything I was interested in. I will book Hotel Felix on my future trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: sanman249
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after reading some of the reviews on this website. But I was quite disappointed. Not sure what people like about this hotel? I am baffled.Yes, the hotel is a short walk from Michigan Ave (Magnificent Mile) - so the location is good. But there are 100s of hotels around the Magnificent Mile. The hotel staff are not helpful. The rooms are VERY VERY small. With two pieces of luggage on the floor ... there isn't much space to move around. The thing is that much better hotels are available in the area for the same price. I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SAndi16
Reviews.Content: I spent one week at the hotel felix with my boyfriend! We really had a great time! The hotel is very good located and the staff is so friendly! The rooms are very clean and really stylish! For us it was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: northshoregirl1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location and for those who like walking, its a great walk from there to Michigan Ave and Grant and Millennium Park and is right next to the tourist corner spot with the 50s McDonalds, Hardrock cafe and other popular spots and if you are there for nightlife, its a nice walking loop to a variety of bars and a great Irish Pub is just across the street. The rooms aren't large, but the hotel is nice, clean, newer remodel and an eco-tique hotel, as very green and boutique style.

Reviews.Title: “Why I'm unable to fall back to sleep at the Hotel Felix...”
Reviews.Author: amyz7890
Reviews.Content: Just after 2am doors are opening, slamming shut, people knocking on doors, voices IN the next room, TV noises next door. An hour later, what are these people up to with so many visitors? Worries me after my travel companion, my 13 year old daughter, Googled the Hotel Felix just hours ago and discovered there was a murder here in October 2011. A 31 year old suspected prostitute was stabbed to death in one of the rooms here. There is no clock or docking station in our room, the outlet to charge my phone is at the end of the bed on a 'desk'. Heating/cooling system is annoying, I'm either roasting or freezing as the vent is just over our heads and blows right onto you as you lay on the bed. First impression of hotel: Cute, small lobby; staff was not overly friendly or helpful; we were sent to the 10th floor, got off the elevator and the compact hallway was a bit confusing as we searched for our room- they must have doubled the number of rooms when the hotel was remodeled; I opened the door and was not prepared for what I saw - yes, I read comments before we left, but was in no way was I prepared for this... a room that fit a bed and very little space to walk around the bed; bed itself is comfortable but pillows are too small; bathroom was also minuscule with a sink that does not have enough clearance between faucet and drain to even wash hands; the view out our window, where do I start! Wish I could upload my photos from my iPhone now, I've never seen anything quite like it! And just don't know what to say about it other than it's absolutely terrible. Hopefully my neighbors will quiet down now, I really want to get back to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Judy R
Reviews.Content: We did not know what to expect when we were assigned this hotel on Priceline. 1) Room was perfect for one-night stay -- we had very little luggage. 2) Bathrooms were small, but not too small. 3) Hotel looked brand new. 4) Room was very quiet. 5) Cute lobby with room for sitting by fireplace 6) Modern and cool space! 7) Not your traditional big hotel -- more European We would definitely stay here again! For our needs, just a one night stay -- hotel was a short walk to Michigan Avenue. Very convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Peggy G
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Felix the weekend of December 10-11th. After reading the reviews on this site I emailed them to ask if it were possible to get a king size bed because my BF is 6'4". Within ten minutes they emailed me back stating they could do that for me. The location was very good - convenient to Michigan Avenue, shops, restaurants, etc. The room are small but very well appointed and the lobby was very cool. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant twice and enjoyed that very much. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Chic design, small rooms, nice place”
Reviews.Author: michiganmarlon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix fits the boutique hotel cliche in so many ways - sleek, small lobby with young-ish staff sharply dressed in black; small, stylish rooms with well utilized spaces; an edgy on-site restaurant with a unique menu. But cliches are OK when they work. Felix is located @ Clark and Huron in the River North area of downtown Chicago, which is close to all of the retail/touristy bustle (and generic-ness) of N. Michigan Avenue but removed enough to have its own laid-back feel. The lobby is small, dark and tech-chic. The front desk staff is friendly without being effusive, and efficient. There are only 3 elevators to wisk you to your room, but this was never a problem during my stay. As I mentioned, the rooms are very cozy, but not uncomfortably so. My queen single had a wall-mounted flat-screen television with a decent channel selection, a (too) small work desk and a lounge chair. The bed was a little high off the floor but extremely comfortable - the kind you don't want to get out of in the morning. The room's closet was essentially an indentation in the wall with a sliding curtain to cover it. The bathroom was compact, but with well-utilized space, and continued the high-tech chic look of the hotel and rooms. Much to my delight, it featured a walk-in shower with a raining shower head and excellent pressure. H2O bath products and big fluffy towels didn't hurt the cause either. WiFi and wired internet access were free throughout the hotel. In addition, a complimentary business center with two computers for guest use is accessible 24/7 with your room key. Free coffee (of good quality) is available in the morning at the bar just off the lobby. I didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, but the menu looked good. I love staying in the River North area, away from the annoying hordes of slow-moving tourists and people clutching shopping bags in the immediate Mag Mile vicinity. For transit purposes, the Felix is about 3 blocks from the Chicago/State station on the Red Line of the El. The No. 22 Clark bus (southbound) stops just a few steps from the hotel's entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped camping with few amenities”
Reviews.Author: 1988RoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: If this hotel had a two star rating I would have still been disappointed. Cramped rooms leave no option for doing anything but leaving everything packed and your suitcase in the walkway to the bathroom. There is no drawer, no surface space to set anything. The "closet" is an 8" pole sticking out of the wall and too low to hang anything as long as a coat or dress. The bathroom had no surface. The shower is just an open area with a curtain. Everything is exceptionally low quality. The room is so dark that you can't tell if it is clean. The windows rattle, the walls are paper thin allowing me to hear every conversation surrounding me. Very limited services unless you want to pay for the onsite spa. This is completely unacceptable for a business traveler. Room service has such limited hours that it required walking blocks to get breakfast before going to work.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed Twice, No Problems”
Reviews.Author: AC312
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Felix twice in the last two years, and I have nothing to complain about either time. They seem to be a relatively frequent hotel on Priceline's Name Your Own Price, which is where I got both of my stays at. Great value for the area - the hotel is only 3-4 blocks from N Michigan and right next to the huge McDonalds/Rainforest Cafe area. Yes, the rooms are small (definitely would not try to fit more than a couple/two people in there), but are clean and well-kept. No bath and the sinks are kind of small, but bathrooms are otherwise nice. They also provide free internet, but it is usually very slow (I couldn't stream netflix on it). Staff was very nice both times - accidently locked a few items in my room safe at 2am and they had someone up within 10 minutes to reset the lock. They also provide free coffee/tea in the morning along with the NYT or WSJ (can't remember which one), which is a nice touch since I don't think there is a starbucks close. Overall, clean boutique hotel in a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and great staff”
Reviews.Author: c-legs
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel a few blocks from Michigan Ave. I've stayed at hotels in Chicago where I've heard sirens all night so this was a peaceful oasis. Extremely friendly staff. Whole Foods is one block away which is convenient for picking up wine or snacks. I've stayed here before and enjoyed it. Rooms are very Pottery Barn-ish with comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tedkop
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the busy Business person. Yes the rooms are on the small side and very European, very clean, comfortable queen bed, from my experiance vey well maintained and surprisingly quiet. I was on the 11th floor for three nights and only heard the ocasional siren fron the street below and no hall noise even though it was booked full. The staff was excellant and very frendly. The location is great with fine resturaunts in walking distance. I would not recomend this for families due to the size of the room and guest parking over night is $42. Got a great price on Price Line.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is rated as a 4 star hotel - but, it should be a 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: Florimbi
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are tiny and cramped, even with only a queen size bed and no room for a rollaway, much less your luggage! I asked for a bigger room and the staff told me they are a "Euro-hotel" - whatever that means, but somehow, I guess, that excuses them from offering more spacious accomdations. Seriously, the front desk people had "attidude" as I had booked through Priceline and they said they would only give us the minimum accomodations, since I didn't book directly with them! Horrible experience! My husband and I were traveling with our teenage daughter. I asked them how all three of us were supposed to sleep in this room...they told us, they would give us extra pillows and a blanket and someone would have to sleep on the floor! They refused to change our room and they had no rollaway beds to offer. Really, we paid over $200 and we are told, someone should sleep on the floor? We left this hotel, abandoned our deposit and found another hotel so we could all have a bed to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Like Hotwire Claims”
Reviews.Author: WN3986
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felix is a small comfortable hotel in a great location. I stayed there through a blind booking with Hotwire which chose to compare it to Omni, Hyatt and InterContinental 4 star brands which is not accurate. I got a great price for a Saturday night in the city but this is a place for a short stay for business or a couple, not a family and not for any more than a couple days. And ask for a room on the upper floor if you're booked here. My husband and I both had a poor night's sleep on the 2nd floor, partly due to rude guests on our floor, partly due to street noise and partly due to what sounded like construction a few floors above us. Oh and the HVAC in room system was LOUD too.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and neatly decorated, but very small.”
Reviews.Author: Jewellt00
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix was a very nice clean hotel with a good location. It was a quick walk to the Michigan ave, restaurants, and bars. It was decorated very tastefully and staff was very friendly. The only downside was the size of the room. The rooms were very small and left little space for luggage, but it was manageable. I would recommend using the parking garage across the street vs valet. Overall this hotel was very nice and I would stay there again, but kind of suprised that it was listed as a 4 star just based on size.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Felix - Chicago Illinois”
Reviews.Author: Karen524
Reviews.Content: Under no circumstances would I use priceline or Hotel Felix in the future. I just purchased a hotel on priceline and was told directly from Hotel Felix after the fact that the hotel room is for a queen size bed only. There are 3 people traveling & I was told the hotel would not accomodate us. I then called priceline & was told there was nothing they could do. I have used priceline for many years and have always been able to get a room with 2 double beds. I will never use their service again. Karen - Omaha, NE

Reviews.Title: “read the reviews and take heart”
Reviews.Author: Cascadecupcake
Reviews.Content: We've been to many hotels with 4 star and higher ratings. This wasn't one of them. I've stayed at nicer holiday inns! Rooms are tiny. You could lay in bed and touch the walls. Only one chair - a desk chair to sit in. Luggage sits on the floor - bed bug bait. One protruding coat rack from the wall constitutes the closet. And, since when did a plastic cup become eco-friendly? Also had a little attitude from the front desk when we asked for a larger room and were told "you already have one of the largest queen rooms". I would hate to see the poor soul who got the smaller queen room. Chicago has so much to offer in fine hotels. Sorry, Hotel Felix, you have lots of room for improvement. Maybe knock down a wall or two to make the rooms adequate for today's travelers. We left and checked into another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and Chic but...”
Reviews.Author: happyfamilyMacomb_Il
Reviews.Content: What an adorable hotel! Good location- not great location, very trendy and hip but very small room. We had one bed, so it is possible rooms are bigger with big beds, but certainly the smallest I've ever stayed out(including small rooms in San Francisco).There is a safe in the room, we had a good view from the 7th floor, and while the room is adorable, it is very small, with little room to set your items and no where other than the bed to lounge. The only place to put your clothes is in drawers under the bed and very small hanging rack. There is a small deck with a chair and one other chair, but not where you can sit and relax to watch tv. The bathroom was also decorated nice, but again very small, and only had a shower and no bathtub. The sink is modern but only about 1-2 inches deep at most. We were walking distance to Michigan Ave, but would've preferred to be closer. Got this hotel for $104 including tax on PRiceline so it was still a nice hotel considering always taking a risk on the unknown. Parking was $48 I believe, but we learned there is overnight parking right across the street for $23.(not sure that would include in and out priveleges however). They do offer complimentary coffee in the morning downstairs. Unsure if there was even a pool. Bed was very comfy!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE LOVE CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: jo c
Reviews.Content: This was in such a great location! It was so excess-able to the magic mile shopping strip. The service was good. The room were small and we unfortunately had a view of a half completed dormant building! Im not sure that which ever room that you would stay you would necessarily receive a view.. The rooms are well decorated and the lobby is quite interesting but done well.. the restaurant is fantastic! we ate here a bit!. The beds are comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Tried Hotel Felix Since Touted As 1st Green Eco-Friendly Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cstrickln
Reviews.Content: IF WE ARE RATING HOTEL FELIX ONLY ON THEIR ECO-FRIENDLY HOTEL, COMPARED TO OTHER HOTELS IN THE AREA, IT WOULD GET FOUR STARS. IF WE ARE ONLY RATING HOTEL FELIX ON THE ROOM, ETC. THEN WE GAVE IT THREE STARS. This review will start out as an eco-friendly review, which most people will probably not be concerned about... the review will end with the room/staff in general review. Since we are both environmentally conscious, active adults at 60, and use eco-friendly products, as well as eating organic foods, we wanted to check out Hotel Felix for it's website claims. It was true that Hotel Felix has natural Southern Exposure, Low energy-lighting, Water saving commode, Use recycled materials, Use "Bare" cups in the bathroom, and I would assume use Eco Friendly cleaning products to clean the sheets, etc. More information on this can be viewed on their website. While we did not put the "save water" card on our pillow indicating we wanted the sheets/towels changed, they still changed them away. Only when I told housekeeping that we didn't need anything, did they not change our towels and sheets for the day. As far as their Eco-friendly Sundair products, thankfully I brought my own shampoo and soap because the ingredients in these products I guess might not hurt the Earth, but they are not so good for your body with chemicals and dyes that are known to cause cancer - and while you don't drink the stuff, our skin absorbs anything we touch/use. I would think that if they are trying to be different from the other hotels in the area, they might offer organic, or natural products without dyes and ingredients that you need a dictionary to understand. Their restaurant, Elate, announces that they are proud to promote local and organic products whenever possible. From what I recall, there were (3) organic choices available from their entire breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner menu. If you are looking for organic food, you can get this much, if not more, at many other restaurants in downtown Chicago. We did eat breakfast one morning and had the one organic choice which was very good and the service was exceptional. Local products does not mean organic and chemicals more than likely are used. They also didn't offer any free range meats or eggs if they are trying to promote themselves as using healthy food. IN GENERAL: VERY CLEAN! FRIENDLY AND ACCOMMODATING STAFF - INSIDE AND OUT. Comfortable, small lobby. Small hotel bar. As far as the room in general - I guess you can say it is a masterpiece of organization in a small space. The room we were in was small, and the closet almost non-existant. If you are traveling alone, not a big deal, but as a couple trying to hang all of our clothing we had to layer outfit over outfit on I think 5 hangers in a small cubbyhole. There are no dressers per say, the bed is a platform bed with 3 drawers, which is fine, except the walking space in-between the drawer handles and the chair to the desk was about 2 feet. There are 2 night stands, each with a small drawer. The bathroom was large enough, the only thing that was "strange" was the bathroom sink. Having a modern flare, the faucet was so low to the ceramic bowl you could hardly get your hands underneath to get the water, squeezing in a washcloth. There was also no counter space to put out a bathroom travel case, etc. The shower was large with a great showerhead. Again, everything was very clean. Comfortable mattress! Our stay was for 4 nights and by then you get used to passing each other in a small space. Since I worked in the hotel for 2 of those days, I felt closed in. But, if you are basically using your room to just sleep while you enjoy the sights of Chicago, then not a huge deal. Good sized TV screen if you are into TV. Would we stay here again? Not sure at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: btysklind
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my sister-in-law and we both enjoyed our accommodations. Although the rooms may be preceived to be small, the space is so well used and very nicely decorated. COMFORATBLE beds - I slept so good! We really liked the this 'smaller' hotel (compared to something like a much larger hotel on Michigan Avenue). Service was much more personal. After a show one night, we came back and had not had dinner, so sat at the bar and had dinner there. The bartender - Will - was very knowledgable about the menu. We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner and time at the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Booking with priceline”
Reviews.Author: momof2Indiana
Reviews.Content: I booked through priceline and according to the reviews I found here, I was to contact the hotel to book a room with 2 beds as priceline only will reserve a queen bed. I contacted Kathy at Hotel Felix and requested two double beds as there will be four of us, she didn't even check to see if available for this Thursday, instead she said since you booked with priceline you will only have a queen I can put a request in for 2 doubles but you won't know until you get here. Please tell me why can't she reserve it for us if she sees it is available, instead we have to drive to Chicago and walk in with our two children to find out if we can stay. If you face this same issue, don't bother calling Priceline as they will not be of any help, nor will they change your reservation for another hotel. I will never book with Priceline again, maybe I will have better luck with Hotwire. Why would Priceline give the option of a hotel with very few double bed rooms?

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Friendly Service, Not-Pretentious”
Reviews.Author: Mike T
Reviews.Content: I'm a young guy so I didn't want to stay at a 4-star hotel that was too pretentious such as the Palomar or the other ones. Something about this hotel, its very modern, very hip place to stay. Rooms were quiet, but tad small like everyone says. If you don't plan on using the desk, dont need a giant sofa and closet, dont need a mini bar, this room is all you really need. 4-star hotel at a reasonable price!! Pros: - H20 Brand Bath Products! - Front Doormen, staff, maids all ridiciusouly friendly. One maid sprinted in front of me to get me more bath products LOL - Comfortable bed! - Plasma TV with lots of channels! Cons: - No Mini Bar (I never use them anyways) - Small Rooms (I only plan on sleeping anyways) - Shower water pressure was a tad weak Overall, I'll stay again for value, upscaleness and it has everything I need. Dont forget, great location in the middle of all the great dining and Michigan shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: CWTraveler88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Felix for a wedding in Chicago. We loved this place. The lobby/bar is very trendy looking. It's in a great area of Chicago. We walked almost everywhere or took the subway very easily. Our room was beautiful, slightly small, but really nice. They provide you with a comfy, fun robe. We ordered room service our first night there. The food was okay, but room service was a really special treat. The staff was incredibly responsive and great at responding to all our queries for directions, extras, or wedding details.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katherine S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Felix last week for our 23rd anniversary. The hotel was very COOLl and comfortable. The staff from the housekeeping to the G.M. were exceptional. The lobby bar makes a great martini.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: PeterV00 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel which were a nice retreat after sightseeing in the heat. The loaction is quite good. Close to the subway and a great place to start a shopping trip om the mile. Also a good amount of restaurants and bars near by. Never tried much of the amneties but the room was really nice and with free wifi. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking service”
Reviews.Author: MBMT2003
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Felix on three occasions this year. The rooms are small, pretty basic, but clean. My most recent booking was for four nights. On my first night a woman was murdered in the hotel. While this is clearly neither the hotel's fault or responsibility, As a female travelling alone I did expect some communication on the subject from hotel staff. I thought the general manager might leave a note in guests rooms, or the reception staff may have reassured guests when passing through the lobby. But no, the silence on the subject was deafening. Furthermore, on checking out the receptionist did not speak to me except to confirm my debit card. She passed me my bill and said "Here you go." I politely asked her what she meant, and she said "You're done here." And that was it. The service has declined over the course of this year, but the dismissiveness of the staff is now breathtaking. I shan't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate ... you get as advertised. Marathoners FYI.”
Reviews.Author: eddiemac1
Reviews.Content: Location: - North river district, 5-6 blocks west of Magnificent mile for the shoppers. - short cab rides to almost anywhere in Chicago downtown ie boat tours. - walkable to most places. Rooms: - Small and cozy. Not alot of room. - Bathrooms were ample. - Tiny closet space. - Good for couples not great for families. - great little high powered dryer for the ladies. - NOISE FACTOR: can hear sirens quite clearly at all hours as well as revving motorcycles. Service: - given 2 beds, asked for a king bed and they accomodated. - no issues what so ever. everyone seemed quite pleasant and accomodating. Marathoners: - No early breakfast or even continental self serve on morning of run. - No shuttle to start. - If looking for a soak after the race. ice bath or warm, NO TUBS in rooms. No major complaints and decent price via priceline. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Customer Service, Friendly, great location...”
Reviews.Author: TCsftravels
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the customer service, all employees were extremely helpful. Julian, the doorman was an expert of the Chicago area and always pointed us in the right direction with many suggestions of activities. The front desk clerk the night of our check-in must have answered 10 calls from us before our arrival, we were lost, and not once did he sound frustrated, he was very welcoming when we finally did arrive. Rooms are definitely smaller than most, however I did expect this upon booking as I had read numerous reviews online. The bed and pillows are definitely one of the best I have slept in while traveling. I loved the decor of the building, very trendy! Thanks for making our visit to Chicago memorable! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robink34
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel and requested double beds and when i went to check in no double beds. A queen room is way too small for a cot even. The hotel staff was unaccomidating in every way possible and not friendly at all. When you call the hotel the staff is not even pleasant. This is a stuck up hotel and it is not all that by any means. PLEANTY of other FABULOUS boutique Hotels near by for great prices!! THINK TWICE before you book!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: nrosin
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice. Yes, they are smaller than the typical hotel room. But the beds were heavenly comfortable. Clean! Great location - 5 blocks from Michigan Ave. Easy walk from the Blue Line which took us from O'Hare to the city. Much cheaper than a cab and convenient. Whole Foods is practically across the street. Hotel staff was super pleasant. The bath products are wonderful! The windows open to let in fresh air. We enjoyed our stay and didn't mind the small rooms - there's an entire city to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, Clean, Cramped and Uncaring”
Reviews.Author: niluht
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix property is a very nice, cute boutique hotel, and its style is very consistant and clean throughout the property. Aside from the very small rooms, the decor of the hotel is very contemporary yet warm, and if you don't plan on staying in your room for very long, you shouldn't miss the space. Basically, it's a very cosy place to crash, but you may go mad if you stay in the room for any length of time. The services in the hotel were about average. A receptionist greeted me when I first entered the hotel, but there were several times when I walked into the building or went downstairs to find nobody at the front desk, yet within 20 minutes I would see three people standing there waiting for something to do. Upon check-in I requested a room with two beds to replace the single full bed (I was expecting at least a single queen in a luxury boutique hotel), and I was placed on a "wait list" for Sunday evening when several rooms opened up. This request never materialized and the list never really existed. It was unfortunate, but not the end of the world. Sleep quality was very nice--Hotel Felix's beds rank up there with the W, Westin, and the higher-end Marriott hotels, but the standard single bed is only a queen. Again, not the end of the world, but I was definitely expecting a queen or king-sized bed for the price. The A/C was very, very loud, and it would turn on and off frequently--literally within a minute of turning on, it would turn off, then back on, and this repeated over and over. At one point it sounded like an Australian didgeridoo, so that might help you or it might drive you crazy--either way, the A/C was loud. The rooms were very clean--the white sheets looked brand new and the white surfaces throughout the room were immaculate. This may be due to the fact that the rooms were so small that they were easy to clean, but the rooms were very clean at check-in. However, we had a qualm we had was with the shower and its curtain. The standing shower reminded me of a dorm room shower--very plain and plastic--the curtain barely reached the ground, and it wasn't wide enough for the shower; so water splattered all over the bathroom with every use. Wall, door and the and floor were covered with water, so things were slippery and we needed extra towels to wipe the place down after use. The very odd design is mentioned by other reviewers, so you would think they would fix this (especially with the "eco-friendly" motif they market). The location was relative to your needs in the city. We were a few blocks from the Brown/Red CTA lines and Michigan Avenue was just a few blocks away, which came in handy when we wanted to go north to Old Town and Lincoln Park or to go shopping. The hotel feels a little off the beaten path, but it was also very quiet at night and still near many great local restaurants, bars and other hotspots. The blue line train was a several-block hike, so if you prefer to use mass transit to and from O'Hare (to maintain the eco-friendly motif), you'll also burn several extra calories lugging your baggage up and down the street. Other notes: housekeeping left our room open with the security bar propping it open until we returned home one evening. The front desk offered 30 dollars in food credit at the hotel restaurant, Elate (where entrees start at 20 dollars a plate), so we opted for breakfast and went about 3 dollars over the credit. Still, after requesting a call from a manager, I received nothing, and there was no one available to talk to at check-out. Late check-out was set for 1 pm and they wouldn't budge--Starwood properties generally offers 3pm checkouts for guests. Again, I would expect this out of a motel or lower-end hotel, but generally nicer properties bend over backwards for guests. Our experience was that of a cheap chain hotel rather than an "eco-friendly luxury boutique"

Reviews.Title: “We should have stayed home”
Reviews.Author: Maureen T
Reviews.Content: We checked in to a room that was "maybe" 100 square feet with one full size bed...for my husband, myself and my teen daughter. When I was told the hotel was "100% booked" and nothing else was available, I tried to make it work by asking for a cot of some type for our daughter. They also had no cots, but offered us bedding so she could "sleep on the floor". Really? For $200 a night? I had to have Priceline intercede as I had booked through Priceline. Guess what: a room with two beds suddenly appeared out of thin air! The room we ended up with was very loud, half the size of comparable rooms in the Chicago market, no mini-bar, no bathtub, a closet that was a cut-out into the wall with no door and a vanity space which consisted of the top of the toilet and a small shelving unit. By the way, shame on Priceline.....this is what qualifies as a top 4 star rating in their system.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bhavana_praveen
Reviews.Content: We visited in the month of sept.....the hotel rooms are small but neat, the hotel is centrally located.....but there was one problem just be careful when you are making a cash advance deposit instead of credit card .....while checking out they might run out of cash and your account will be credited only after a month....

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: norabegood1
Reviews.Content: We loved the Felix. It was our second stay with an online special (Hotwire) and is so worth it! Great location, walking distance to many places. Portillos hot dogs is right around the corner. Rooms are on the small side, but who goes to Chi-town to stay in the room? Great service, really clean. Park across the street at the garage (about $22/day). Weate at a great tapa's bar about 2 blocks away (see review). Get a bus pass at the Walgreens one block down and ride for three days for about $5...forget the car...parking is madness. We also had Guardinos (?) pizza direct delivered to the room....wow, best pizza in chicago so far!

Reviews.Title: “Spa-Like Vibe, VERY small rooms”
Reviews.Author: khardst
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felix is a small eco-friendly boutique hotel with a relaxing, spa-like vibe to it. If you stay there and you like vodka, you're in luck!! The Felix is across the street from EFFEN Vodka. The views from the rooms are the breathtaking, but the rooms are exceptionally small, as are the bathrooms. Also, we could never get the air quite right, it was either hot or cold, not comfortable. A major thumbs up for the hotel besides their service is the fact that they offer FREE, I said FREE internet service and the bath products they offer are heavenly!! The restaurant within the hotel is Elate Restaurant. In my opinion, they are pretty expensive. My friend and I had two burgers with fries and about 3 glasses of wine each and the bill was $125.00. We also had breakfast there one morning and it was good as were the burgers we had the night before. I would suggest the Hotel Felix for a short stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great price with a Priceline bid”
Reviews.Author: JensNeenah_WI
Reviews.Content: I bid on 4 star hotels at Priceline and got Hotel Felix for $70 ($88 w tax). My friend and I were happy with what we got. I called the hotel directly to request two beds since Priceline books 1 queen. They said they would have to see the bed situation that day but we ended up with 2 doubles in the corner overlooking Huron. Great room and it was a little bigger than the room right next to ours that had a single king. So, make sure you call and request two doubles if you want more room. Parking--valet parking is expensive. Right across the street, you can park (store) your car for $23 for 24 hours. This is not in and out service. We took the taxi to Navy Pier which cost $20 round trip w/tip. Since it was a corner room, there were windows on two walls. Very nice curtains covered these two walls and darkened the light in the morning. Some street noise but I wear earplugs so didn't notice at all. My friend wasn't bothered by the noise. I also kept the fan for the AC on continuous so it would help with the noise. The beds were double sheeted, soft and comfortable. The bathroom was plenty big--all in one room vs. sink outside. Modern, great tile in the shower. Could do with having a deeper sink although it was cool to look at. The closet space was minimal. It fit a small suitcase once the ironing board was moved out. Friend put her stuff under the desk. If you are staying longer, you can put your things in the bed frame drawers, but you still have do something with the suitcases. Everything was very clean. The lobby is small but very cool with a 10 seat bar in the corner. Free coffee and tea in the morning. Computer area is one level up and was fine when we were researching things to do. Staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: DSMtravel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felix is well appointed. The lobby features an intimate bar and an adjacent convenient restaurant. The rooms are small as was our bathroom, but the bed was comfortable and the room was very quiet. The $32 per day for self parking seemed reasonable to me for downtown Chicago, and the staff is very pleasant. I was sorry to find that the tv had no pbs channel, and substituted the NHK world channel on the pbs channel slot. That was a big disappointment for our tv watching. The wifi is free and strong. The hotel is located in River North with lots of close restaurants and Michigan Ave. is not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Louise34731
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Bears/Packers game. We had two rooms booked but one was not ready when we arrived so we waited in the bar area. Small but comfy bar located on one side of the lobby. Drinks were good but some bar snacks would have been nice. We sat at one of the little tables so maybe they would have been available had we sat directly at the bar but it was full. About a half hour later, Phillip, who checked us in come over to let us know that the room still wasn't ready but bought us a drink which was very nice. Phillip was also very professional, courteous and could not have made us feel more welcome. As noted in other reviews, the rooms really are small. Take that part seriously. And the bathrooms are small too with a small sink and no counterspace. So, if you're like me and have a lot of stuff too spread out you'll need to make adjustments. It really wasn't all that bad. The room made up for itself by being very, very clean. As this is Chicago and there is tons to do we were only in our rooms to sleep. Kudos to Charles, the incredibly gracious doorman with a remarkable sense of humor, who shared his burger from 25 Degrees when we got back late one night. The burger was awesome by the way so give the restaurant a try. (Also we went to Zed451 across the street from 25 Degrees - very cool vibe, great drinks, delicious food) Overall, we will definitely stay again. Our friend booked our rooms on hotwire so we had a great deal but I wouldn't mind spending more to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: BeyondScrapple
Reviews.Content: One night stay recently. Front desk service was attentive, quick and thorough. Rooms were much smaller than conventional hotels, but quite comfortable. Free wifi. Pleasant European design. Clean and quiet. Windows opened, which is a plus in my book. Small workout room with only three treadmills, two ellipticals and some dumbbells. Overall, a good stay at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Did you hear? Rooms are small.”
Reviews.Author: Jenn M
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed at Felix, and excellent stay both visits. Husband and I used priceline first visit, and booked ourselves second. Location for us can't be beat. Next to clark Street Ale House, 25 degrees. Easy walk to Michigan, Lake Shore Drive. Rooms are tiny, great, comfey bed, nice amenities. Elate Restaurant is wonderful, nice wine selection, excellent happy hour. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: Koter
Reviews.Content: This was hotel was nice, relatively clean and in a pretty good location. There was nothing spectacular at all, but nothing at all disappointing either. Service was fine, room was fine, internet was free, the gym had everything I needed for a 2 night stay. The walk to Michigan Ave was 5 minutes and the taxi to Wrigleville was a $10-15. I would say it was a little pricey for what they offered. Not bad, not great.

Reviews.Title: “Very hip boutique hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Spartyhomer
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our recent two night stay experience at the Hotel Felix. The hotel sits in a great location in the River North/Near North area. Our room was very nicely furnished with the latest cutting edge decorum, including suitable creature comforts and amenities - such as a very comfortable bed. We also enjoyed the fun bar downstairs that featured a good DJ spinning discs - with nice wines available by the glass and also a good drink menu. The only real drawbacks to the hotel (typical of many boutiques) is that our room (including the closet) was extremely small. Furthermore, there were no minibars or refrigerators in our room. Such would be helpful to add for guests. Finally, when we called downstairs to request the front desk to print our boarding pass whn checking out, the desk clerk said they were all too "busy", and somewhat abruptly said we should "handle it ourselves" in the lobby area at a computer terminal. When we arrived downstairs a few minutes later to check out and also print our boarding pass, we saw three people at the front desk - and none looked particularly busy! Odd, but didn't spoil our overall perception of the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great performance”
Reviews.Author: BuffCrone
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Felix three times, when the price is right. I prefer the Dana, which is around the corner, on a number of levels. Nicer rooms, better views, better service. For this visit the service at the Felix reached a new low. I called the day before to let them know that I would be arriving late, and was transferred 3 times from reservations (not at the hotel) to the front desk, back to reservations, and back to the hotel. Finally the desk clerk said he would make a handwritten note! Not reassuring. When I finally got into the room, it was not ready for prime time. There were no hangers, nor glasses, nor any stopper in the sink. The bedside lamp was bolted to the wall at 10Âº off plumb. The pillows were old and lumpy. After multiple calls, we did get a sink drain, hangers, and two dirty glasses that we had to wash to use! Never got better pillows. The rest of the room was fine, although the window looked out directly into another building under construction, so close we could have touched it. We also ate breakfast in the cafe. They were out of several dishes. The coffee was delicious, and so was some of the food, but the rest was cold. I guess they do not give Hotels.com guests their best rooms OR their best service. I won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: SANsna
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel when I come to Chicago for business. Before finding this hotel, I usually stay at the Comfort Inn on Ohio St. However, I have come to love this hotel because I like its character and it is also closer to my office. The rooms are definitely small by American standards. However, having traveled all over Europe and Asia, I really thought it was fine. It wasn't as small as the rooms I got in Japan. I am a smaller person so maybe it doesn't bother me as much. However, rooms look great, very clean, and the amenities look modern and works well. I really enjoy the rooms that I have gotten there so far. Service is somewhat hit or miss. Most of the time, I get great service. Sometimes, I get a person that seems a bit impersonal. I don't usually require much in terms of service but when I do, the staff at Hotel Felix has been helpful. In terms of location, it works great for me. If you arrive late, there is a good pub (Kerryman) close by. You just cross the street for a beer and chicken curry. That usually gets me through until the next day. It is also close to the hard rock and more importantly, it is just 6 blocks from one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago, Xoco. Runned by Top Chef Masters, Rick Bayliss, Xoco is his "value" restaurant. If you want to try his other higher end restaurants, they are next to each other. I think that there are probably better hotels in Chicago but I don't think Hotel Felix should be ranked as low as it is now. It is a great value hotel in Chicago for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag!”
Reviews.Author: kimmac56
Reviews.Content: Great central location with good access to restaurants and shopping, BUT ,very small rooms, post rationalised as eco-friendly! thus relatively expensive

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: casszilla
Reviews.Content: Ended up at Hotel Felix on a last minute booking. Rooms are small yes but are in great shape, love the bedding and the shower. No complaints about anything. The bellmen outside were always friendly, when exiting a taxi they always asked us to check and make sure we had all of our belongings. The hotel bar is nice and cozy, only 2 beers on tap but it allowed us to try new things. The resturant next door has some decent night life and the food was great!

Reviews.Title: “excellent eco-friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: leif_erikson
Reviews.Content: On travel for business, changed to hotel felix last minute due to reports of bedbugs in our previously booked hotel (looked up on bedbugregistry.com). hotel felix was great - clean, great location, friendly service. the room wasn't small, for chicago. we had a toddler and asked for a tub, so the bathroom was actually quite spacious. no mini-fridge, but the hotel staff was willing to keep some leftovers for us in the fridge at the front desk - however, they refused to heat up the food (pizza) in their microwave, so our toddler couldn't eat it. otherwise, service was great. bed was comfortable. we were there for business so we did use the valet service, which was great for our needs, but would be prohibitively expensive (though comparable to all of downtown chicago) otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago boutique hotel conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: WiscTraveler078
Reviews.Content: We bid for a downtown Chicago hotel and were awarded the Hotel Felix. Located 5 blocks off of Michigan Ave. We were pleasantly surprised with a fully renovated boutique hotel in a nice location. No parking garage closeby that I could see, so take advantage of valet parking at $42 per night with in and out privileges. The rooms are small as everyone had previously stated, think cruise ship cabin size, NO, think dorm room size. But ,it had everything necessary and all was modern, clean, and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and efficient. I would recommend the Hotel Felix, maybe not at the full rack rate, but if you can get it at a discount, a good choice for a downtown Chicago hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: retuga03
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here. I didn't find the rooms to be too small at all. The bed was incredibly comfortable, the shower was a nice size, and my view from the 11th floor was awesome. The toiletries were very nice and I loved the fact that the trash cans were divided for recyclables and non. It was definitely close enough to downtown and the river so that you could choose to walk or take the Red Line. The proximity to Lincoln Park and the neighborhoods to the north were also easily accessible by foot or the Brown Line.

Reviews.Title: “Garfield has returned”
Reviews.Author: farm2fork
Reviews.Content: Nine months after our initial visit to Hotel Felix we returned for a last minute weekend in Chicago. On our first visit we loved the location and amenities of the hotel but criticized the size of the rooms. During these 9 months our memories of Hotel Felix were fond. While planning our last minute trip we decided to take George up on his offer to make our next stay at Hotel Felix comfortable and they did not disappoint. The wonderful smell of the lobby remained as soon as we entered the door. As we made our way to our room we wondered what it would look like compared to our previous stay and we were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room for our second stay. The bigger room was nice, but everything about the stay and hotel was wonderful and we would recommend staying at the Felix and likely will return many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel has great staff, quiet, clean, great location, beds are to die for.”
Reviews.Author: jimtippy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from September 6 thru September 9 2011. The room was not small I stayed in room 704 great view, quiet, very clean, great service. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The elate restaurant next door had great food and good prices. If you're going to Chicago and need to stay near downtown this is the place. Four blocks from Michigan ave very nice and trendy area where hotel is located. Whole food store a block away for snacks or food items. The hotel is new clean and great value. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: lake b
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Felix for 3 nights with my boyfriend and I was so positively impressed. Hotel Felix is surely an excellent place to stay, with hight standard of customer service. Beautiful rooms, very clean, cosy and confortable. Elegant common spaces. We recommend the nearby restaurant Elate, kind of expensive but gorgeous food. Rates are not cheap but you could find good offers on the hotel web sites.

Reviews.Title: “Not again...”
Reviews.Author: Gera_14_11
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel through Priceline and stayed 3 nights. We were given given a room with no view at all. No other room available..., at check-in at 4.30? Next to our window was a building with cloths around it. From Europe, first time Chicago, you may expect a better introduction, I guess...
