After a long flight and with having a jet-lag this was quite a bummer. Together with the fact that the room was so small you had quite a "locked up" feeling... At the whole I expect more of a 4-star hotel. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Right smack in the middle!”
Reviews.Author: LatinaGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felix has a European flair & is right smack in the middle of every point of interest. There is free wi-fi internet connection. We didn't hit the bar but the lounge are, albeit small, is darling & appealing. Keep your music down 'cause the walls are relatively thin (or our music was just too bloody loud) & you will get a "keep it down" call from the front desk. You can easily get to the hotel from ORD via shuttle or train. If you fancy visiting an original prohition era speak easy, exit the hotel, take a left walk down about 10 minutes & voila! The Green Door Tavern @ Huron Street. We would stay here again. Clean, very clean & comfortable mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: Staff is great, restaurant was great but the rooms are okay. Rooms were small. There is a lot of competition in Chicago and I had not stayed here before so I gave it a shot. That said, I won't be back, not because they were a bad hotel, I simply feel there is rooms out there that offer more than the Hotel Felix

Reviews.Title: “Location and gym are two of the best features”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night and was quite happy with our experience. The location and gym was worth the price that we paid. Pros -The gym had state-of-the-art treadmills and ellipticals, a bench, and a full dumbbell set up to 50lbs -Great location near the Magnificant Mile -Flat screen tv Cons -The room was small! the queen size bed took up 80% of the space and the closet was barely big enough to hold a garment bag. We might have been in a corner room, though, so this may have been an atypical configuration. -No coffeemaker

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful decor”
Reviews.Author: Fox_and_Anchor
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby and room were very lovely -- tasteful and contemporary without being too austere. It was also really convenient to be close to Whole Foods to buy snacks and wine. (You can see Whole Foods from the hotel's front door.) However, the location wasn't ideal for sightseeing and the lobby is very small. (Also, the neon light from the Hard Rock Cafe's guitar shined in my window.) I'd definitely stay here again if the price was right (going in the dead of winter usually means prices are lower). But, I would not recommend staying here if it is your first time in Chicago since you're somewhat removed from the sites and you probably won't get a real taste of the city. However, if you're comfortable with the transit system and are looking for a beautiful, modern hotel, this might be a great fit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: Chas1979
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice experience at this hotel. Yes the rooms are small like some other reviewers have said, but you get that with any older hotel building in the city. The lobby and rooms were beautiful. The only thing I didn't love was the location. It is at least 6 blocks from the subway, and Michigan ave busses. After doing a 4 hour walking tour of the city, I didn't like having to walk over 1/2 a mile back to the hotel. Otherwise a great hotel. Also, I think I fell in love with the doormen there! They were soooo friendly and welcoming everytime. Nicest and most helpful ones I have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Small but cozy. Great food.”
Reviews.Author: annabanana1
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Chicago staying at the Hotel Felix. If you're going to Chicago for pleasure then location is key! Hotel Felix is on Huron and LaSalle (3-4 blocks from Mag Mile). If you like Portillo's the Felix is almost just steps away. The rooms at the Felux are very compact but incredibly efficient. If you appreciate good design you will appreciate the layout and unique solutions in the rooms. We had a corner room with two double beds and were very comfortable. The beds are very soft which was great for me (I have severe rheumatoid arthritis) but yet the bed had enough support for my husband. The large windows in our room could be opened and it was nice to have fresh summer breezes coming in! There are black out draperies that help late sleepers and muffle street sounds. The bathroom was again compact yet efficient and very nice. The decor is s bit more contemporary but not cold. If you appreciate Eco-conscious hotels the Felix is the first LEEDS certified hotel and offer Eco-friendly options for customers as well as organic food. If you drive a hybrid vehicle you'll get a discount on parking with the hotel. Speaking of parking valet is $42/day with in and out privileges. The price is pretty standard for Chicago but you can save money by parking in a nearby ramp for $35/day. The people are friendly at Hotel Felix and I feel there is a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Felix, not a GREAT, but a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: alexmoral
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Chicago for a few days and we had the opportunity to stay at the Hotel Felix. IMO the hotel is located in a neighborhood which is fairly close, not next , to well known attractions such as the NAVY pier, the Magnificent mile, Millennium Parkâ€¦etc. The hotel itself is small, very clean, modern, cozy, and decent for the price. Rooms are super-duper small, I mean SMALL. There is no closet in which to put your clothing. You must hang your clothes in a small space provided to do that, only protected by a curtain. Tthe room has a safe box, a 42 inch flat screen TV, clock radio. No cofee maker in the room. The bathroom is also small, however; compared to the room, its size is not too bad. Imagine if you could fit the bathroom in the actual room, it would fit only about four times, that is how small the rooms are. There is about three to four feet MAX, between the bed and the walls on either side of the room, that is it. Toiletries are H2O products. Beds are comfortable, but the pillows are HORRIBLE, small and uneven. I advise you to travel with your own pillow from home, if neck pain is something you don't want to deal with during your vacation. Staff are nice and extremely helpful . If you need a taxi or directions to go to places, they are happy to help. Complimentary coffee is provided in the mornings. After a certain time they do not refill the kettles. So make sure you go early. There is a small bar in the lobby that serves drinks until about midnight or a bit later, however if you are still thirsty for more, there is a bar across the street from the hotel which is open until later. Parking!!!a luxury in the city of Chicago. The hotel charges $45.00 for parking per night, with in and out privileges, something no too many parking places offer in the city. There is a parking lot one block west of the hotel and it is possible to park there for $12.00 all day, no in and out, though. No car is needed in the city, there are plenty of cabs, and the public transportation is excellent . The hotel has a restaurant on the first floor called " Elate" that serves nice food, and drinks, as well as night activities such as Jazz on Saturday nights. It is on the expensive side, but worth to try. Food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: newbeeSTL
Reviews.Content: 6 of us went here on our recent trip to Chicago staying in 3 different rooms. Got the rooms super cheap on Priceline. The hotel is in a very good location, a quick look up on the address would show that though so I won't go on and on. Very clean rooms and the staff are very friendly. I thought the bed was very comfortable as well. WIFI was slow at times, but fast at others, probably just depended on who else was using it. Warning, the rooms are VERY small. If all you want to do is sleep, and get ready to go out, you will have enough room. If you want to have a party in your room, it won't work (too small). TV was nice and lots of channels to choose from, but let's face it, I didn't go to Chicago to sit in my room. If you stay here, I strongly suggest you eat at Portillo's and Eggsperience at least once each. Both places are very close and very good!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...”
Reviews.Author: jls_spice
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Everything is clean and comfortable and the people are very nice. Did I mention the free hybrid parking? That's just a cherry on top of a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice place and cheaper than most other 4-stars downtown!!”
Reviews.Author: Docwiley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved it! The room was small but we weren't in there much. One of the best mattresses I've ever slept on!! We were on the 3rd floor and heard NO street noise. Nice updates!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again.”
Reviews.Author: TW0569
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, but very nice. Modern furnishings & fixtures, very clean, & the mattress was SO comfortable!!! I wish we had one like that! I appreciated all the niceties like the bathrobe, q-tips, & good quality toiletry items that were provided. The staff were very friendly & professional too.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Joann098
Reviews.Content: The customer service at the hotel was terrible. My husband scheduled the hotel for me and when I got to the hotel I was told that my name wasn't added to the reservation and I cannot check into the hotel. I said that I have the same last name and address as my husband and I was told that because of the security reasons I cannot check in until my husband adds my name to the reservation. I called my husband to ask him to call the hotel. I was sitting in the lobby and waiting for the front desk clerk to let me know that I can check in, after my husband made the phone call. I text my husband to ask if he already called and he said that he did about 10 minutes earlier. After that I went to the front desk to ask if I can check in now and I was unkindly told "yes". My husband was scheduling hotels for me many times and no one ever told me that I am not on the reservation. The same last name and address isn't enough?! The room that I got was the smallest room that I ever stayed at. The air-conditioning was super loud the entire night. The hotel is located about 10 blocks from Michigan Ave and the area around the hotel is very scary. Be sure to take a cab at night!!! You save few bucks on the location but you would need to spend more on a cab. Next morning I wasnâ€™t able to reached the valet at the phone number that I was provided with my ticket. Finally, I called the front desk and someone told me that they would reach the valet for me. When I got downstairs, my car was parked unattended with the engine running at the front of the hotel!!! No one was there to help me with my luggage!!! I cannot believe that the hotel is advertises as a 4 star hotel. Obviously, it is not a 4 star hotel. I think that this is 2 star hotel advertising as 4 star..

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations - Staff was great!”
Reviews.Author: 440Washington
Reviews.Content: We purchased our stay through price line.."name your price." After accepting our bid I was a little leary after reading reviews, but I have to say this hotel exceeded our expectations. When we arrived we were greeted by very friendly staff. Check-in went very smooth and quick. I asked if they had a king room available as I heard these rooms were bigger. The staff member said no they did not have one available today, but they did have one available for the rest of our stay. He made a note and we were moved the next day. The fact he offered this was great! He could have just left it at "no availability." Our 1st room was small, but very nice. Our 2nd room was wonderful because of the added space. The hotel staff recommended some great resturants..perfect for what we were looking for. All in all, I was very impressed with the hotel and staff. I will recommend Hotel Felix to others and I would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “So Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: honeycomb2525
Reviews.Content: The place was amazing! You walked in and there was a fireplace to your left. It had an amazing Spa service. Before your massage they have you soak your feet in a warm bath of salts and then they massage your feet and then they give you your whole body massage. The bar/restuarant is very romantic feeling with a delicious selection of foods. The beds were so comfortable that you melt in them. And compliments of H2O bath supplies in the bathroom. YUM! That was the first time I tried that brand and I am absolutely hooked on it now. I buy that product every year I visit Chicago. Hotel Felix is a newer hotel couple blocks off of Michigan Avenue and the staff there treats you like royalty. I would definitley recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good buy!”
Reviews.Author: whyland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to see what a guest survey 5 out of 5 would be like. Well, the rooms are tiny, the coffee is not good, the sink didn't drain and wasn't fixed after reporting to housekeeping, the bartender was more interested in hitting on a customer than serving us and we should not have accepted the recommendation from the booking agent.

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable and adorable stay!”
Reviews.Author: taiwaneseshorti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely one I'd love to come back to! A friend and I were looking for somewhere in the city to stay and booked it through priceline.com, so the cost wasn't incredibly high for the 3 night day. The lobby was gorgeous to say the least, and the room was ensured to be pristine day after day. The staff is truly one of the best I've ever seen. Not only are they incredibly friendly, they're also extremely knowledgeable in nearby attractions and are quick in helping you find exactly where you need to be. They're also willing to help 24/7 (literally, since I asked them for some extra pillows/blankets at 1am)! Keep in mind this is a boutique hotel. The rooms, bathrooms and even elevators are considerably smaller than those of standard hotels. BUT THE SLEEK, MODERN DECOR MAKES UP FOR IT (in my opinion). Overall, RECOMMEND! Great location, great staff, happy stay!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, far from Michigan ave.”
Reviews.Author: Plnbgr
Reviews.Content: These rooms are so small you can barely move!!!! Also, very far from Michigan avenue. We have stayed in Chicago numerous times, by far the worst experience.

Reviews.Title: “Small, stylish and well placed.”
Reviews.Author: lonestaradvisor
Reviews.Content: In a great location, the Hotel Felix is a stylish boutique hotel with a great restaurant, comfortable bar and friendly staff. The rooms are small but well laid out and stylishly appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Like Going Back In Time...And Not In A Good Way.”
Reviews.Author: jazzbeezy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a business trip after moving from another hotel. And was totally bummed out. The rooms are small - very small. The whole place feels like an old Holiday Inn or old Hilton that was redesigned to look modern. Lipstick on a pig, etc. It's not modern, it's not a boutique. The whole thing - from the lobby that feels like an office building, to the hallways to the elevator to the splotches of paint on the wall - just feels off. Maybe if you're a tourist who doesn't know any better, this will seem super posh to you. But it's not. The WIFI is free but deathly slow. It took about 20 minutes to load up a 5-minute video on YouTube. Overnight parking is $42! (However, it's free if you drive a hybrid - that's pretty cool). The positives: friendly staff and central location. But I really don't see how they can justify charging $300/night for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise in Chicago"”
Reviews.Author: maltafaz
Reviews.Content: Looking for a different place to stay while on business and also, looking for a better daily rate in Downtown Chicago, we came across the Felix. It had been recently remodeled and was tastefully decorated and had a modern flair. The room was comfortable, although very small with a small closet. The bed was comfortable, bathroom well appointed, and the workout room was more than adequate. I liked where the hotel was located, close to many good places to eat and visit, but off the busy Michigan Avenue scene. I liked the service at the Felix and the business center was very good. My only criticism of the Felix was the small size of the room I had. However, I liked the hotel and would return. It is a teriffic value and beautiful to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel bad priceline”
Reviews.Author: jack65_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 children were here in July for 2 nights. Pricelined a Room and then read reviews. Drove here from Pa to attend sonâ€™s event at Great Lakes and did bring sleeping bags (thanks Trip Advisor) based on what I read. We did call to ask for two beds, but were told, they could not, at least for Sat night. The location is great. We walked everywhere, and were very impressed by the neighborhood. There are many eateries and fun bars within walking distance. After the first night (daughter slept on the sleeping bags on the floor) we were upgraded to two beds, and the beds were great. This hotel is a very good hotel for two, and my wife and I would book again, if it is just the two of us. I do have a large problem with Priceline and the fact you canâ€™t ask for two beds, and must hold the hotel at least partially responsible for involvement with Priceline. If going to on trip with Children, to any major city, and using Priceline not recommended, or at least not if looking for 4 star hotel. 3/12 gets you a major chain and 2 beds. Donâ€™t upgrade Again if going with a partner, and you get the Felix, you got a very good hotel, and should enjoy this chic, hotel,in hip urban surroundings TIP Park across the street on Clark St, while they are tiny spaces, they are most convenient to the hotel, and the price is very good for a major city

Reviews.Title: “Chic Boutique Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Geetie
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felix is a totally renovated hotel located in a wonderful neighbourhood. Rooms are rather small as are bathrooms. Lovely amenities and first class restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Chicago & Best Beds in the World!”
Reviews.Author: BigTexasFamily
Reviews.Content: Just like everyone else, I booked the Hotel Felix via Priceline. Just like everyone else, I immediately consulted Trip Advisor to research the hotel. Obviously, I was concerned by the mixed/negative reviews, but once you hit â€œBidâ€� on Priceline, there is no going back! I bid $105 per night for 2 weekday nights. Let me tell you that I could not have been more satisfied with the Hotel Felix! It was perfect for my wife and me. Sure the rooms are not â€œlargeâ€�, but they are also not â€œtinyâ€�. Itâ€™s NOT like itâ€™s a cruise ship room for crying out loud! Itâ€™s a smallish, but very functional hotel room. I would have killed for this room last time I was in New York City! The real reason that this hotel gets a bad rap is the fact that â€œlow-ballâ€� bidders think that they are going to find a room smack dab in the middle of Michigan Ave. for $75 to $100. Well guess what, it isnâ€™t going to happen! The Hotel Felix is 5 blocks off of Michigan Ave. Once bidders realize this, they begin to pout and blame Priceline. They secretly wish that they had made a higher bid. Pricelineâ€™s maps are not misleading. Deal with it! That is the gamble you take for playing this game. In the last year alone, I have stayed at the Four Seasons Maui, the Ritz Carlton Naples (Florida), and many quality hotels in between. Without question, the Hotel Felix has the best bed! Hands down! Pros: 1) Bed â€“ Best hotel bed in the world! 2) Free WiFi. 3) Free Exercise Room (Small, but very efficient). 4) TV â€“ Best HD reception I have seen lately. 5) Free Coffee in the mornings. 6) Neighborhood â€“ Clean, safe and quiet. 7) Staff â€“ Helpful and friendly. 8) Location â€“ 5 minute (or less) walk to Michigan Ave. 9) Shower â€“ Big with plenty of hot water! 10) Tons of excellent restaurants nearby. Cons: 1) Could use more counter space in the bathroom. Donâ€™t be scared of the Hotel Felix! Give it a shot! Remember how little money you paid to stay there! All will be well!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieNewBoston
Reviews.Content: This is a smaller boutique-type hotel which has a truly relaxing atmosphere from the moment the doorman opens the door! The smaller lobby is done in relaxing colors and aromatherapy scents fill the air along with the waterfall. The staff are all very accommodating and friendly and happy to tend to any needs. Complimentary coffee and exotic tea in the lobby at the bar in the morning. The rooms are on the smaller side but very comfortable and clean. Wonderful bath products! The hotel is approximately 4-5 short blocks off of Michigan, kind of parallel with the Water Tower area. A very safe walk. There is an awesome restaurant located on the next block called Orange. Very good for breakfast or lunch. I love staying at this hotel. The rooms are very soundproof and I always sleep well and feel relaxed after a hectic day of shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms But Nice”
Reviews.Author: cross_checked23
Reviews.Content: As others have done on this forum, we acquired our reservations through Priceline. Like many others, we also had small rooms. It wasn't a big deal for us on this trip with just two of us (per room) and very little time to spend in the rooms during this one night stay. The positives: We got there an hour before check-in but they had our rooms ready and service was quick. We found the hotel to be clean and it seems that it was recently renovated and decorated nicely. The beds and pillows were very comfortable, definitely above average. Flat screen TV's with a lot of channels to choose from. The bathrooms were normal size with a spacious shower. The locations is good, just a few blocks west of Michigan Avenue and close to the center of the Magnificent Mile so you can head either direction (north/south) for various restaurants, etc. Wireless internet is available at no charge and they have a nice lounge area in the lobby. The negatives: Smaller rooms (at least for us). I'd say we have an average bedroom and this was smaller than that. There is space to walk on either side of the queen bed but there would not be room for any furniture such as a dresser. Very little room for storing anything. They do have ice and snack machines but I did not notice a beverage vending machine. The smaller rooms is what kept me from giving it a higher rating than 3. Bottom line: I would stay here again with a discounted price such as from Priceline unless we planned to spend a lot of time in the room. Perhaps bigger rooms can be requested. Tip: There is a parking ramp right across the street on Clark that was $23 per day...Fairly inexpensive for downtown Chicago and about half the price the hotel was charging.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience here!”
Reviews.Author: twolittlemonkeys
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at Hotel Felix for 6 nights. I was a little worried after reading some of the other reviews, especially since we booked through Priceline, but we couldn't have been happier with the hotel. They were very receptive to our need for two beds since there were four of us and we were able to get a double bed room. The room had plenty of space, very comfortable beds, and was very clean. Other than street noise, which we expected, our room was really very quiet. We found the hotel staff (front desk, housekeeping, bar, doormen/bellhops) to be very attentive and friendly. Anytime we called for something, it was brought up right away. The hotel is in a great location and is close to Michigan Ave, lots of restaurants, and a grocery and drug store. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brown2972
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i Stayed here for a weekend to visit college friends in Chicago. I was quite nervous after it was booked fours through name your own price on price line after reading many negative reviews. However, we were pleasantly surprised! The hotel was great-super comfy beds and awesome black out shades. Very clean. Many reviews complained of tiny rooms, so I expected to walk into a closet sized room-the room wasn't the biggest hotel room I've ever been in, but it was plenty big for 2 people. There was a full size mirror outside of bathroom with great lighting and outlets near by which was excellent for when we were getting ready-I was able to blow dry my hair and do my makeup out there while my bf showered so it worked out perfectly. We were on the 11th floor and had a great view of the city. For s boutique hotel this was awesome and Had a lot of character. A lot of people complained about the shallow sinks-they were shallow and modern but it was really not a major deal to us. Still plenty of room to stick a tooth brush under it and to wash hands. The toilets flush was a little weak, but I'm assuming its because it's a green water saving toilet-again it was fine. Other than those 2 minor things everything was fabulous. We would definitely stay here again! Wonderful weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but tiny”
Reviews.Author: fromrichmond
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here in July for 4 nights. It's a nice hotel but the rooms are VERY small. You could not fit more than 2 people in the room. The bathroom is very small. The sink is so shallow that I was using it as counter space. The closet to hang your clothing is a little hole in the wall with a curtain. We were also placed near the elevator and you can hear everything. I think this is rated as a 4* hotel but I would say more of a 3*. It is clean and nice looking. The location is great. We walked everywhere. You can take the train to the hotel from the airport we flew in from Midway). The best part of this hotel is Benjamin, the doorman. He was so helpful. Everywhere he suggested we go was fantastic. He seems to have this knack of reading people and knowing exactly what they would like to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: drose12
Reviews.Content: We have really been traveling this summer and I must say this is one of our favorites. The service excellent. The room was small, but very quiet and comfortable. We did book priceline and were treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sixtydeb
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny but well laid out and quiet and the bed very comfortable. The lighting was fantastic - I loved the bathroom mirror! There were great restaurants near-by - we ate at Graham Elliot's and also the restaurant in the hotel was as good as Graham Elliot's and half the price. We had moved to this hotel from the Doubletree whch had a bigger room but none of the charm of the Felix.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - European in Feel”
Reviews.Author: Tag2267
Reviews.Content: Recent two night stay. Despite almost looking elsewhere after reading online reviews (Trip Advisor and Expedia) I gave the hotel the benefit of the doubt and booked - glad I did. Hotel is well located being close to some great restaurants and sights and walking distance to just about everything else. Valet parking is directly out front and has ample space to unload the car without blocking traffic. Inside the room I booked was spotless, new(ish) and large enough for two. But size wise it is more Euro than US so don't expect something huge. Perfect for a weekend escape and the drawers in the bed frame were a nice touch. The only downsize was the pillows: unless you like them small and soft ask for some regular sized pillows if you value your sleep. And last point, contrary to some of the posts, I found the staff professional and helpful. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: mstrg325
Reviews.Content: This hotel has potential to be great, but is a big miss in a lot of areas. Because of these misses and my experience, I must rate it a 2 out of 5. Location: Excellent. Can't beat it for restaurants, bars, close enough to Michigan Ave, close to the freeway, etc. Rooms: very small. they only have ~20 double bed rooms, so if you're trying to stay here off of Priceline or an opaque site, be wary. You will probably get a queen or a king room. The rooms are higher-end and have nice touches. Highly recommend the rooms, other than their size. Beds were comfortable. Service: Not good. I was not the only one with the issue by any means. There were lots of other disappointed guests when I was there. Hopefully you don't have the same experience I had!

Reviews.Title: “The Only Review You Will Need To Read.... 100% Accurate”
Reviews.Author: zkoehl00
Reviews.Content: We got the reservations through Priceline, and I wasn't really expecting too much other than a hotel to sleep in while my wife and I explored the city and attend a baseball game. The first thing people will state or complain about is the size of the rooms being too small. Ok, this is a Boutique hotel that utilizes 100% of the space, how many times are you going to use the giant couch chair and dinner table you will find in other hotels. The closest is equipped with a safe but can only handle about 6 hanging items, but there is storage under the bed. So unless you plan on partying in your room then the room was quite "cozy" and well suited for couples or people traveling on business. We were right next to the elevator (501) and I thought it was going to be extremely noisy, but you don't even hear the elevators as it is situated in front of the bathroom and there is about a 10' hallway to get into your room, I doubt that all the rooms were like this just the ones next to the eleveators. To those people who say they only have 18" between the wall and the bed is completely false, there is a good 24-30" on the side closest to the wall and about 4 feet on the other side. If you are staying for business they have a little table and chair that you can hook up your laptop too. The bathroom has a sink and a shower stall (Which is big enough for at least 4 people). There isn't any room on the sink counter to put your toiletries but there is a shelf on the wall above the toilet where you can put these items. The hotel is located 4 blocks west of Michigan Ave and about 1 mile from water tower places, and about 1.5 miles from Navy Pier, with numerous of places to eat. There is a Wal-Greens down Clark (1 Block South) in case you have need for a drug store and there is McDonald's within walking distance 5 minutes there and back to the hotel. There is a lot of good restaurants West on Huron street, if you like Italian I suggest Scoozi! There is Fogo Da Cho around the corner from the hotel as well..... Amazing (Pricey) if you go there you should go at lunch time all the same food and about 20 dollars less a plate, plust it isn't as crowded as it would be during the dinner rush. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the curb side attendant would always ask if you needed a cab and would hail one for you if you do. Would stay here again in a Hear Beat. Let me not forget to mention that the Bed is "HEAVENLY", just ask for extra pillows as you get 4 little ones which is equivalent to 2 regular size pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Book it”
Reviews.Author: gbonsall
Reviews.Content: I read the remarks. We stayed here and liked it a bunch. Nice boutique hotel with a nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy but Great”
Reviews.Author: arkygirl4
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, my husband and I were weary about this hotel. However, we received a huge bargain on priceline ($85 a night) so we weren't too worried about it. In the end, the bargain was totally worth it. Yes, the room was small but it was adequate for our needs. The bed was super comfy and the decorations were nice and contemporary. As for customer service, we never had any problems. Every person we encountered was very nice to us. However, we never really had any issues to deal with nor did we make any special requests. I probably would not recommend this hotel for a family -- I imagine it would be REALLY tight. Also if you are paying full price, you can probably find a hotel with much more room for the same value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: kdoyle1965
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are small, but very clean with comfortable beds. Hotel is great for one or two - - location close to restaurants, bars, and Whole Foods. I contacted hotel prior to arrival and paid an upgrade fee ($40 on top of my Priceline bargain) to make sure we got a room with 2 beds. It's tight for 4, but everything else about the hotel very positive.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel. Do NOT pay 4-Star prices, even on Priceline.”
Reviews.Author: LaFeet
Reviews.Content: This really is a 2-star hotel. Do NOT pay 4-Star prices, even on Priceline. 1. The rooms are really, really small. Even the employees joke about it. 2. The room cleanup is spotty at best. One day they showed up at 6pm, the next at 10am. 3. The lobby never had coffee in the morning. And when they did, it was decaf only. Ended up having to go to Starbucks every day to get some decent coffee. 4. No refrigerator in the hotel room. 5. Every cheap thing the hotel did ended up turning into a joke to us about how the hotel was 'green'. 6. The location is several blocks out of the way of most good restaurants, shopping, and everything else. 7. I can't emphasize enough how small the rooms are. A queen bed left about 1 1/2 feet of walking space around the entire room. 8. The streets were loud at night. Bring some ear plugs. The good: 1. The hybrid parking for free was really terrific. 2. The restaurant next door is really cute. 3. The valets were really nice and overall the service was good. 4. Cute convenience store near by. 5. Close to Gino's East. 6. A couple blocks from the Red Line for Cubs games.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, I liked the Hotel Felix”
Reviews.Author: ILoveRI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights this spring, and it was an enjoyable experience. Yes, the room I stayed in was small, but entirely adequate for my needs. I loved the interior design and the H20 products. My room was quiet, and I'm a light sleeper, so would have noticed if it wasn't. Everyone on the staff that I dealt with was very polite and friendly -- absolutely no issues there. I also really liked the location -- really just a short walk to Michigan Ave, and plenty of restaurants and conveniences located nearby. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Stay at the Hotel Felix”
Reviews.Author: melady4
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old son and I stayed at the Hotel Felix for two nights while the Phillies were in town. I got a great rate on priceline. The staff checked us in at 10am on the day of our arrival and was permitted to check out at noon our last day. I found the staff to be very accomodating and friendly. Room was small as stated in other reviews but it was nice. Bed was very comfortable. Our room looked over a parking lot when you looked down but I choose to look out and saw some nice views. The location is good not great. you are just off the action maybe four short blocks to Michigan Ave. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service does not exist here”
Reviews.Author: lageers
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin! First of all, I do want to give props and say that Hotel Felix is very clean and a classy place. However, customer service does not exist here and the rooms are only made to fit the bed, and that is it. We booked our 2 night 3 day stay through Priceline, first mistake. We received a 1 queen size bed for 4 people. When we arrived, luckily they had a King size bed open for the night, but for 2 queens it was going to be an additional $65/night. We had agreed that the next day we would move to a queen size bed room. The next day, they call and tell us that we need to leave and re-priceline to get the same rate. After discussing we had already paid for two nights they realized this was their issue, and had us move out promptly, put our bags in bag check and wait a few hours before our queen size bed room was ready. What if we needed to be in our room, what if someone was sick? This didn't occur to them. We get into the room later that afternoon. The next day we're about to check out and realize we had forgotten a purse in the previous room. Instead of hospitality letting us know that, we called to the front desk and they told me I would have to file a claim to lost and found. Then all of a sudden, I was put on hold, and told it would be right up. It was soon brought up with a few things missing. Clearly, they were going to keep it, until someone claimed it. In conclusion, this is a nice place for 1-2 people, and do not ask for any upgrades, and do not expect an organized hotel, nor nice customer service/hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Almost there..”
Reviews.Author: dandygirl
Reviews.Content: I will begin with the positives. The location worked out quite well. It was nice to be off the beaten path of Michigan Avenue, yet still close enough to it. The area is surrounded by restaurants, lounges and bars. Portillo's was a few blocks away, for the infamous Chicago hot dog experience. There was also a Walgreens, a 7-11 and a liquor store all blocks or steps from the hotel. We had a room with a queen bed, and it was not much different in size from the rooms that we are used to getting in NYC. Small, but not suffocating. If you are major shopper or heavy packer, you might have some troubles with storage (the closet really is a bar with four hangers and a curtain). The H20 toiletries were great, and were continuously well stocked by our room attendants. I also applaud the hotel's environmental initiatives. It was great to have separate garbage and recycling bins in the room. And now for the negatives. I guess this might be a four star hotel based on amenities alone. I dealt with three separate people at the front desk during our stay. One to ask about storing our baggage, one to check in and one to check out. I know first hand that customer service can be a tough job, but the customer experience at a hotel is paramount. It makes or breaks your business. A simple smile would have helped. I disregarded it the first time, and we checked our bags with the bellhops who were all extremely friendly in contrast. The second person checking us in was probably the same person that people on here are referring to as 'condescending'. Perhaps without meaning to be, but regardless. He made no eye contact. It was as if he was reading the available amenities off a script. No smile, no welcome, no nothing. Like I said, I get that customers at times can be difficult, but all I said was "just wondering if we would be able to check in", and nothing else. I wasn't complaining or asking for a particular room, etc. The third and final person we dealt with at check out did greet me with a smile, and I finally felt like I was not bothering someone. On to the room. We got a lower level floor facing the street. Street noise would definitely be a problem for some, so beware light sleepers! We could hear the live jazz from the main floor restaurant on the weekend evenings, but that was actually quite nice. The main issue for us was not so much the size or the room, or the shallow sink, but the air conditioner. By the second night we would turn the temperature low for the hour or so before bed and then turn it off the for the entire night. You could hear the thing loud and clear from the hallway. I am not a light sleeper, but this was even too noisy for me! We didn't bother mentioning it figuring all rooms would be similar. Not sure if that is the case. The bed was comfortable. The small pillows were a little weird. I guess they are contemporary, but they were a little strange. Would I pay to stay here again by choice? I don't know. I would probably try something else next time. I think Hotel Felix has the potential to be a fantastic hotel, if it could just work out some essential kinks!

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Blondiegal02
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago and found this hotel for a good price and good location-about 6 blocks off the Magnificent Mile. We had read the rooms were small, but these rooms are ridiculous. First room we found two bugs-front desk made us drag our luggage down ourselves just to put us in a room down the hall on the same exact floor. The guy at the front desk, Phillip, offered no apologies and wouldn't make eye contact, just gave us new room keys. Our room was even smaller than the first. Second morning we found another bug. They moved us again, and assured us the manager-who wasn't on duty the past two days- would get in touch with us. He never did. This place was the worst I've stayed in. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always love the Felix!!”
Reviews.Author: Lee_W2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Hotel Felix multiple times and we love it. We used to live in Chicago, but now when we visit the city, we always choose the Felix. The location can't be beat - just a few blocks walk to Michigan Avenue for great shopping and restaurants, and the room rates are very reasonable. The Felix feels like a smaller, warmer version of your typical W hotel - modern and elegant, but also very welcoming. Accomodations are comfortable, room service food is good, spa services are delightful (and Aveda!), and the hotel staff is always helpful and pleasant. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “MIXED FEELINGS”
Reviews.Author: Tompsy
Reviews.Content: The Felix Hotel is in a good location - easily accessible my foot from Magnificent Mile and from the River Area. If you go to stay - ask for a quiet room - the noise from the street could be deafening. We DID get a quiet room but we were looking out in to a building site next door! Room was clean - well maintained and minimalistic in furnishings. Disappointments - room quite small, very little storage space (just a few coat hangers in a very small closet with a curtain), only two very tiny drawers on bedsides. Bed was fairly comfortable but the small pillows! What on earth is that all about? I had to put 2 inside one cover to be comfortable. Bathroom - good supplies of toiletries and cosmetic "helps" but the sink is SO shallow it is impossible to get your hands under the taps - and teeth cleaning is difficult. Towels were immaculate. We asked for toilet rolls (there was only a part of one when we arrived) - I asked for a bed cover rather than the very heavy duvet - both requests were responded to almost immediately. Staff at the desk were efficient, polite and business-like - BUT when I engaged in conversation with them they were willing to have a good chat - and were fun too. Business Centre on Mezzanine level is excellent. Disappointed there is no tea/coffee making facility in the room. Great - there was a safe which worked properly!! Would recommend to others - but be prepared for a VERY long wait each time for the elevator! AND it is small!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: ashvan
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel with a lot of charm! Really enjoyed the location and found the adjoining restaurant to be very good for breakfast, lunch and dinner. We enjoyed the area the hotel was in and found it to be very central to most of the activitiy in Chicago. The beds were amazingly comfortable and the staff was very attentive to our needs. Would receommend to anyone traveling to Chicago on business or just a fun trip with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Numerous better options in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MoreWinter
Reviews.Content: Sheets and towels had stains. Staff is condescending. Only thing going for the hotel is the location. But even that is lost with all the other options that continue to open in River North. Friday night we were kept awake by a band in the restaurant on the first floor. My 9-year-old actually asked for ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give it another try!”
Reviews.Author: bmgonz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through priceline's name your own price, so really, I didn't pick it. I work in Chicago (live in the 'burbs) and had a friend from college visiting so we wanted to stay downtown. We needed 2 beds so I sent an email to the front office manager and she was very friendly & accommodating. The day of my reservation, I arrived at 6 PM and was informed my room wasn't ready yet. This was a bummer because I had to be up in the Lincoln Park area by 6:30 and was already running late. The young man checking me in was very apologetic but because I needed a room with 2 beds, there really wasn't much he could do to solve my problem. So, I changed & got ready in the bathroom off of the lobby. Not ideal, but it worked. We checked in after our event but the room was perfectly fine. It was clean, had good light and the beds were comfortable. I'm also a big fan of great doormen and the two gentlemen who took care of my luggage and flagged a cab for me were absolutely wonderful. Was it a perfect experience? Nope. Would I give it a second try? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Felix Chica'go, go, go, and stay there, it was awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: ThePalHotel
Reviews.Content: I'm a filmmaker, and was in Chicago recently looking at potential locations for a feature film I intend to shoot in the near future. I just left the posh Pfister in Milwaukee, which was awesome. Lesson, don't judge a book by it's cover; front, back, inside or out! Yes the Pfister in Milwaukee was amazing (and expensive, but worth it), but soooo was Hotel Felix in Chicago, at half the rate. I must admit, the genuine service of the complete staff was extreme at the eco-friendly Hotel Felix, in the best of ways, and the king size bed was the most comfy bed I have ever slept on ever (not that I have slept around, lol, but I have tossed and turned at many a starnge hotel on the road). Make sure you request a king, large rm, w/a bath tub (OMG, absolute heaven : ), and if they can accomodate you, you better believe they will! The imprint of this eco-friendly domain, earned it's 4 stars in my book! Make sure you always say thanks, and tip once in awhile, cuz those kind folks at Hotel Felix in Chicago are the truest representation of an unpretentious upscale hotel in The Windy City, and beyond! At the helm of this ultimate experience was Tom (the too cool for school doorman, that truly can open doors in ChiTown, w/a phone call), as well as Phillip, Noami, Larry, and last, but certainly not least, Ashley, she was soooo kind, as they all were!!! Let me also put any rumors to rest about bed bugs. Whomever started that rumor may have to be careful where they tread before they arrive, cuz rumors are harder to break than atoms (just to put any boutique bashing to rest). This boutique hotel was awesome, bed bug free, and, if to top it all off, if you do drive here, and have a hybrid vehicle, you valet park for free in DT Chicago! WOW!!! Thanks Hotel Felix (www.nativenewyorkerfilm.com).

Reviews.Title: “It is great , will definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelBunny
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. It had very chic and modrn decor. i had a room with a queen size bed. It was just perfect for one or maybe a couple. the room was relatively small, yet the space was maximized with the tv being mounted and the location of the desk. I love that they are an environmentally friendly facility. Though, I must admit, I found the offerings on the roomserviice menu limited. The staff was wonderful and very helpful. My favorite thing about this hotel was the bed. I slpet so well! It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Smashley81
Reviews.Content: I was very excited to stay at this hotel. I booked 2 nights through Priceline at $115 and $155 per night. Being 4th of July weekend that was pretty good for the city. When we arrived the staff seemed ok, asked to help with luggage. The front desk told us about the hotel restaurant and the morning coffee/tea hour. However, they couldn't even point us to the elevators. The elevators started the smallness of the trip. 4 people were all crammed in with small bags. Once we got to the room we realized how small that was and why they have to offer free coffee in the morning. The room had no coffee maker or even cups. It offered 1 small window without much light, a closet (if you can call that a closet) with a curtain as a door. The bed offered TINY pillows which my head fell off of all night. The air conditioner was very loud and the tv seemed to be hooked up wrong because it took forever to get it to turn on. The bathroom had only a shower with a curtain that barely covered the opening which let water spray all over the floor. the sink was so shallow water would splash out. I did enjoy the toiletries offered including makeup remover clothes and q-tips! Here's the kicker. We got home from a game and tried to get into our room and neither key card worked. I had to go back to the front desk and tell them and his first response, "well, were they by any credit cards?" Seriously, no I'm sorry or let take care of that for you?!?! Where has customer service gone? I want to be comfortable when I'm away from home and I was not at Hotel Felix. We will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The tiniest room I've ever stayed it!”
Reviews.Author: EddieC64
Reviews.Content: This hotel was advertised as a 4 star boutique hotel. the room we stayed in was horrible. The queen size room was literally 8'x8', with a 15"x15" closet with 3 hangers for two people. There was no dresser but there was two small drawers underneath the bed and there was only two electrical outlets in the room. While nicely decorated it was not worth the money. I felt I was in a hostel rather than a hotel. Don't waste your time and money staying here. Spend a little more for a nicer hotel with a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: gbmom_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the hotel Felix while our daughter attended an orientation session at a nearby college. We found the hotel to be very clean, friendly, and conveniently located to the subway and Magnificent Mile. We don't mind walking a few blocks to restaurants and activities. There were many nice restaurants within 2-3 blocks, including a Ginos, an irish pub, and a couple of nice Italian restaurants. Our room had two double beds and was located on the corner of the building, therefore, we had an excellent view from our room. The bathroom was large enough for us and was clean and well maintained. The room did not have a tub but rather, had a walk in shower. The sink was a bit shallow and made teeth brushing, face washing a little difficult. H2O shampoo, etc. was a nice touch. The bathroom also had one bathrobe. Our only complaint with the room was the size of the two beds. They were double beds but seemed soooo small. It was especially challenging for two adults to sleep comfortably in one bed. The linens were high quality. It was just difficult to sleep with two to a bed. The front desk staff was friendly and provided any information we needed. The attendant outside the building was especially friendly and stood several minutes in the rain hailing us a cab. He also provided information on the self park across the street, which was very easy to get to and much less expensive than the valet service. The lot is literally across the street from the hotel and was about $23 per night. We received a discount when we mentioned that we were the parents of a DePaul student. Our rate for the room was very reasonable. We would stay at the Hotel Felix again, but will consider 2 rooms with King beds to make sleeping more comfortable. We also appreciate the environmental efforts the hotel is making toward less waste.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel952
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone else when they say the rooms are to small, they couldn't give me double beds, the spigot in the bathroom sink is to close to the base (sink). I think they charge to much money for the small room. I wouldn't recommend staying here if I had a choice. I stayed one night with my sister and two other friends. (I had two rooms) It was a girls night out in Chicago. Good trip, just didn't care for the room. Booked room thru Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Mezzo, mezzo”
Reviews.Author: lopo
Reviews.Content: Two nights at this hotel. Check in was smooth & efficient; dsk person was pleasant but not overly friendly. I was on the top (12th) floor. My room was located directly across from the elevator but, fortunately, I did not notice a lot of noise. There was one small window with an ordinary view. The room was not especially large but I wouldn't describe it as tiny. There was a king sized bed, 2 night tables, a desk & chair, as well as a tiny round table with an upholstered chair. The closet was cut into the wall (no door); it contained an iron & board, a safe, & a small pole to accommodate hangers for a few garments. There was a curtain to 'hide' it. The room also had a full length mirror near the front door, some ceiling lights as well as a floor lamp and bedside lamps. The bathroom was spacious & clean: no tub. The faucet in the sink was not set well since, while washing one's hands, there wasn't room to put them under the faucet. The spigot was too close to the base. That was annoying. The water pressure in the shower left much to be desired. The room was much more attractive than the common area (narrow halls) on each floor. Housekeeping staff was very friendly. I found this hotel to be off the beaten path; if you'd like to be close to attractions and/or action, you may want to stay elsewhere since the cost savings are not significant.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.. :-/”
Reviews.Author: Loulew21
Reviews.Content: The service was terrible. We tried to be out of the hotel as much as we could. We originally booked for 2 nights but only stayed one night. The room was itty bitty. The smallest we have seen! The bed was nice, wasn't the best. The person who checked us in didn't give us any info on the hotel or even tell us where the elevator was... We had to ask. I wouldn't recommend staying here if you were looking for a nice hotel to relax in. For being a boutique hotel it was way below average in my book!

Reviews.Title: “smallest room I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: fluffy61
Reviews.Content: 1. We wanted a room with two beds and asked for this over the phone and was told "no problem just ask when you check in". When we checked in we were told there were no two bed rooms available. 2. When we opened the door we were shocked to find only a double bed and not even a king. There was no more then 18 inches between the bed and the wall on both sides and no more than 2 feet between the foot of the bed and the desk/TV/chair. My niece banged her knee on the bed twice and got bruises just trying to move 3. The closet was tiny and there was no where to put our suitcases. 4. The door to the bathroom could be reached from the bed 5. We thought we may have a good view but when we opened the curtain all we saw was 3 surrounding brick walls and a rusted rain spout 6. We then called the front desk to see if we could at least get a king size bed and were told they were booked. 7. I called the front desk to get an extra blanket and had to wait over an hour because 'the blankets were in the dryer'. We were offered no discounts nor apologies at any time. I WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN NOR RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE ELSE.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel In Great Area”
Reviews.Author: horseman48
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and enjoyed our stay. The room was a bit small but very clean and comfortable. I especially loved the bed as it had a very comfortable mattress. Nice large flat screen TV with a full array of channels. The batroom was well appointed and had a nice large shower. The employees were all very friendly and helpful. We were without water for a relatively short period of time but were compensated for the inconvenience with a $40.00 credit for breakfast at their restaurant, Elate. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Tekysales
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for work. The rooms are typical of a city hotel - small. Very nice and modern decor. Nice bathroom. Staff was friendly and very infromative. Good location with many bars/restaurants right around it.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential, but major kinks”
Reviews.Author: travelbee28
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Felix for four nights in May at a priceline rate of $150/night. On the first night, after a long night on the town, I was horrified when I pulled back the covers and discovered several (and I'm talking 10-12) strands of someone else's hair stuck to the sheets. I've stayed in tons of hotels around the world and have never seen anything like this. I complained to management and left a very courteous note for the housekeeping staff. To their credit, I never had an issue after that. Still, this is unacceptable. I hope they step up their game, because it's a cute little hotel. Rooms are small, but well appointed and the bath products were great. The lobby/bar area was usually crowded a la W hotels, giving it a trendy vibe. Staff were friendly. Parking was outrageously high, but par for the course in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Shoebox”
Reviews.Author: mrpond2u
Reviews.Content: Tiny room. Loud air conditioner. Tiny closet with a curtain door. Tiny ironing board. Zero space. Gap in door so we could see light in hallway. Guy across the hall we could hear breathing. This is not four stars unless you are a little person...even then it would be 3. Like the H2O products at least. Skip it. There are many places to choose in Chicago. Ask me.

Reviews.Title: “From the tiny room to the fake marble peeling off of the facade in the bathrooom”
Reviews.Author: Westontraveller1231
Reviews.Content: My company booked 5 of us here through Priceline - granted I don't know what they paid per room - but the rooms are tiny, uninspired in design (which can make up for small), there was no tub, just a shower. In addition, the supposedly work-friendly desk was so tiny that it barely held a computer and the closet - well the closet isn't a closet - it's an alcove with a drape with room for 6 hangars all crushed together.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: servicecomesfirst
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago once a year on business and always stay at a downtown hotel. I like the location of the Felix: a few blocks from the hustle and bustle of Michigan Ave. in a pleasant neighbourhood with lots of people walking their dogs. I found the front-desk staff to lack the friendliness that you typically find in a major hotel -- although the bellboys were very helpful. We asked the front desk to make three dinner reservations and later discovered that they forgot to phone two of the restaurants, so we had to make alternate bookings ourselves. The rooms are very small and the main problem is that there is no closet; instead, there is a very tiny alcove with a rod where you might be able to hang 5-6 items. The only drawers are underneath the beds. The tiny bathroom lacks any counter space. The beds are comfortable, although the pillows are, again, tiny. The restaurant immediately next door serves a very good and inexpensive breakfast with excellent coffee. All in all, the next time I go to Chicago I will be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and will come back”
Reviews.Author: oneHappycamper
Reviews.Content: Small boutique hotel . from the moment you arrive, you almost feel at home yes the rooms are small but very nice. I wish they had a door on the closets instead of a curtain which makes it look cheap. but I did ignore this The internet is welcome addition

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Shachi2158
Reviews.Content: Very small rooms, with not too many amenities. No coffee maker, nor any hair dryer and plastic cups for drinking water! Very clean rooms and within walking distance from nice restaurants and Walgreens but no views to the rooms. Staff is very friendly, and free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Small room very little storage space”
Reviews.Author: Atlantis1000
Reviews.Content: Our room was small with a queen bed and tiny pillows that looked liked square cushions. The closet was a little space cut out of the wall with a curtain and almost no space to hang a suit and party dress. What bothered us most was lack of storage space. A part from that, the hotel is well located with easy access to Michigan Av.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as described - very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Jkatajhina
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights here via Hotwire for business and yes, the rooms are a bit small, but very comfortable and up to date. I did laugh when I banged my shin on corner of bed, as that seems to be a common complaint, but I did not mind the room at all. Windows open, bed comfortable, bathroom has standup shower with big tiles and terrazzo floor, and big rainhead. Very nice. Rooms might be too small for a couple with a lot of luggage, but if you're traveling light, this seems to be a great choice. The shower didn't have water for an hour so they offered me a $40 voucher in the Elate restaurant downstairs, which I thought was a nice gesture. Staff was very nice, especially the guys who work the door. I parked across the street in lot which is $30/night. Starbucks a block and a half away and the Kerryman bar a block away had great food. Free wifi also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice amenities, affordable price!”
Reviews.Author: NashTraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on a last minute 3-night getaway to Chicago. We got a great deal on Priceline (which seems to be the way most people end up at the Hotel Felix). Regardless, it was a great hotel for the price. The rooms were crisp and clean, with great modern decor, and I appreciate their LEED certification. The FREE high speed wi-fi was really useful when booking tours, dinner reservations, etc. My only complaint was a 3 hour water outage one afternoon in the entire hotel due to nearby utility work by the city. This happened to be on a hot day when we desparately needed showers after our bike tour before heading to the Cubbies game...but this was out of the hotel's control, so I can't blame them. I've read some reviews here complaining of the lack of closet space, small rooms, etc. Come on, it's not the Ritz; but it IS an affordable hotel in downtown Chicago, so I think expectations have to be reasonable! I would definitely stay at the Hotel Felix again.

Reviews.Title: “We always stay here when travelling to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: selsisu
Reviews.Content: We are from NYC and have stayed at the Hotel Felix three times in the last couple of years and are about to head there again this weekend. The location is terrific--near clubs, stores, galleries but you are not in the middle of throngs of tourists. The hotel and its amentities are understated and elegant. The rooms may be small by US standards (not by European standards though) but we found the rooms to be comfortable and well-appointed. I was recommended the hotel by a dear friend and several of my friends have stayed at the Felix on my recommendation. The staff is helpful and kind. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Run!”
Reviews.Author: Holly_Mac24
Reviews.Content: After reviewing several hotels my friend and I decided to book through Priceline - big mistake! We drew the short stick and wound up with Hotel Felix. We were taking a last minute girl's trip to Chicago for a long weekend. I knew Felix was a boutique hotel - no big deal, just needed two beds. I contacted Denise -- (head of reservations) weeks in advance and she was not only rude, but the least bit helpful. We were crammed in the worst room with one queen bed on a floor with a view of neighboring parking lot. The ONLY positive was that the bed was very comfortable, then again I was sharing it with my friend so it wasn't even worth enjoying! If hotels do not wish to accommodate customers who book through third party sites, they should not list their extra rooms through partners like Priceline, Orbitz, Expedia.... I will do my very best to avoid this hotel and the inconsiderate staff in the future. Be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, no bathtubs but otherwise clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: nobo
Reviews.Content: Treated myself to a night downtown, but prepaid, which was a mistake. The rooms are clean and contemporary, but totally of the the tiny European budget-hotel variety. I appreciate the efforts they're making to go green, but I was wanting a bath and a relaxing night. I ate dinner in the restaurant bar, and that was nice with good service. Free coffee and NY Times in the morning was a plus. Location is good - close to whole foods, but nowhere in your room to sit and enjoy the nice wine and cheese you might get there. If you can get a really good price, I'd recommend it, but only if you don't need a tub or room to move.

Reviews.Title: “Solo Travelers Only and ask about CONSTRUCTION next door!”
Reviews.Author: RomyDeeJay
Reviews.Content: Solo Travelers Only First of all, letâ€™s address the issue of the whiners: Seriously? People are staying at a fantastic address in Chicago in an exciting neighborhoodâ€”(btw, Iâ€™m a former Chicagoan: this is the neighborhood and it even boasts a Whole Foods a block and a half away). And theyâ€™re complaining? Location, location, location. Youâ€™re central to everywhere youâ€™d want to be in Chicago. And people are paying between $50-100 a night and complaining? That wasnâ€™t good enough for them? Letâ€™s get real: Hotel Felix has tons of charm; and , if youâ€™re traveling on business or solo for whatever reason, itâ€™s an ideal place to stay. Yes: the room is small; yes, itâ€™s tiny by American standards. But itâ€™s actually perfectly fine (if a tad claustrophobic) for 1 person. And the room is incredibly nicely appointed: nice toiletries and sink in the bathroom (cosmetics were the H20 brand, which is very nice), tasteful fixtures, great HD flat-screens in room, free wireless, nice amenities, no coffee machine in rooms but complimentary coffee in lobby in AM. So... you have to get dressed and go get it. Tragic, right? Clean, sleek lines, eco-friendly... and is it really such a big deal that thereâ€™s not a tub? Iâ€™d rather have a huge spider showerhead with plenty of hot water, which is exactly what I got... And people were complaining that the sink was shallow? And this was a problem because...? That actually was an eco-friendly touch. So, for business people: itâ€™s comfortable and modern, but you wonâ€™t have much of a workspace. (Honestly, my next stop for a Clarion chain hotel and it was 3x the size and had a huge desk.) I would compare this hotel more to Japan than to Europe: small, but very efficient. Or imagine picking up a copy of Architectural Digest or something and seeing how someone managed to do a fab apartment in 15 square meters.... This is what weâ€™re talking about. All that said... Yes: there are some issues. I see that the General Manager frequently responds to guest feedback and seems quite well-intentioned. Reasonable can disagree, of course, but I promise you: these rooms are not â€œcozyâ€�: they are tiny and cramped. Coziness at least implies a nice lounge chair, an armchair. In this very small space where I banged into the bed a couple of times, there is no room for a real chair in which to sit comfortable. And reviewers are right about the lack of closet space. If you Priceline this hotel (as I did)â€”and I was thrilled to be in this neighborhood for $150 per nightâ€”then I do think that these small rooms do not in fact accommodate 2 adults: in my humble opinion, 2 adults need 2 chairs and there is not enough room for 2 chairs in the space provided. I suspect I paid on the high end for Priceline... then again, I was on the 10th floor. Americans always want larger than life: but I am 5â€™2â€� and the bed was the right size for me. Also, the ventilation is problematic because of the size of the room and the quality of the equipment/hardware: curiously, there is no exhaust or ventilation in the bathroom, which makes that room hot and musty. More troublesomeâ€”esp. if anyone in your party happens to be bald: there is no way to avoid having that fan-forced air of either A/C or heat blowing directly on your head while you sleep, which is pretty unpleasant. My husband would not have tolerated this. (The upside is that this is a room in which you can actually open a window: but itâ€™s downtown Chicago, so youâ€™re unlikely to sleep with it open. And plastic glasses instead glassware? Ice water in a plastic cup of the sort that they use at keg parties? Reviewers are also correct that housekeeping seems a bit stingy about replacing used products (probably the eco-friendly thing)... And itâ€™s also true: dust and crud on the marble tables goes unchecked: the coffee stains look like part of the marble. Not 4 stars. Staff is lovely and accommodating and friendly: everyone that works cabs, bell caps, etc: Julian, Benjamin, and another one who was just as fabulous but I didnâ€™t catch his name. And this will sound weird, but they seem to hire extremely... for want of a better word... â€œbeautiful people.â€� Everybody that works there looks like a model! Otherwise, sorry to say that, for as much charm and convenience as the place had, I think that Americans expect space in a 4-star hotel: so I do agree with those Priceline customers who think 3 stars max is the appropriate rating. I feel sorry for those who hoped for a romantic getaway or who brought family. The Hotel Felix does not meet the expectation of luxury that accompanies a 4-star rating. This is a great place to stay if youâ€™re on business and donâ€™t need lots of space. Not recommended for couples. A final note: BEWARE: there is a HUGE construction project right next door. It was not active when I stayed at the hotel, but if it ever is, it will be a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, second stay - questionable...”
Reviews.Author: missnoetic
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Felix as a package deal on Expedia with my flight to Chicago. The pictures looked great but I did read through reviews about the small rooms...paid extra for double beds since I was not traveling alone. Location: First of all, the location of the hotel was great for us. It's very close to State Street, Magnificent Mile, etc. without being in the thick of it. It's just outside of those areas so you still have the peace and quiet of a quaint neighborhood. The hotel is also located within walking distance of many great eateries, Trader Joes, Whole Foods, a U.S. Post Office, etc. Cleanliness: Well this is where it lacked quite a bit. The cleaning service they did was...almost non-existent. The first day we checked in at about 3:00pm, we were trying to catch some rest but the maid service kept banging on our door. We just checked in, we do not need service. Secondly, it seems like they do not know what a duster is - our room was filled with dust every day. There was one day where our room was not cleaned - we got back to the hotel at about 8pm - suddenly a woman just lets herself in the room (no knocking) and quickly apologizes and closes the door (to be fair â€“ there is a privacy lock and a secondary lock which we forgot to activate this night). I'll assume that was the maid...at 8:30pm. I found hairs around the room of different colors so I knew they didn't belong to me. Overall - it just felt...unclean. I did notice a slight improvement at the end of the week when another maid was working the floor. Room: As other reviewers have mentioned - the rooms are small. There is basically no closet. I lived out of my suitcases, the beds include two drawers each if you want to use it. We had a double room so we were fit in pretty tight. We were also placed on the third floor which gave us a nice view of a cement wall outside our window. The walls are a bit thin. I knew when my neighbor was coming/going, taking a shower, etc. Luckily we were placed in the corner so I didn't have to hear too much hallway noise. Microwave/Mini Fridge: NONE Air Conditioning: I guess as a green hotel, their air conditioning units only allow for automatic settings. Our AC unit kept kicking on and off during the night - it was loud and got really hot in between the kick-ons. Bathroom: The bathroom is actually a good size. There is a complete lack of counter space which made getting ready a bit of a headache. The shower head was pretty weak and I didn't like that there was no bottom water spout...and the shower head was not one of those removable heads. Staff: I didn't talk much to the staff. When I checked in - the staffer had a bit of a speech issue and I had to keep having to ask him to repeat his question...and he finally snapped his question out. Wonderful, thanks for the welcome. Greetings back to the hotel were scattered and my check-out staff was cold and short. Internet: Free Wi-fi! This is definitely a huge plus for me. I had almost no issues with the wifi during this trip. There was one day where I saw a huge crowd checking in and that day, the internet was much slower...but all in all - it worked great! Loved having the free wifi. Would I stay here again? I would consider it...it really wasn't too bad and I thought we got a pretty good deal on our stay. I don't know if I would highly recommend it to others. Tip: If you have an iPhone - it's a god-send. The Yelp application helped us find some of the best eats!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine on someone else's dime”
Reviews.Author: HaCoMo
Reviews.Content: I've heard of people being charged many hundreds for these rooms; do not pay that. Find a deal or find another place. This is designed as a mod business traveler's hotel: tiny closet is actually just a narrow low-hung bar in a nook. The quarters are tight, fine for one but not for two. My room was never cleaned in two nights. Room service breakfast was average, but on time. Front desk staff was surly -- well, nighttime staff was. Morning staff was okay but deeply slow. The doormen are lovely though. In all, if you just need a place to crash that is within walking distance of good restaurants, this is acceptable as long as you don't pay boutique prices.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, but VERY tiny; DON'T pay full price”
Reviews.Author: HotPantsMalone
Reviews.Content: My feelings about the Hotel Felix are mixed. The hotel is in a good location and the rooms and lobby are well-designed. The doormen and the bellhops are VERY friendly and helpful. However: if I had paid full price to stay here, I would have been unhappy. The rooms are tiny. No, I mean TINY. REALLY, REALLY tiny. I didn't have room to put my suitcase on the fold-out suitcase holder because it would have blocked the door; I was unable to remove my shoes from my suitcase because I would not have had anywhere to put them; there are no closets, just a corner of the room with a hanging bar. The room basically has space for the bed and that's it -- I've stayed many places in NYC and Europe and I can deal with a small room, but these are exceptionally small. Another problem: there was no electrical outlet in my bathroom. Want to use the blow dryer? You have to do it in the bedroom, where the light is terrible -- this is a real problem for a woman with business meetings who needs to look polished. Basically, in addition to the size and design issues, my big problem was that the front desk staff was lackadaisical at best and surly at worst. I called down to see if I could get a robe (my room didn't have a robe when I checked in; the towels were also still stained with someone else's make-up). They never brought me one. I called the front desk to see if they could tell me how long it would take to get to O'Hare, and when I expressed disbelief at the clerk's estimate of an hour (at 11am), he actually snapped at me. (For what it's worth, the trip to O'Hare instead took 22 minutes.) I had issues checking out, and my key kept getting demagnetized, and every time I tried to deal with these problems, the staff acted as if they were doing me a favor -- on one occasion, in fact, I went down to get my key fixed and there was no one at the front desk for over fifteen minutes. I actually had to call them on the phone to come out and help. So I don't know what's happening there, but the service from the front desk was off-putting. All that being said, I did find the beds very comfortable and I appreciated the free WiFi. I ordered breakfast room service, and it came quickly and was very good. The coffee was particularly good. But given the price, I think you probably have better options in a town like Chicago, where there are so many hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good advice”
Reviews.Author: jimmyMoscow_Idaho
Reviews.Content: I guess if you are looking for a big room, this isn't the place for you. But for our three-night visit to Chicago, it was perfect. It had a great bed, flat-screen TV on the wall in front of it, and a bathroom including a large shower with a rain showerhead. The doorman/concierge gave us excellent advice on restaurants, including the nearby Yolk for breakfast, and we also enjoyed Cafe Iberico and Cyrano's Bistrot in the neighborhood. Maybe best of all: Because the hotel is so new, and so green, everything was spotless and clean-smelling. Yes, we were sent there by Priceline, but if I were to visit Chicago again, I would hope to get it.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!!!! DISASTER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nipper85
Reviews.Content: pre-paid, walked in at 11:30pm to find out.... they have no rooms available, sorry!!! then I find out from the guy at the front desk that they do it all the time.... overbook and sell out. so... they "walked" me to another hotel (a nightmare of a hotel) which they paid less for then what i paid them... wait, did that make sense??? yes! thats what they did! I pre-paid $151 plus tax - they paid $139... then I find out from the front desk lady at the "new" hotel that I am not the first one today!!! So..... STAY AWAY FROM THE FELIX!!!! PS - went back today to speak to the manager which mysteriously was not there while the valet told me she was. I am not making this up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel near downtown”
Reviews.Author: TotoroNJ
Reviews.Content: Though I got this hotel from Priceline with 4 star, I have to say this is not as good as other 2 1/2 rated hotel nearby. Room is small. Considering I am a business man, I needed more space in the room. Just a little bit more. This room tends to be close to tiny size. Price is OK considering its location. 10 min. walk to Daly center and aquatic city. Wifi is free. Free business center with computer and printer. Nothing special to remember. Just its rating need to be fixed. But, its price is attractive factor most of all.

Reviews.Title: “It is the spirit of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Jimfellows
