Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Felix Easter weekend . We had a awesome time there ! The staff , the valet even the housekeeping were very friendly and helpful . The rooms are very modern and there is a relaxing feel in the air . Besides feeling good about the hotel , its location is awesome . It is located within walking distance of anything you want to do downtown Chicago !!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: internationalguy87
Reviews.Content: For this to be my first boutique style hotel i loved it . From the Front desk staff.to everything about the hotel so clean and quiet...great location will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, ant infested, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: nelshark
Reviews.Content: I went with my mother in law and baby. When I called ahead to request a double room or at least king, they told me they will only give me a queen since I booked with priceline. So then I called priceline to cancel because they GUARANTEE accomodations for at least 2 adults. A queen cannot accomodoate 2 adults in my opinion, unless you are lovers (an assumption priceline makes). In addition priceline has failed in meeting the 4 star criteria, as I booked fro a 4 star on the Mag mile. This hotel room is TINY, hardly any room for the crib and NO ROOM for the stroller and suitcase! This was worse than a hotel in timesquare! THis hotel no way compares to the 4 stars of downtown chicago!!!! The ant infestation didnt help either. We only were able to see them on the filthy black carpet because I had laid a white towel down on the floor. As I called the front desk horrified, I found some crawling up my arm while I was on the bed. Needless to say we didnt sleep well at all. In addition the AC unit is awful. You have to put it down to a freezing 67 degrees, otherwise if we put it up to 69, the heat turned on. I was never more exhausted and irritable on a vacation before! After all this, the front desk wasnt apologetic the least bit! When we eagerly checked out he asked if I took any waters or anything, something any other hotel would OFFER to make up for all the inconvenience. But NO I didnt drink your stanky water bottles or anything else, thanks for offering though. TERRIBLE TERRIBLE HOTEL. DO NOT GO. Unless you are going solo, and dont mind insects and an unreliable thermostat! HOWEVER I do have to say, the Bell man and door man were wonderful! Thanks to them, we were accommodated and assisted a bit in transferring to another room.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning a return trip!”
Reviews.Author: Willpetro2
Reviews.Content: Fantastic on many levels; clean, friendly staff, cool rooms with a wonderful view of the city and located in an area where there seems to be something to do on every corner.. Nice little (hip) restaraunt and bar on main floor as well.. Best part of the day for my spouse and I who headed up to the city for the afternoon and decided to stay the night after sightseeing for many hours.. A wonderful day topped off by a really unique place with a great (and VERY professional) staff..

Reviews.Title: “Great if your a midget”
Reviews.Author: Travelingdemon
Reviews.Content: First it took us thirty minutes to check in and we were the only ones there. When we got to our rooms they were the size of other hotels closets with no amenities. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, phenomenal housekeeping staff, accurate concierge information and helpful guest services.”
Reviews.Author: sherrilynn007
Reviews.Content: My mom and I recently went to chicago for leisure, and albeit I did book this hotel through Priceline, it was a very pleasant surprise. I would stay their again when in Chicago. Some reviews indicate that rooms are small but I found them very adequate, comfortable bed, safe, iron, blow dryer, large bathroom, extra chairs, and certainly large and comfortable enough based on the time you spend in the room. If you are looking for the Taj Mahal then perhaps staying at the Palmer will be a better choice. If you want a great room at a reasonable rate then the Hotel Felix may be for you. As a side note, my my is a smoker and the porters knew her by name and looked out for her when she went down for a 10pm smoke. Also, hotel provided me a refrigerator at no cost as I have a severely broken ankle and have to ice ankle fairly frequently. This was very much appreciated. Room had mild noise from traffic, I wear ear plugs so doesn't matter. View, not so much. Whole foods a few blocks away a major bonus. Especially with refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Felix is Great! Priceline's Rating System and Placement Criteria is Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Divehpu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felix is a great eco-friendly hotel. The room was nicely decorated, the bed was comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. The location was perfect if you want to be near public transportation and close to North Michigan Ave. Also, if you own a hybrid, valet parking is free. If I were on business or if I were traveling to Chicago for a weekend getaway with my wife I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. The issues arise with people (mostly families) booking this hotel through Priceline. Priceline lists this hotel as four stars and I have a hard time with that. I would give it 3.5 stars as a CITY hotel. Priceline is also booking families in standard, queen size rooms even when the bidder clearly lists children in the reservation. I contacted Hotel Felix after bidding and they were able to upgrade us to a King, but did not have two doubles available. When families bid on a four star hotel in Chicago they are not thinking boutique hotel, but more along the lines of the Hyatt, Hilton Suites, Embassy Suites, etc... In other words, large hotels with a long list of amenities. I even contacted Priceline to voice my concerns, but they were completely unresponsive. The bottom line is my wife and I found a great hotel for a future couple only getaway, but will not use Priceline in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for our limited requirements, but not really four-star”
Reviews.Author: WITraveller251
Reviews.Content: My best friend & I stayed in the Felix on a recent "girls weekend" trip to Chicago. The room was clean, but - ad indicated by many reviews - incredibly tiny. I didn't think it would matter much because we didn't expect to be in the room much, but even our 20+ year friendship and lack of personal modesty was pushed to the limits while we were both maneuvering to get ready each day! Staff members were friendly and helpful, and the location was just fine for us. We visited the nearby Whole Foods to stock the room with water and snacks, and found the easy accessibility of Michigan Avenue to be a plus, however, it is pretty far north of most downtown tourist destinations. We got this room using Priceline and searching for a 4-Star accommodation in the Michigan Avenue area. I don't think this equates to other 4-Star hotels I've stayed in while visiting Chicago, and it's location is just barely within the area I was seeking. I guess that explains the EXTREMELY low price I received.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, small service....about a 2 star for downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: GPFarms
Reviews.Content: Overall experience - BAD....reflecting on the last reviewers comments....Don't stay at Hotel Felix.... The overall rooms are nice, but extremely small. NOTHING is outlined on their web-site to reflect the postage-stamp sized rooms.....Very misleading. I traveled with my 3 and 8 year old, checked in, only to find ONE queen bed in the room. Upon returning to the front desk, I was told there were no king bed rooms available...for our first night, but a good chance of king bed the following night - Well, no deal.... The front desk's response was patronizing, short and RUDE. What I find pathetic is the fact they even offer a ONE queen bed room, that is no larger than a normal 4 star hotel bathroom.... This hotel is a 2 star....no higher. Positives (and yes, there are some) are cleanliness, location and front door persons are awesome, polite (maybe promote them to front desk - fire the current ones...)

Reviews.Title: “One Sardine too many”
Reviews.Author: scretney
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a lot of nice hotels and many not so nice. Felix Hotel in Chicago ranks very close to one of the worst ever. Priceline ranks them as 4 stars - that's about 3 too many. The Super 8 or Motel 6 has more room and amenities than Felix. Priceline booked me into one room of about 200 sqft with 3 adults (another story altogether). We joked that one of us sardines would need to sleep outside the room - though the hallway didn't offer much either. It was so bad that I ended up booking another hotel with two beds a few blocks away. I promised myself that I'd write this review so that others would avoid the same "4 Star" mistake that Priceline lured me into!!

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, tiny pillows and thin walls”
Reviews.Author: ILuvPDX
Reviews.Content: I pricelined a "4 Star" hotel in Chicago and got the Hotel Felix. The hotel has a decent location for shopping on Michigan Ave (about 5 blocks West) and is close to the Grand Stop on the Red Line. I was happy with the location, but that's about it. I asked to have 2 doubles because I was traveling with my mom and they couldn't accommodate us, even though they said they could the day before when I called to confirm the reservation. The walls were paper thin and we heard the TV in the room next door. There were only 12" square pillows on the bed that were not comfortable. No coffee maker in the room and coffee isn't available until 8am in the lobby. Don't valet your car for $42. Park it in the lot on Clark for $23 a day. h20 bath products in the room were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Coco4151
Reviews.Content: I used Priceline last minute to book this trip and when my offer was accepted I then read all the reviews. My biggest concern was with Priceline who did not declare that they only book queen size beds. I called the hotel directly and asked them if we could have 2 beds as I was traveling with my teenage son and they accomodated us. We loved the room and the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The room with 2 beds is plenty big despite some of the reviews saying they are super tiny. The beds are very comfortable and the option to control the heat is great. We loved the H20 bath products and the shower was awesome as is the complimentary Metropolis coffee. A special shout out to Larry in guest services who made us feel really welcome. If you like boutique hotels, choose the Felix. Any by the way, the best pizza of our lives (and we have been eating pizza in Italy for 16+ years) is at Osteria via Stato just a few blocks away. Don't miss the chocolate tart when you go!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff; Excellent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: kevin_51_83
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern rooms. Helpful staff. Attached restaurant and bar are also of a high quality. I've stayed at Felix multiple times and will continue to stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ecco friendly OK whatever but decinitely not consumer friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jacobsandiago
Reviews.Content: I have travelev extensively having visited every state and major city in the Untied States and many abroad. This hotel is just ridiculous! My son is a musician and had a gig in Chicago so he booked through one of the many on line sights as he usually does and ended up booking a room for 2 with double beds. Well, we ended up with 1 queen bed in a room that didn't have space for a roll away. The front desk claimed they couldn't do anything and didn't amazingly poor service. I slept in the queen bed and my son slept on the floor in a space that was approx. 3 ft wide. Oh, and they couldn't supply any morw bedding either. Ecco friendly OK whatever, but certainly not consumer friendly. The worse place I have ever stayed in I felt like we were in a closet.

Reviews.Title: “I am unclear on how this hotel rates a five star rating per Priceline.”
Reviews.Author: LynneCarter
Reviews.Content: I have used priceline.com and specifically Name your price, for my travel needs for years. I have always been extremely satisfied with the results. However, I fail to see how the Felix qualifies as a five star hotel. The rooms are the size of a Microtel and there is nothing special about the amenties. I was traveling with another couple who was planning to share our room, but when I called and requested two beds, my request was denied. My friends ended up making their own reservation at the Conrad Hilton. This defeated the purpose of us traveling together and enjoying each others' company. I will no longer use priceline again if the Felix is to be compared to the Westin and the Intercontinental as a five star hotel. And I will be sure to not stay at the Felix again.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: tunelawyer
Reviews.Content: We were booked at Hotel Felix through Priceline. I was worried about the size of the rooms, as I kept reading they were small and that Priceline customers only received a room with one bed. Travelling as a couple with a teenager, I was concerned. But I called the hotel after making the reservation, and was greeted courteously and given a room with two beds, no questions asked. Checking in, both the door staff and the front desk were the friendliest and most accommodating I have encountered in my travels. The room, while small, wasn't tiny for three adult-sized people. Plenty of room to move around, even to plug in an electric wheelchair. The room was immaculate and beautifully furnished. The only problem I encountered was the folks next door were quite loud. It was St. Pat's weekend, and they came home drunk about 3 am and were extremely boisterous. After attempts to get them to quiet down were unsuccessful, I called the desk. Within minutes, a staff member was knocking on their door and telling them to keep it down. The front desk gave me 15% discount on our parking at checkout, for our inconvenience. Charles the doorman was polite, helpful, knowledgeable about the neighborhood and generally a friendly guy. Everyone working in the hotel made our stay pleasant. There was a bartender who offered advice on places to go outside the hotel. There was the housekeeping employee (I don't know his name) who saw me carrying three cups of coffee, and dropped what he was doing to help me take them up to my room. Other than my neighbors, the room was extremely quiet (although I agree the walls are probably on the thin side). The location couldn't be beat. The only complaint is how expensive parking is, but that's a problem with every hotel downtown. I wondered why a boutique hotel like this would want to accept priceline bookings, but after our stay I get it. I never would have found out about this hotel, and I am sure that we will stay here again, and recommend it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as reviews I'd read!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaWh
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel as our Priceline offer based on Name Your Own Price for a four-star North Michigan Avenue hotel. When we checked Trip Advisor reviews, we were very concerned about the size of the room and the sleeping arrangements for three people. Upon check-in. however, we were able to get a room with two doubles and the room was small but not unreasonable based on the price we had paid. In terms of sound, there was some noise but ask for a room at the end of the hall and you should be fine. Loved the decor, the beds were super comfortable, great linens, and the staff was friendly. All in all, I don't think this hotel is "four-star" compared to some of the Chicago hotels in that category, but it has a good option to offer those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel, high end touches, just great.”
Reviews.Author: CBT_11
Reviews.Content: I like older hotels with character so I really liked the Felix. It's interior decor is classically elegant with neutral and pleasing colour schemes but the rooms also have modern touches such as a great shower with high-end toiletries and HD Television. It also had the most comfortable mattress I have slept on in a hotel and great linens. I have a hard time sleeping in a room without an open window so I was glad to see that the windows opened. I found all of the staff very congenial and not at all pretentious, but of course this is the Midwest. I did not use the spa or eat at the restaurant but the bar looked beautiful and I wish I would have had time to have had a few drinks there but we had dinner planned elsewhere. Many reviewers have stated that the rooms are very small. We had a double room and I felt that it was of perfectly adequate size. I booked on Priceline and for the rate I received I felt that the hotel represented EXCEPTIONAL value. It is in an excellent location, one block from a truly excellent grocery store as well as within walking distance of many restaurants and bars and the excellent shopping on State Street downtown and famous Michigan Avenue. For the airport, the Red Line El is a five minute walk away. Take the Red Line to Jackson Station and transfer to Blue Line Trains to O'Hare. This is quicker and a fraction of the price of a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small room”
Reviews.Author: Bladingod
Reviews.Content: Before arriving the room was booked on Priceline at a very reasonable rate. The hotel was very centrally located downtown in a quiet neibourhood. Hotel has free wi-fi for guests. The only downfall of this hotel is the size of the rooms. Even for a single business traveler, I found the room to be very small.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Chipotlequeen
Reviews.Content: I booked through priceline and I got a great deal!! I surprised my boyfriend for his birthday, and he absolutely loved it! The hotel was very modern and low key. The beds were very very very comfortable! The room was clean, the service was great, out stay was amazing and I would definitely stay there again!!! Only con- I wanted to get late check out and couldn't!

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: lynniegoes
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Felix. A true boutique hotel. Yes, we had a small room, was worried after reading other reviews, but it was beautifully set up and more than enough space for the massive quantity of luggage I brought. The staff was delightful, from the doorman and valet that greeted us as we pulled up, to the bartender, front desk and housekeeping. The environment is calming, quiet and well appointed. The location is perfect for 'doing' downtown Chicago, walking distance to Sunda ( great spot ), Blue Chicago (Peaches always brings it ) and Whole Foods is across the street for a quick stop in for organic wine and cheese to bring to the room. The doormen knew the answers to every question, could hail a cab in a moment and were fun to interact with. Elate makes a killer Bloody Mary, Mimosa and a Cobb salad to start your day off right, and the Lobby Bar was a great place to mingle with International travelers and have a nightcap. Looking for an eco-friendly, boutique hotel, downtown Chicago experience, try Hotel Felix, I will keep coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffwhatever
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews of this hotel and quite frankly expected less then what I got. I liked this hotel. Granted, the rooms are not roomy, so if you're traveling with a family you may want to look elsewhere, but if you're a couple or single this is a great place. Huge bed, flat screen TV, good mood lighting over the bed, and a large bathroom with a walk-in shower. Good location for nightlife as it's right about center of the north Rush St area or the south Hubbard St bars and clubs, so you can walk either way.

Reviews.Title: “Substandard Flair”
Reviews.Author: cspanophile
Reviews.Content: This was a 4* Priceline win, but I will not be bidding that zone (River North) again. Generally, I find Priceline's star levels to be accurate. Not this time. The hotel is far from a 4*. The Felix has wholly inadequate--almost ludicrously small--rooms. I was initially placed in a tiny room; but asked to be moved. This was done. The second room was marginally larger but, like the first, it lacked a closet; instead, there was a curtained-off niche which served as a kind of closet, though the bar for hanging clothes was a mere 15" or so in length. There was no dresser; indeed, there was no space even to leave a suitcase open on the floor. The room had sufficient room for the bed and almost nothing else. I have been in many hotels in Europe, so am accustomed to rooms that are small by American standards. I have never been in rooms there as small as those at the Felix. There were housekeeping problems, too. The rug in the room was filthy; when I pulled back the bedding to sleep, there were long blond hairs on it. (I have dark brown hair.) "The laundry must have missed it" was the explanation offered by a staffer. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Bogus roomservice charge was not refunded”
Reviews.Author: pscjac
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights and while the room was nice enough, it was tiny. Upon checking out we learned that someone (not us) ordered food and charged it to our room. We told the staff that there was a mistake, and we were told the charge would be removed. When we got home, we found out we were charged for the food. After calling the hotel, being put on hold, being ignored, forced to talk to several answering machines, basically being called a liar, and WEEKS of waiting, we were told our money would be refunded. But, it was never refunded!! Very unprofessional service..still trying to get through to someone who can help me out. Like I said, the hotel was nice enough, but definitely not worth the headache.

Reviews.Title: “Price good on priceline but would not recommend for more than one night”
Reviews.Author: lataskata
Reviews.Content: Positive: Location. It was in the heart of downtown and only a few blocks away from Michigan Ave. shops. Cleanliness. Negatives: Again, rooms extremely small - we are talking about really small. If you have more than one person staying with you, I wouldn't recommend staying more than one night as the cramped quarters gets old very quickly. There is hardly any space to put your suitcases, especially if you have more than one person in the room. Can hardly move around in room. Hallways and elevators are extremely small. Could barely walk two abreast in hallway and rooms are extremely close together and not well insulated. Could hear everything going on in hallway and also could hear loud traffic outside window 7 floors down. Rooms did not have coffee maker. People at front desk snooty when we asked if we had king size bed. Thought we had reserved room with king sized bed but were told rather snotty that they didn't have any king size bed rooms available. Would not want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: JBarath
Reviews.Content: Came to Chicago for a weekend trip with my husband and used Priceline to book the hotel. Got Hotel Felix for a great price, $75 per night. Yes, the room was small, but we really didn't need any more space then we had. We basically used the room to sleep and get ready, so it served its purpose. The bathroom was perfect, shower was wonderful. We loved the decor of the hotel. The valet and bellmen at the front were wonderful. Very attentive with getting our car, or a cab, or even giving us breakfast suggestions and directions to the various places we wanted to go. Great location, easy walking distance from lots of must see places. Recommend Yolk for breakfast just a couple blocks away and Iberico Cafe for tapas and sangria, also a couple blocks away. On our next weekend trip we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Lobby, helpful friendly staff, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: JudyFrost
Reviews.Content: A well-appointed room and comfortable bed. Staff resturant suggestions were right on, for a late Sunday night meal and Monday breakfast. The lobby is both chic and cozy. A great location. Walking distance to all the best Chicago shopping while being on the interesting edge of the city.

Reviews.Title: “If you are traveling with kids, Hotel Felix is not the hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: MJS07
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Felix using Priceline for my family and me. We were shocked when we got this boutique hotel, as we have successfully used priceline in the past for many family outings in the city. We definitely were hesitant once I read the reviews. We checked in at 3:30 and they did not have two queen beds available. We were then told that if we can wait 30 minutes they will have a room ready. Great! We took the kids to dinner (and told them we would be back in an hour). We got back to the hotel a little after 5:00 and the room was still not ready. We finally got into our room at 5:30. During our wait, a hotel representative came out and gave us two drink tickets (a glass of wine was $11 each) and two boxes of chocolates for the kids. This was not a great start since the hotel lobby alone is not kid friendly. I felt like I had to keep shushing my kids (8, 6, and 3). We finally got into our room with two double beds. Oh my, this is the SMALLEST room I have ever stayed in. I stayed in much larger rooms in Europe and New York. I completely agree with one reviewer that stated it is smaller than a cruise ship room. We had no more than a few feet between the wall and bed. I nailed my leg on the bed frame pretty good navigating between kids and luggage and I am sure our hotel neighbors heard me scream. Again, this is not a kid friendly hotel! The bed seemed smaller length wise (both my husband and mine were hanging off). The bathroom was clean, the middle table with the clock and lamp has never been dusted. The HVAC was loud and rattled throughout the nightâ€¦a sign that this was an older building with updates. There was no desk for working â€“ it was a small table with a tiny lamp â€“ not sure how useful that would be. Although the free wi-fi did work well. In the morning, my husband went down for complimentary coffee and they forgot to refill the pot at 8:30 AM and again at 9:30 â€“ not 4-star service as itâ€™s listed on Priceline. This is the first time I have ever done a review. I cannot stress how disappointed this hotel was labeled 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Schwanky”
Reviews.Author: standndlvr
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel in the hustle of Chicago. No doubt the rooms are small, think European. But I'm in the city and not hanging out in the room all day. Free wireless and free computer access paid for themselves. Nice decor, staff was eager to please. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmmeyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at this hotel for one night to get away. I booked it on priceline so it was a nice surprize staying at this hotel. The lobby and rooms where beautiful. I had read some reviews that said the rooms were small but I think we had plenty of space. The bathroom has a shelf next to the sink to but all your hair and makeup products. They also have a complimentry room with computers to use, we looked up show times for the night. Tapas restaurant around the corner has good food and even better sangria.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy Dormroom”
Reviews.Author: jskcnski
Reviews.Content: We love Chicago. Priceline, 4 Stars and we got Hotel Felix this time. It should be 3 stars. Nice place, VERY small rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel with personality and great service”
Reviews.Author: Jessica-and-Nick
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here over her birthday. The hotel lobby is absolutely beautiful with a bar, fireplace, and a pond. The staff was great and willing to fetch cabs or answer questions about nearby attractions. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The bath products are locally made and of great quality. The only thing we would have liked to see in the room was a refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: dm2345
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on priceline for $70/night. It said it was a 4-star...not sure on that but I'm still very happy with the hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 9 am thinking we'd check bags with the bellman and move on but were very happy to be able to check in to our room...this is probably not common, so I wouldn't expect it. The staff was very friendly and courteous. The rooms are not huge, but have more than ample space. Bed was very comfortable, pillows were on the soft side lacking much neck support. The bathroom was the least desirable part of the hotel, but don't take it as being bad. The shower curtain was about a foot too narrow, there were no tissues in the room, we were missing a bath towel the 2nd day, there's no fan and the sink looks good but doesn't function that well. These however are minor problems. Felix is right between the Chicago CTA stops on the Brown and Red lines, so you have convenient public transportation. There are many great restaurants in the area...Fogo De Chao is a must!! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here the next time we are in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: SB668
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at other smaller hotels in Chicago, but none of them took pride in their establishment the way Hotel Felix does. The moment you arrive, you notice it's high level of quality and detail. Polite, professional doormen will greet you - even in a driving snow storm. Then upon entry, a fire in the fireplace, beautiful decor, calming and relaxed atmosphere. Yes, the rooms are small. Some say miniature, some say cozy - but let's face it. This is a big city and you aren't going to find a large room that well decorated at that level of service at that price. Not going to happen. We stayed in the first night - the beds are super comfortable. Breakfast in the morning at Elate was delectable! The French Toast was amazing and the standard Bacon/Eggs was delicious. This hotel is located just off Michigan Avenue. We walked all along Michigan Avenue, to see The Bean, Christkindle Market and to the top of the Hancock Tower. These walks were no problem. Navy Pier might be a bit much but still doable. The aquarium, etc would be too far. But the parking at Hotel Felix gives free In/Out service so you can drive and park if you'd like or take a cab. Hotel Felix's theme is Happy. We were happy to have stayed and we will be happy to return!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! What a great hidden Treasure!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bbradd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel felix with friends this past weekend and had a great time. First and foremost the staff was incredible. The front desk staff was especially helpfull and knowledgeable about the city. Always welcomed us back with a smile and the rooms were impecable. I can't wait for my next trip to chicago to stay at Hotel Felix. As for the reviewer's that say the rooms are small. Well the are cozy however very well designed. Also besides sleeping there is nothing else you are going to do. You are in Chicago and the purpose of the trip is to enjoy the city not stay in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice decor, but "miniature" is the theme”
Reviews.Author: dc607
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with two of our friends booked 2 rooms at the Hotel Felix in Chicago, IL for 1/16/11 through Priceline's "name your own price" feature. First of all, I have to say that we couldn't beat the price we got ($50 each before taxes)! The hotel has a great lobby that is decorated in very trendy decor with a very warm, long fireplace located next to a sitting area near the bar. The hotel was very clean and the staff was generally friendly, although they didn't really say much to me at check-in our check-out, and come to think of it didn't even thank me for staying there at check-out. Our room was also fairly quiet to street noise, but there was quite a bit of noise noticeable from the room next door. Reading previous TA reviews, we all expected small rooms, but "small" kind of seems like an understatement for something that priceline classifies as a 4 star hotel. "Miniature" seemed like a better description of our rooms. The biggest issue that we were disappointed with was the complete lack of space in our room! There was barely enough room for me to squeeze by the desk at the foot of our bed to get around to the area on my side of the bed near the window (I had to turn sideways and scoot by the desk chair just to get past it, and I don't see how I could have moved the chair to anywhere else in the room). In addition, there was barely enough room to put my feet down on the side on the bed when sitting on the bed or getting up out of bed. It seemed like the so called queen size bed did not appear to be a queen sized bed as it was much smaller than a typical queen sized bed, and the pillows they gave you to sleep with were squares that were about half the size of a typical pillow - "miniature". Also, there was barely any closet to speak of (literally a hole in the wall with a curtain in front of it), and the faucet in the bathroom barely had any space underneath the nozzle where you were able to rinse your hands with water while washing your hands (and to complicate matters, we had a slow drain, so my hands got dipped in the sink water every time I went to wash my hands). The shower was probably the most spacious part of our entire room and was very nice. Again, I was pleased with the price we received for these 2 rooms, along with the service, cleanliness of the rooms, and the decor, but for Priceline to categorize this as a 4 star hotel seems extremely misleading given that the rooms are barley big enough to walk around in and that on Priceline's website it states that 4 star hotels "...offer a wide selection of amenities with the guest's comfort in mind". I hardly consider this a hotel where the guest's comfort was in mind in terms of the size of the rooms! If you get this hotel through the name your own price feature on Priceline, it is an okay hotel for $50, but if you are thinking of booking this hotel by your own choice, I would look for a hotel with bigger rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Darling Boutique hotel---such a great value”
Reviews.Author: LIDChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Felix for one night, in Jan 2011. It was a girls weekend, celebrating my bday. We booked 2 rooms on Priceline and were amazed at the value for such an adorable hotel (ideally located). Our experience curbside with the bellmen was above par. They offer exceptional service and make you feel like a true vip. They even helped us arrange for limo service for the night, at a STEAL. The only disappointment had to do with the actual check in. Stay clear of Claudia!!! Her attitude is harsh. When I went back later in the evening to ask her fellow staff member what her name was, he joked "that's how she is"....... Sad if you ask me. The rooms are small as many reviews say but not any smaller than most other big city hotels (try rooms in New York/Paris/etc). The rooms are decorated beautifully (very chic and modern). The bathroom was a big surprise (practically the same size as the room). We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Its fun but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Snowman00
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix is hip, attractive, quirky and small. Lots of reviews start with the small rooms, and I'll get to that. But I liked that the hotel is small. It's not some 1,000 room chain. The lobby is compact but efficient, with great design elements. I spent time there just hangin' in the morning drinking the free coffee and reading a free newspaper. Check-in was fast and the clerk was friendly and when he made a minor goof, cutely self-deprecating. Maybe he liked us, or maybe it was the luck of the computer assigning a room, but we got 12th (top) floor, with a view north across Huron St. As a Priceline booking, it was indeed a queen room, but I think it was one of the somewhat larger 1Q rooms. I could easily get around the room, there was a bag stand and I could fit a 'carry-on max' roller bag on it between the beside table and the desk. Liked the full-laptop sized in-room safe, too. I thought the room decor was cool, I liked the color choices, and the halogen lights over the bed -- very Vegas. I didn't try to read, I could imagine that this was not great task lighting. Bed was very comfy. One complaint - not just of this hotel - is having a plush down comforter that is way too effective/warm for the ambient room temp. How about a spring-weight down duvet? Still looks great but not so stifling. It was that or just a sheet: hot or cold. I heard about iffy WiFi so brought a LAN cable and that worked well in the room - I'd recommend it, it's more secure that open WiFi (I think) and didn't hiccup once. Desk was small but very workable, solidly built, and I liked the desk chair. The thermostat was weird: When I set the temp, it first ran the a/c, then just fan, then heat, all for the same 69 deg setting. It was a little noisy. Quieter than many thru-the-wall units in low-rise motels, but still a compressor noise near the bathroom which was odd. HVAC noise didn't keep me up, I don't think, once I found how to have the fan run continuously. I also heard too much of my neighbors plumbing, and several neighbor's door "ka-chunks!". Didn't get a great sleep, in fact. I think despite $30M in remodels, they may have cheaped on the between-room insulation, or couldn't totally overcome the old buildings internals. The bathroom, though, was great. Compact, but nice style and a great, great shower. I loved the big green shower tile! I did not love the TP made from recycled paper - very coarse. There just has to be softer "green" TP out there!! Overall, I thought this was a fun, interesting boutique hotel. Friendly staff, no hassles for being Priceline (got extended checkout with ease, too), I enjoyed the lively yet cozy lobby space. Someone recommended Yolk, 3 blks away, for breakfast, and I second that! I also agree with reviews that say this isn't a 4 star hotel. It's a nice specialty hotel with a few issues (poor noise separation between rooms, some rooms tiny - the folks across were packing and leaving and I saw their 1Q room was really, really small). To class this with the real Magnificent Mile 4-star properties would be a mistake. If you get a deal on price vs. the big name big hotels, take it, and try it for a short stay. Its fun but not perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy design and attractive though small rooms, aloof service, street noise”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: Pros: Trendy contemporary design aesthetic of lobby, restaurant, and room. Room and bathroom were pleasantly designed and tastefully furnished although small. Breakfast was quite good but expensive and service very slow, which is not ideal on a business trip. Decent in-room safe for laptop. Free in-room wireless internet. Room small enough to make ironing a bit of a challenge but not too bad. Location was good, fairly short cabs to Navy Pier and Michigan Ave. Cons: Found the night front desk person in particular to be borderline snooty and aloof. Day staff were a little better, but still less than friendly. Parking was across the street in an open, unstaffed shared parking lot and expensive around $40 a night. Windows in this old building were single-paned and thin, meaning I heard street noise from pedestrians and cars all night and had trouble sleeping. Would consider a stay here again but request a quieter room non-streetside.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hr588
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, friendly and a great location. Why do I say avoid it? The room is so small that you can't even move around. There are about 18" from the side of the bed to the wall all the way around. At the end of the bed there is what is supposed to be a desk. There is a chair in the corner for the desk but there isn't room to put the chair. You have to sit on the bed and lean over to use the desk. The suitcases must be set on their end and put along the wall. There is nowhere else to put them. There is a tiny closet that has a little curtain on it (and the luggage won't fit in there). I hate to ramble on about the room size but it's just not functional for more than one person. I also stayed here a month or two ago and the room was a little bigger and I was alone and I dealt with it but I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a four star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Grayfetti
Reviews.Content: Do not Priceline this hotel if you are expecting a four star hotel, it is a three star at best. My husband and I took a chance with Priceline requesting four star or better and were so disapointed with this hotel that we gave up our room and checked into the Marriott, a true four star hotel. Of course, we gave up the money we paid for Hotel Felix as Priceline is non refundable, but the Marriott completely understood our disapointment and at no extra cost, upgraded us to a suite on the 46th floor with a stunning view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Small room made up for by great service”
Reviews.Author: dthiel
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a few days to visit relatives and took a chance on staying at a new place. What a pleasant surprise. The room wasn't the largest hotel room I've ever seen but the customer service made all the difference. When travelling over the holidays it's always a bonus when the people around you go out of their way to make you feel comfortable a cared for. I work in a customer service field and know good service, so kudos to the staff at the Hotel Felix.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to all the TA reviews”
Reviews.Author: travelbarb
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the TA reviews, there were no surprises. Queen room small, but I was expecting smaller. We had a total of 8 pieces of luggage and shopping bags and with care managed not to trip over anything. Doormen very friendly and helpful. Desk staff not so, but not rude. Just bland. Coffee service in lobby until 10 AM, unless it runs out at 9:45 AM, which it did and the not so friendly desk staff said they would not be making any more. Plan on returning to Chicago this summer and unless Priceline changes its rating, will probably get stuck here again. Would never pick this hotel, but for $60 or less a night, you are getting good price to value.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Accomondations - Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: jpdombrow
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Chicago for my daughterâ€™s birthday. The location was close to shopping and one very fine restaurant. The room was clean and comfortable. We did missed not having a coffee machine. We arrived at the hotel on 12/26/2010 and the staff was not prepared to handle the number of reservations. Out first room was not ready at 2pm and we are unable to get into our second room until 7:15 pm. It was very inconvenient getting ready for dinner with four people and one bathroom. What disturbed us the most was after we checked out on the following day. We left our GPS device in the room. We noticed it within 20 minutes of checking out and called the front desk. They took little interest in my request to have someone go to the room ASAP and instead forwarded my call to housekeeping where I got to leave a message. I called about 20 minutes later after we had an opportunity to check our luggage and again we were told to leave a message with housekeeping. Later in the day I finally convinced someone to check the room. Bottom line is that we were responsible for leaving the GPS device but their reaction to this problem was slow and in the meantime the device was taken from the room and never recovered.

Reviews.Title: “What a shame - could have been a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdtraveler2011
Reviews.Content: Rarely have I read bad reviews on tripadvisor and found them to all be almost completely true. The location of the hotel was fantastic and the rooms were quite clean. That said, the rest of my stay was quite disappointing. The front desk staff while not rude was certainly not friendly and did not go out of their way to help as a "4 star" hotel should. The elevators were consistently slow, and the rooms...well they are cozy. I stayed in a king room that reminded me of the "coffin hotels" in Tokyo. The lighting in the rooms is horrible, the heater woke me up every time it jolted on, the legs on the desk fell off and the desk lamp did not work. The internet is complementary, though high speed is quite an exaggeration. The bathroom sink while pretty, is totally not usable as the faucet is 4 inches from the basin - can barely wash your hands. Shower was decent, and the bath amenities while very nice (h20) were never restocked. All in all, save your money - this hotel needs to be revamped, restaffed, and taken over by a different company.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly Small”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynBen
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix is not a 4-star hotel. It is a former SRO that was once occupied by crack addicts and the homeless that has had new beds and flat screen televisions put into it. The hallways are narrow and shabby. The elevators are slow. The lobby is kitsch. My room is literally the size of a prison cell. The window is not much larger than what you would find in a prison. The closet is so small they can't even have a door for it. It is little more than a curtain. The room is so small I wish they had not put the tiny bathroom in it. I don't mind shared bathrooms if it means you don't feel like you're in jail. There is simply no reason what so ever to stay at this hotel. For an extra $10-$20 a night you can stay in far superior hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Sheek and Modern All Wrapped Up in One”
Reviews.Author: lajoys81
Reviews.Content: I got a nice price through priceline which you could'nt beat. I read the reviews and saw pictures of the hotel on tripadvisor and had my doubts. Upon arrival I was greeted by the doorman and bellman and I must say that they were the most courteous people I have ever met during a hotel stay in Chicago. I wanna say Charles and Benjamin were the stuff!!!!!! They ask you do you have your cell phone and your wallet upon exiting the cabs, which made you double check before the cab left the scene, which I truely appreciate. Checking in was simple and fast no King bed was available, but I expected that due to me being a late check in. Beautiful Lobby and clean hallways tells you alot about the hotel. I entered my room and yes it was a bit on the small side, but as you get aquainted the size grows on you( Have to keep in mind this is a boutique hotel). The bed was to die for sooo comfortable and the showers lets just say I didnt mind taking 2 or 3 a day.... OMG and the curtains(which completely darkens the room incase you doint want the sun shining into your room on an early day) and the computer chair to the desk I just wanted to take home. Great theme colors for the room! Housekeeping was very prompt upon calling for additional wash clothes and towels! My bestfriend and I really do appreciate Benjamin he was of great help he helped us with finding the latest spots to party during New Years Eve and very approachable. He has a good spirit. :) My friend forgot a few of her toiletries and the concierge desk carry complimentary toothbrushes and toothpaste and that was a great help even though there is a Walgreens around the corner.The Fitness Center was a bit on the small side, but carried the latest and modern equipment and also a spa around the corner from the fitness area. I am use to staying at the Hyatt Regency on East Wacker Drive, but I believe Hotel Felix has won me over as a consumer. I cant wait to return..........GREAT SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family trip into the city”
Reviews.Author: Belikinbeer
Reviews.Content: Our check in was very easy and the staff was professional and personable. We knew in advance the rooms would be samll and thankfully did not have a lot of lugagge as that could quickly become a challenge. The hotel allows you to walk to Michigan avenue in about 10 minutes and has decent access to many good restaurants. Given the location, you feel more like you are city dweller versus a tourist. Our rating was based mostly on small things, such as not really having a dedicated concierge service...would stay there again for the value, convenience and ammenities...

Reviews.Title: “Worst 4 Star Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: arochkus
Reviews.Content: Felix Hotel 12/26 â€“ Room 1211 â€¢Very Small Room â€“ Approx 8â€™x10â€™. â€¢Queen Bed Only. â€¢Spa robe 1 size fits all. Not made for a large man. Could not close it. â€¢Narrow counter/desk at foot of bed. Could not sit in chair at desk comfortably. â€¢No other seat in room. â€¢Closet 2/5â€™ wide & 2â€™deep. Could not fit standard suitcase. â€¢Â½ roll of toilet Paper â€“ Had to ask for an additional roll. â€¢No coffee in room. Had to go to mezzanine in AM to get coffee. â€¢Heater very noisy. Woke me up at least 4 times during the night. At first thought it was an alarm. 12/27 â€¢Called manager in the morning. She stated something must be wrong, as heater should not be that noisy. Sent an engineer. He stated noise level was loud due to size of room and condenser was so close. Called to find me a less noisy room. Mover to room 1018. Room 1018 â€¢Larger room / seemed to not be used recently. â€¢View was a construction site. â€¢Missing toiletries / Called for housekeeping â€¢Small leather box for toiletries missing. â€¢Leg on Desk broke. / Had to straighten leg. â€¢Desk chipped up â€¢Heater made less noise, but still louder than accustomed to in a 4 star Hotel. I turned off heat at night to make sure I could sleep. â€¢Ice machine on floor did not work. Had to go to the 12th floor to get ice. 12/28 â€¢Ordered Breakfast (2 eggs, potatoes, bacon, toast total $20.00) Not what I expected from a 4 star hotel. Small portions of potatoes, 1 slice of toast, small craft of coffee, no butter, jelly, salt & pepper Room probably worth $65.00 per night, which is what I paid through Priceline, but I am accustomed to getting a â€œdeal.â€� This was no deal. Worst hotel I have stayed in while in Chicago in years. I usually stay in 4 star and 3 star hotels in Chicago. (Palmer House, Hyatt, Holiday Inn, Silver Smith, Hard Rock, Ambassador East, Wyndham, Marriott & InterContinental) Good luck if there are 2 of you. You will be bumping into each other and have no room for you luggage

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want from a hotel stay.”
Reviews.Author: pepermint28
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Chicago, and the hotel stay just made the whole trip a huge success. The service was great, the rooms were very clean and the beds were incredibly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms the size of a closet”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: If I paid the going rate, which was $125 a night, when we stayed at the Felix on December 26th, I would have be disappointed. Instead, we used Priceline's "Name your own Price" feature and got the room for $56 a night, which made the tight confines easier to swallow. We were in room 1006, a King bedded room. Pros: comfortable bed nice bath products Whole Foods down the street Free, fast internet Great TV Cons: ROOMS THE SIZE OF A STAMP. I warned my husband to be careful when walking around the bed, which was a tight squeeze, because it was easy to bang your shin. He banged his shin four times, and it isn't because he is a slow learner. It is because you just don't EXPECT a two inch clearance when you move around in a room. NOISY HEATING UNIT. We ended up turning it off because of the sound of vibrating metal when the unit ran. The room stayed nicely warm with the unit off. IF SOMEONE IS AT THE DESK, the other person has to climb over them in order to get past them. The walk to the el station (Red line) was about five blocks, which is fine in nice weather and LONG when it is freezing and blowing. We prefer to stay closer to Michigan Ave. If we were paying full fare, this would NOT be our choice. For the same price, you can get a bigger room in a better location. When we are waiting to see if our 'bid' will be accepted via Priceline's "Name Your Own Price" feature, we usually chant "Not the Felix! Not the Felix! Please, not the Felix!" This time - it was.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: poinsda
Reviews.Content: In Chicago for a short business trip (3 days). We were able to book this hotel at a reasonable price through Priceline. Felt right at home and comfortable in this hotel. Rooms are on the small side, but not too cramped. The restuarant next door and onsite lounge were very convenient after a busy work day. Would definitely recommend for a short stay in town.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is nice. Rooms are small, but very nice and clean.”
Reviews.Author: leastewart68
Reviews.Content: I got this room through Priceline ($65/night) thinking I was getting a 5 star hotel. While this hotel is nice, it is definitely not a 5 star quality hotel. I was ready for a small room, but the room is REALLY small. We had a room with a queen bed and there is barely enough room to walk around the bed with our bags shoved up against the outside wall. We were in room 1109. From the end of the bed to the wall is 2'. From the side of the bed closest to the window, where there is a small desk, there is 3'. From the side of the bed interior, there is 2' and a small bed table. I hope that gives you an idea of the size of the room. I am a frequent European traveler and I am used to small hotel rooms, but this room is smaller than I anticipated. The TV is awesome. The room and bathroom are very clean and there is great quality linens on the bed. The staff have been very nice and helpful. I asked if they had a brochure for the Museum of Science and Industry and they told me that they don't have brochures. This seems odd to me, but since this is a very 'green' hotel, I understand. Wifi is free and fast. Hotel is in a fantastic area!

Reviews.Title: “Had great time at hotel Felix”
Reviews.Author: shannonstark05
Reviews.Content: this hotel was perfect for the price. I went with a group of 6 and it was modern and what a great location. The staff was very nice also

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay with everything at your fingertips”
Reviews.Author: Meems07
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel as a romantic holiday getaway. As soon as you walk in, you can feel the warmth of the fireplace and were greeted by a nice staff. Hotel Valet is 42.00 but if you park your car yourself in the lot across the street its 32.00. It was a good tip given to us by the bell hop. We used the fitness center which is extremely up to date with all new equipment, tvs attached to each machine. We even paid a visit to Asha Salon which is onsite. The entire hotel was redone so everything is brand new and beautiful. Do not expect the largest spaces in the world, but they did a great job of keeping the decor minimal but modern. The location was extremely close to shopping (state street) and to the Daley center for us to be able to visit the Christkindlmarket and check out the giant christmas tree. We ate dinner at Elate restaurant which is next door to the hotel. You do not have to walk outside of the hotel for it. The menu is not the largest in selection, but what we ordered was very tasty. It was a beautiful stay for my husband and I.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jrb953
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife in October 2010 for 1 night. We got the room from priceline for $75 a night. What a great hotel! The rooms are small but let's be honest, it is located in the heart of the city. I've stayed at the hotel felix, inn of chicago, and best western river north and all 3 have tiny rooms! Hotel Felix has a leg up on the other 2 because of the great beds! Just booked another trip to Chicago and will be staying at hotel felix. Got 4 nights for $60 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: alsk
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel and I thought it was great! The decor is very modern, the rooms were clean with comfy beds and large walk-in showers and the staff was friendly. They had free internet in-room and we used the business center to print boarding passes before we left. The location was just a few blocks from Michigan Avenue, with great bus routes closeby, plus there are some good restaurants right around the block. No, the rooms aren't huge but our Queen room had plenty of space for us.

Reviews.Title: “Small room bothered my wife... otherwise, quite good”
Reviews.Author: trowca
Reviews.Content: Very hip, cool decor, great shower, quality furnishings, cool lobby, very friendly front desk staff, close to River North action. Only the room size was an issue, but the rooms are actually very efficiently laid out.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms smaller than a litter box”
Reviews.Author: farm2fork
Reviews.Content: The location was very good since it was close to many restaurants and Michigan Avenue. We felt safe walking around at night looking for places to eat and drink. The lobby and bar decoration was contemporary, nice deep colors and to top it off it smelled very good. The rooms were tiny, the queen sized bed took up all but 2-3 feet surrounding it. No real closet or space for your luggage. The tv is on the wall right on top of the tiny desk. Pictures attached.... Not a place for a long stay or for those looking to spend a lot of time in their room. You are definitely paying for location alone at Hotel Felix.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Nahant_Snique
Reviews.Content: I didn't plan on staying in a hotel when visiting Chicago until our host notified us that the accommodations would be limited at his home. Therefore, I got on Expedia and found the Hotel Felix. The rate was reasonable and I could get a room with two doubles. The bar was nice, lobby clean and sleek. I thought our room was of ample size for a city hotel (though my friends staying with me did not agree). We didn't use many of the amenities, but the gym was nice and the location allowed us to get around by cab for a reasonable price. There's also a Whole Foods down that street that is perfect for picking up meals to go, etc.

Reviews.Title: “happiness was my stay @ this green and modernized hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tam29
Reviews.Content: Ioved my weekend stay @ this hotel. Friendly front desk,doormen and enjoyed my hour massage. Room had nice view from the 12th floor, very comfortable bed and enjoyed the H20 product's in the bathroom. I disliked the scratchy towel's and not enough hanger's in the small closet space. I booked with priceline.com and for the price and location can not let those few dislike's prevent myself drom returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK as a 3*...but this IS NOT a 4* as Priceline categorizes it!”
Reviews.Author: MrClean57
Reviews.Content: Rooms are SO SMALL it overshadows any of the positives (location good, bed very comfy, new modern decor). It was equivalent to a youth hostel in Europe....seriously. Only a queen bed in the room but it was too cramped for only a couple to move about without banging knees on the bed frame. "Closet" consisted of only a 12 inch pole in a corner with a curtian to cover it....could not fit all hanging clothes on it (2 adults for 2 days but included heavy winter coats). Surrounding rooms water was VERY loud when showers run or toilets flushed, and HVAC system was very loud. Simply put, room was just too small to be acceptable at any star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, convenient location, service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: jasonc_10
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly from our arrival, helpful throughout our visit, and even left us with a parting gift as we went on our merry way. Enjoyed the room, comfortable bed, and close to all our destinations downtown. We grabbed breakfast from the restaurant next door - very hearty. Quite enjoyed it. Also liked the nice touches on the sustainability front - the hotel is Silver LEED certified, our meal was served in paper packaging / cardboard, even the water bottles are compostable. And yes - the rooms are small (or at least ours was - booked on Hotwire) but perfectly ample and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Felix--Fun & Fancy”
Reviews.Author: 4VICCI
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Thanksgiving weekend in KING room (904) and were very impressed by this otherwise unknown hotel. I was quite concerned when I read previous posts warning to stay away from Hotel Felix Others complained about the tiny closet. True it is tiny--my solution, get more hangers! Also, our bed contained three large drawers in the foot of the bed capable of holding all our clothes. Our bathroom was huge. The sink is a modern design, very shallow. Anyone with 1/2 a brain knows you will splash water if you turn on too much pressure. Also, this room (904) was designed for the wheelchair-bound, with peepholes for the former in addition to the standard one. Ice is on even floors only. Lovey robes, lush towels and bedding. Convenient reader lamps at each side of bed. Great location, very upbeat and fancy. The decor makes it fun and a lovely subject to photograph. Very attentive door and desk personnel. Superb [Aveda] Spa Asha is on the second floor. I had a Killer massage which was the best I'd ever had. Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but DEFINITELY not a 4 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: slkooiman
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with what we got from this supposed 4 star hotel. The room was miniscule - smaller than an office cubicle. We had no room to maneuver around on another in the little floor space and there wasn't even a closet! No mini fridge, very small bathroom, extremely shallow sink, scratchy robe. Wireless Internet is included for free, which is a nice bonus. Lobby is swanky, beds are clean and comfy, but the 4 star rating is very misleading. We used Priceline and ended up still feeling like we'd been deceived. That being said, it was an easy walk to Michigan Ave and just around the corner from several wonderful eat spots. Check out Orange on Clark St. for wonderful breakfast! For the price we paid via Priceline, it was a decent value. Still, no way this was a 4 star level. Seek elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teach2727
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the valet guys were great. When we got up to our room, my husband and I both laughed out loud because we couldn't believe that this was really the size of our room. It was so small; unbelievable. I was charmed at the thought of great spa products, slippers, and a cozy bathrobe. However, upon entering the bathroom, I saw a nasty, used, dried up washcloth hanging over the shower, barely any toilet paper, and NO bathrobe. I called the front desk, they quickly gave us a new room but no upgrade for the inconvenience. One day we called for our car out of valet parking. We were told to give it 15 minutes so we visited the spa after we requested the car. Twenty minutes later our car was still not there. Finally I asked and was told that the guy never sent in the request so then we waited another 15 minutes. Positives? The neighborhood was cute. The walk was 6 blocks to the Mile. Giordano's was 5 blocks away, grocery store nearby, easy access to 94. We have already booked our trip for next year; it is NOT at the Hotel Felix.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ushela03
Reviews.Content: So you can read all the other reviews on here about the rooms. The room we had was small... beyond small, it was tiny. I booked through priceline and was very happy with the price. I then called ahead and requested a king size bed. The woman on the phone said she was "pretty sure" that it would be accomadated. When i requested a king at the desk they said they didn't have any. When later in the stay I went to see if any King bed were available i heard a hotel employee tell another guest that if you book through a 3rd party they will only give you a queen. The queen rooms seem to be on the corners of the hotels and are REALLY small. you can only walk around the bed. Things that were great about the hotel... Location - a few blocks to the "L" and a whole foods down the street was nice. You can easily walk to the Hancock tower and Mag. Mile. The shower in the room was terrific. I'm very tall and I loved the high shower head. We flew a red eye from LA which arrived in Chicago at 5am. Went right to the hotel with the expecation of just dropping off our bags and our room was ready. It was very nice to get a few hours of sleep in the morning. Negatives... Room size was even smaller than I imagined. Front desk staff seemed disinterested in general. I banged my leg on the side of the bed twice... partly do to the small room and partly due to the frame. Final Verdict... I wouldn't pay more than the $120 a night I paid from priceline. Its a great location and it looks nice. Be ready for a small room (Smaller than you think even if you are prepared for a small room).

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jolotraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a nice boutique hotel, with very friendly desk staff and valet service. It was also nice that they offer complimentary coffee each morning in the hotel lobby, free wireless throughout the hotel and a business center with free internet service and printing. Yet, the rooms in the hotel are extremely small. This was upsetting since I was staying for an extended period of time, more than one work week, and didn't have adequate space to put my things. This was probably the smallest room I have ever stayed in, smaller than rooms in New York City. My room was only slightly larger than my queen sized bed, allowing only enough room to open the front door, which again, didn't provide enough space to hold my luggage. Since the room is so tiny, the desk was placed right in front of the television (on the same wall!). As well, I could hear the noise from the hallway and other guests coming in and out of their rooms since my bed was literally right at the front door. Though the room was well groomed and stocked with complimentary toiletries and a very nice flat screen TV, I would not stay again since the size of the room made my stay uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Front Desk Staff - Didn't feel welcome so won't be staying again”
Reviews.Author: jamiet747
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the makings of a solid entry level boutique hotel but is totally let down by the miserable and unhelpful attitude of the front desk staff. I stayed this week and most of my colleagues also staying at the hotel echoed these sentiments. If I was the manager of this hotel I'd promptly be setting up some basic customer service training for the front desk team. On the flip side, the most charming and helpful person at the hotel was the bell captain. Great shame to have such inconsistency in the service quality.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: jrtravelor
Reviews.Content: hotel is small, unfriendly and offers nothing.......my advice is to stay clear of hotel felix

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: spierard
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive about the hotel after ready some of the reviews; however, I must say that I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was great. The room was smaller than most hotels that I have stayed in but was very clean. I know some have commented on the sink being shallow (not more than 2 inches deep) but that wasn't a big ordeal to me. There is no tub in the bathroom but for me that wasn't an issue either as I am more of a shower girl. Loved the shower. Ample room and the products that they provide were from H2O, Loved the products so much went to Michigan Avenue and bought some to bring home. The bedding is luxurious. Had one of the best night sleeps and that was considering we were the room right next to the elevators. The hotel is also in a great location. I would definately stay here again on a trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient hotel - but could use some improvement”
Reviews.Author: PuckOTG22
Reviews.Content: I left the Hotel Felix with mixed emotions. First, the hotel has a great, chic interior. The lobby is nice overall and the lounge areas are fantastic. The hotel staff was always helpful but there were a few things that really irritated me. First - and this seems silly - but the stupid door signs kept falling off. You think its silly until you have the maid knocking at your door at 8am because the sign fell off the door. The maid walked in several times. Crazy! Second - like others have seen - the sink is CRAZY shallow. Like, maybe 2 inches or something. You can't even wash you hands under it. It works ok for brushing your teeth I guess. The walls inside the room are thin. You can hear most everything going on outside the room and in other rooms. So, that was awkward sometimes!! LOL And finally - the room itself is minuscule. You can't pull out the desk chair without hitting the bed in the single rooms. And if you want to sit in the chair to watch tv - its above the desk so its like sitting in the front row at a movie theatre. But, I did love the shower and the choice of soaps/lotions they give you. The towels were fine but I've felt better. The bed was super comfy and so were the pillows and linens. And the beds did have drawers under them so you can pull them out and store things inside them. Overall - it was a nice hotel room - but if you plan on bringing a few friends with you - don't attempt to get more than 2 people into any of the rooms. We upgraded from a 1 bed to a 2 bed room. And even with the 2 bed room (which has more space) my friend and I were walking all over each other. But, to reiterate - I'd still recommend the hotel. The people were friendly. The hotel was convenient to the red line and some busses. You are just around the corner from a walgreens, eggsperience (great breaksfast), portillo's (best hot dogs!), Gino's East (Chicago Pizza) and just a few blocks from Michigan avenue and all the shopping. You are also across the street from a liquor store and just down from a grocery (Whole Foods). It was so convenient. I loved the location. Sure, it was small - but it was nice, pretty, modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Miniscule Rooms - not a Four Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nomyname
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Hotel Felix and I have to agree with everything that other posters have stated. The rooms are miniscule, the non-closet is just a space in the wall with a curtin on a rod and the bathroom was tiny as well. The bathroom sink had a depth of just over 2 inches! Not great if you need to hand wash a top. I have to agree with the review given by ANN-70. In no way is this a 4 star hotel. I would barely call it a 3 star. Just because they furnished it with minimalist furniture and play world music in the lobby doesn't make it a boutique hotel. The only saving grace was we didn't spend much time in the room, even when it rained all day we would rather be anywhere else than in that claustrophobic room. I booked this hotel using Priceline and I agree that they misrepresent this as a 4 star. The value wasn't there for the price I paid. There are many other hotels in Chicago that are a lot better for a slightly higher price and with better rooms. I know better for next time. The best thing I can say for this hotel is that the Whole Foods Market was 2 blocks up the street. That was very convinient.

Reviews.Title: “We love Hotel Felix! Awesome place to stay, & we'll stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: CaseWalk
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just got back from a "girls trip" to Chicago and stayed at Hotel Felix....and it was awesome! I would highly recommend this hotel! -The location was great! We actually bought multiple-day transit passes when we first got to Chicago, and ended up not using them b/c it was so convenient to walk everywhere from our hotel! -The hotel staff was fantastic! The front doormen were so friendly and always helpful (especially with directions)! The front desk people were also great! Ask for Ashley - she went above and beyond the whole time we were there to help make sure our visit was fantastic! -The decor of the hotel is very chic and creative, in a modern minimalist style. The rooms are clean and lovely, and the beds were super comfortable! The queen rooms are nice, but the king rooms have a lot more space (we stayed in both :). -Ask for the red Chicago guide book (from Ashley at the front desk), and use it for restaurant suggestions! We chose several spots that were recommended to us by friends and also in that book, and we were not disappointed! -We will definitely stay at Hotel Felix again next time we are in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “DISSAPOINTED! NOT A FOUR STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Ann-70
Reviews.Content: Just came back from spending a week in Chicago for a business trip that I decided to combine with Leisure over the weekend. Unfortunately the Felix Hotel did not fulfill my expectations for either purpose of my trip. This hotel is NOT a Four star property, as per Mobile or AAA standards. Below are a few reasons why: 1. Ridicously small rooms (even for a boutique hotel) 2. No coffe maker in room 3. Poor quality of bath towels 4. Bath amenities are not replaced consistently 5. Closet is just a rod with a curtain in a narrow space. 6. Extremly slow Internet service. 7. Bed linens are of poor quality (already feel worn out) As to the staff, you should fire everybody except the maids and doormen. These are the only persons that acknowledge you and don't mind questions you might have. Front Desk staff seems to have an attitude. One day I had to use the business center and noticed the lights were turned off. Upon entering the business center I found two employees using the computers to surf the internet. I told them that I would turn the lights on, in order to work, and they left mumbling as if I had just diturbed them. For the price I paid and the length of time I spent at the hotel, I can attest that this is NOT a four star hotel. Go somewhere else, were they value you business and provide the expected service.

Reviews.Title: “The Fexlix Exceeded My Expectaitions and then some”
Reviews.Author: christine2222
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights at the Felix last week and was impressed as soon as the taxi door opened and a very warm valet welcomed me to the hotel. The lobby was simple yet so tasteful. The entire Hotel was newly redecorated with a modern feel yet natural rock walls, a water feature, some wood textures give warmth.The front desk people as well as everyone I encountered was helpful and friendly. The guest room was not only beautiful but contained the most cozy bed! The linnen was crisp white and fluffy! Yum!! The bathroom products were another surprise: H-2-0 From the boutique shop on Michigan Ave. The location is in the heart of the best dining and shopping in Chicago.The neighborhood couldn't be better or safer. The big topper was the restaurant Elate in the downstairs lobby! I had two fabulous meals; dinner(the waiter loved his job and reccomended wonderful dishes). and Sunday Brunch (Yummy menu-I had the Tostada dish and my friend had Ricotta Pancakes...We were so happy!!) They also had a Bloody Mary bar where you choose the pickled adornments from several options. I loved this Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Cptmorgan
Reviews.Content: Going into this I knew the rooms were considered to be small, but they were samller than I anticiapted. One of rooms we had to move the desk chair so you could walk between the bed and desk. Thank goodness we really only spent in the room to sleep. The staff was very freidnly and helpful with where to go, things to see etc. It would be tough to recommend based on the small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel with miniature rooms”
Reviews.Author: Niikky
Reviews.Content: I agree with most other reviewers, the rooms were small, even by European standards. If you can look beyond that, the hotel is fine. It was clean which is very important. The staff were great. The design is cute, overall it feels like a mush smaller boutique hotel. We also booked through priceline. I'd say this hotel isn't in the same class as 4 stars in the area; Omni, Park Hyatt, mostly because of room size. Also the sheets aren't made of 100%cotton. We hardly spent any time in the room so overall it was more than adequate for a two night stay...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for Singles/Romantic, Not good with kid(s)”
Reviews.Author: scrappygracie
Reviews.Content: We just went in town for the weekend with our 5 yr old. Good thing I checked the reviews. The room is very very small, typical of old Chicago downtown hotel. It was so small that they have no rollaway as there's no room at all to put it. There's no sofa either. We were lucky that I thought to bring a child air mattress just in case. And we barely have room to lay that at the end of bed. The location is okay. Close to Emilio for Tapas! Room is clean, modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Letsgoblues1
Reviews.Content: I got it via Pticeline, and it was offered as a 4 star hotel, in the "magnificent mile".. Well, it is half a mile from the Magnificent, and it is an OK 3 star hotel. Clean, with very kind staff, it offers miniature rooms, smaller than a 2 star European Hotel. Free Wi-Fi, charged 42 bucks per night to park my car (more than I have paid at the Drake earlier in 2010). Feel deceived by Priceline, who apparently books a large number of rooms...offering it as a 4 star hotel in the "magnificent".

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, friendly staff, not good for families”
Reviews.Author: tommy25
Reviews.Content: Just completed a stay at his hotel. The other reviewers were right - the hotel rooms were absoluely tiny. We booked this through priceline (130/night), and I would have been annoyed to get this room especially if I had paid full price. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - especially the doormen. The location was safe and convenient (to North Mich Ave). There was no bathtub - so bathing the kids was a big challenge. Adding a crib to the room made things even more cramped. Also the free internet at the hotel was incredibly slow. We mainly ate at kid friendly restaurants such as Foodlife and Portillo's nearby. The staff recommended 'Yolk' for breakfast - which was excellent. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel - based on size of the rooms and the price.

Reviews.Title: “don't book via priceline”
Reviews.Author: Ocean035
Reviews.Content: Some of the rooms are so small you cant walk in front of the bed between the desk and the bed you can't fit. That they actually think it's OK to put people in rooms like this. It is just poor business. We come to Chicago every year. We like to try new hotels every once in a while. we will never return to Hotel Felix. We booked via priceline and that might be why we got such a small room. But why they would have a room that small to begin with who knows? We generally stay at the Hilton Suites on Delaware place much nicer.
