Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, wonderful staff BUT room too small to be comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jalpotz
Reviews.Content: We booked Felix on Priceline as a 4 star hotel. The location is great, the decor is beautiful, and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. However...the room was entirely too small for a couple to be comfortable...absolutely no room to move/even walk around. Getting in and out of the small bathroom was a constant challenge. There was no space for amenities such as coffeemaker, water or wine glasses etc I wondered if the designer, manager, other staff of the Felix had ever actually STAYED in a room ???? I would love to stay there again, but only if there were some way to have a reasonably sized room. We paid $333 for two nights...I guess I I don't understand the star rating system of Priceline

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2802
Reviews.Content: I booked through priceline, paying more for our room than what was advertised on the hotel's website. I was skeptical after reading TA reviews. However, although the room was small, it was clean. The front desk folks were nice and helpful, wifi and business center were both "free" (no upcharges). We would recommend, just don't do it through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, small rooms but good design”
Reviews.Author: olivedel
Reviews.Content: Hi, We booked this hotel through Priceline using the "Name your own price" feature. Bid won at $75. After having checked the review in this website, I thought it would have been a crappy hotel. Not at all. Even though the rooms are small, the staff is friendly, and the decor is really nice. Comfy beds and nice bathroom. Definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond! I will never use PRICE LINE EVER EVER AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: jonjonks
Reviews.Content: Prior to my stay I read a majority of the reviews related to Hotel Felix assistance for those of us that used Price Line in an effort to save money not understanding the dynamics that most hotels sale a block of rooms to these 3rd parties, which tend to be a single room. I have to say that a simple phone call and professional coutesy to the Director of Operations resolved the occupancy issue I faced and was provided a double bed occupancy for my stay. The staff were professional and polite my room was clean and anything I needed I received. This is a lesson learned and I believe you pay for what you get...The Hotel Felix will certainly get nothing but praise from me and my continued business when I visit Chicago again! However, PRICELINE NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, very noisy especially air con unit”
Reviews.Author: jeffjamison
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with one of the other reviewers - Rooms are very tiny which is to be expected in a botique hotel however, they did a really poor job of sound insulation in the rooms along with a very noisy air conditioner. I am sure there are better places in Chicago. And it is a bit of a hike from the mile and the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Beds, Terrible Service, NOT a 4-star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bf1234
Reviews.Content: See title - Plus, I have never received such poor service even from a 1-star hotel. When we arrived, the front desk person seemed to revel in the fact that he could not accommodate our two-bed room request, offered us another room at $50 more a night than what we were already paying, and then offered to bring bedding so one of us could sleep on the floor. We said, "sure, we'll take the bedding." Guess what? No bedding brought to the room as of three hours later. Called to ask for it again and they had no idea what we were talking about. Left to get something to eat..... guess what? When we got back, no bedding. Called again and got an attitude and they finally brought the extra bedding, but guess what? They were out of blankets, so all they brought was a pillow and some sheets. That was the first night. We were there three nights and our room was not cleaned the entire stay. Had to request towels, toilet paper, etc. I don't know if they are understaffed or what, but there are definitely better places to stay downtown river north area for the same price, if not cheaper. It seems like it could be a nice place, but they are seriously lacking in the service area.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend staying here”
Reviews.Author: Fpack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very central, just by the route for the hop on hop off bus for touristy bits. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Yes the room was small, but it was more than enough for what we needed. I would recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room and noisy aircon”
Reviews.Author: Europamonkey
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago for a weekend getaway - a fantastic city, great architecture and nightlife. The hotel's location is about 5-10 minutes walk from Michagan Avenue and the nearest stations. Check in was fine, and the staff were courteous and professional throughout our stay. The room was on the 7th floor, and was very small - 'couldn't swing a cat' springs to mind. There was barely enough room to walk around the bed, and I don't know why they bothered to put an ironing board in the room as there was hardly enough room to put it up. The bathroom was also very small, but the shower was good. On the plus side, it was clean, and housekeeping was fairly efficient. Two small bottles of still water were placed in the room, priced at $5 each. The aircon unit was noisy and woke me up several times when it turned itself on or off. I cannot recommend this hotel - you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in River North area of Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: doctortow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Felix for 4 nights on a business trip. Its a fairly new and modern hotel which prides itself on being a green establishment. The service was always consistently helpful and nice. The lobby and small bar have a modern look and it always smelled great. The business center is free for guests and has access to a printer and desktops. And, thank God, the WiFi is free for once! The rooms are a nice size and are nicely appointed. The bed was simply awesome with down pillows that are new and firm and not lumpy. The H20 bath products are a nice extra touch. There was no bath tub, only a shower. The closet space is small but there is drawer space under the bed. The housekeeping did an excellent job with the room and it was always spotless. The fitness area was nice as well with weights, treadmills, and ellipticals. I did not eat at the restaurant but there was free coffee there every morning. The website talks about a red carpet conceirge service, but that isn't really the case. I did ask them for advice in finding good broadway tickets while I was there and the response was that they were happy to do a google search for me. I kind of laughed and told them that I could do my own internet search. So, that was a bit funny. They probably shouldn't claim that as a service they offer. But, it was a very nice hotel and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with Hotel Felix..9/10 !!...recommend (see comments)”
Reviews.Author: govan99
Reviews.Content: I got this Hotel on Priceline. I bid $105/night for Downtown 4*...got Hotel Felix...for 3 nts...with taxes and fees..it came to around $375, I think..this was close to same price advertised on Hotel's website for weekday rates (or Hotel was running special prices??)...so didn't save much with Priceline... after I won the bid was kinda down as I read about the rooms being very small at Hotel Felix... after staying there for 3 days...I have to say myself and my GF relly liked the Hotel Felix...we had a corner room...nice view and queen size bed...room is definitely on the small side...would be a real tight squeeze for more than two people to stay in this room... but bed was great...nice flatscreen TV...nice bathroom...my GF liked the soap /shampoo...said it was very nice... my GF used the Spa/massage/facial ..she said it was great...again space in Spa is a bit limited but she said it was really nice and staff were great...bar /lobby is also nice...though again pretty space small area... ate one morning at Hotel Rest (Elate)...had breakfast...we both thought food was excellent...fresh...nice presentation...decent service...though a bit pricey...for two...$40-45 front door guys/valet at Felix were so helpful...they recommended places to eat/site seeing...very helpful...really liked that... BTW...I won a bid for another single nite during the same Chicago stay (bid 105 again for 4*) and got the Hilton Palmer House on Monroe...they gave us one double bed...which I know technically they can do (as that is all Priceline gaurantees)...good thing myself and my GF are not too big...this Hilton room had no view and room was smaller than Hotel Felix...some wallpaper in room was peeling...bathroom ceiling was in primer...some rust on shower head...very old TV...bed pillows were bad....checkout was 11am...was not too impressed...was thinking how good Hotel Felix was compared to what Hilton gave us... though Palmer House does offer great location...Hotel Building itself is kinda neat..nice lobby...when at Hilton..it felt like we were on an assembly line...missed the personal touch of the Hotel Felix... Anyway, I would give the Hotel Felix a 9/10...highly recommend... Note, if travelling with more than two people..I would be wary of using Priceline if bidding on a 4* Hotel in Downtown Chicago... as I was saying, Hotel Felix would be a real tight squeeze for more than two people to stay in a queen size bed room...and if u won Hilton Palmer House and they gave u one double bed...things could be pretty bad...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and stay”
Reviews.Author: Needa12
Reviews.Content: Good location. Very safe area. The hotel met our expectations. It was very clean and the staff was helpful. Free wireless internet, where other hotels charged. The self parking was right across the street, which we used instead of valet. We will stay there again if the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! Rooms are crazy small and so is the bed.”
Reviews.Author: trippie1
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through Priceline which I have used successfully in the past. I will never stay at the Felix Hotel again and I will never use Priceline again for fear of booking a hotel as bad as the Felix. The rooms are so small that within minutes of walking into the room I got a headache, my heart started racing, and I felt dizzy. I am not claustrophobic but this room is just uncomfortably small. We were given a room with what the hotel calls a queen size bed. When we questioned the staff about the size of the bed they admitted that it is a "European" queen. The bed that they call a queen is smaller than a full size bed. There is no tub just a shower. I am not sure how they can rate this a 4 star hotel. We are going to find somewhere else to stay for the night. What a waste!

Reviews.Title: “Would not consider a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: SherriB1050
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past week for business and stayed the weekend for personal. Booked through Hotline - ok rate - however not what I would consider a 4 star. I have stayed in several hotels in downtown Chicago and rooms much bigger same or lower rate. Room so small if another person was traveling with me would be annoying how we would be tripping over each other. No in room coffee maker, front desk told me due to it saves energy. Really a 2 cup coffee maker! When I had to run the water for several minutes before it got warm for a shower. Complimentary coffee and tea in lobby - when you are trying to get ready for business and head out the door - no time. Air conditioner worked great - however unlike other reviews - was so quiet I wasn't sure it was working. Bed very comfortable. While I understand you don't spend a lot of time in your room - you at least need room to walk around in. To my co-workers I called it the 'Ikea Dorm Room Display"

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Canadianchic53
Reviews.Content: Booked room for two nights through Priceline. Room was small but very well decorated and new Beds were very comfortable.. The Location was great . Only complaint was the noisy aircondiioner that interrupted our sleep. The location of the air conditioner so close to the thermostat made it difficult to control room temperature. Staff were extremly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “what a rip-off!”
Reviews.Author: rodgersfamily8
Reviews.Content: Worst, most expensive Chicago hotel I've stayed at in several trips over past 20 years! I may never use Priceline again! This is not a 4star hotel! Rooms are size of closets. First room we were given was not made yet. Second room had a bug on the bed. Third room had an odor but we gave up and stayed. The room temp was irregular, stuufy & the AC was so loud we turned it off at night. Was Lollapalooza weekend & paid $240 on Priceline because my husband had a conference that weekend. Stay at Red Roof Inn instead!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY AT HOTEL FELIX!!”
Reviews.Author: NKY_10
Reviews.Content: Great experience at the Hotel Felix! Very modern decor, super-friendly staff and a convenient location. True, the rooms are pretty small, but we were not in Chicago to hang out in the room. If you plan to spend a lot of time in the room, this might not be your place, but if you plan to use the room just to shower, change clothes and sleep - this hotel will be great for you. Our room was very, very clean and tastefully decorated. The bed was AMAZINGLY comfortable and the room was extremely quiet. The waterfall shower head was a nice surprise. If you prefer to stay at a "Green" hotel, this is the place to stay. The Hotel Felix is located approximately 5 blocks from N. Michigan Ave. and the "Magnificent Mile" of Chicago's famous shopping district. We were a ten minute walk to the Water Tower Place shopping Mall, the Hancock Building, and numerous other stores and restaurants. We walked to Navy Pier and it took us about 20 minutes, but we enjoyed the walk and marveled at the architecture. We were a little nervous about walking back at night, but the streets from NavyPier to Hotel Felix were well-lit and heavily traveled, even at 9pm on a Monday night. We never felt unsafe. Parking was $42 for valet or $35 to self park across the street. Both have "in and out" privileges, but we left the car in the lot and walked everywhere. Overall, we had a fantastic experience and would definitely stay at the Hotel Felix again. We booked our room through Priceline's "Name Your Own Price" and got the 4-star rated Hotel Felix for $100/night. Great bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Not that impressed with Hotel Felix”
Reviews.Author: birdeeking
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Felix. I booked it through price line and it was called a 4 star Hotel. The cost was around $180. The Hotel is in a nice area (river north), and its clean, but that sums up the good part. The room was very small!! I would say its more like a 3 star hotel, and should have cost around $90 to $100 dollars. The lobby was small, bathroom tiny.. No room to move in the place, even staying alone... It was clean, and the bed comfortable. I just recently stayed at the Hyatt on wacker for $89 dollars and it was twice the size of my room at the Felix and much better lobby and amenities!!

Reviews.Title: “Went for Lollapalooza in Grant Park, this hotel was in a great location and it was brand new.”
Reviews.Author: crtnycnnrs
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago for Lollapalooza in Grant Park. It was really hot and crowded but also alot of fun. At the end of our day at the concert we were happy to come back to our clean, luxurious hotel. The staff was very helpful and welcoming. The rooms were small but effieciently designed, since there was only 2 of us in a double bed room it worked out well. We had some cocktails in the bar in the lobby where the bartender was friendly and gave us some tips for our visit. The hotel is also close to the subway so getting around was a snap. I can't wait to go back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Minxer78
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for one night in late July, and I must say that I was very impressed with it! I LOVED the decor, it was very modern, yet I found it very welcoming. The staff were most helpful and we found the location perfectly located. After spending a few weeks abroad in Europe, it was nice to return to North America and stay in a hotel that was up to the type of standard I'm used to. Other reviewers complained that the rooms were small; however if you compare the room size to those in Europe, this hotel's rooms are perfect! The bed was especially comfortable and I liked how all of the cardio machines came equipped with TVs. If I return to Chicago, I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “We reserved a room from them through...”
Reviews.Author: Mylolo111704
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room from them through priceline. We even called to cofirm that we had a room. They said everything was fine, we had a room. We pull up to the hotel to check in....and they were overbooked!!! No room for us! They sent us to another hotel for the night, with no promise that we would have a room at the Felix for the duration of our stay! So at 1:00 am I am trying to find the hotel they sent us to stay at, all the while my poor 5 year old daughter just wants to go to sleep! Never again Priceline and Never Again Hotel Felix!

Reviews.Title: “Very hip boutique hotel with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: HarborTwo
Reviews.Content: After reading TripAdvisor reviews, was a little apprehensive because reviews seemed split evenly between those who hated it and those who loved it. Put us in the LOVE category. Booked hotel for two nights through blind bid on Priceline.com. Booked only two days before trip and was able to get room for $50 less than any other 4 star hotel I could find online the week before. Because it was a blind bid, I expected one of the smaller queen bed rooms that many have whined about. But on checkin we were given a king bed room on the ninth floor that was quite large. Hip decor and very comfortable. Bed was a 10 - absolutely comparable to the best we've ever slept in, including the Ritz. Staff was very friendly and helpful, especially doormen Julian and Benjamin. Parking directly across the street for $35 a day was very convenient. Nice location - walk a couple of blocks to Rush Street for lots of great restaurants. Tempo on Chestnut for breakfast was great as always and very close. Easy walk to Magnificent Mile. Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms facing Huron Street lack soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: casabar
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and very helpful. The restaurant is very good. The location is great. But...soundproofing in the rooms at the front of the hotel is definitely lacking. Checking in we were given a large room with attached bath which included tub and shower. After a night of listening to what promised to be a remake of the rumble scene from West Side Story in the parking lot across the street, we were changed to a room on the south side of the hotel. The room was smaller and bathroom had only a shower which was fine for us. Also, the closet space would accomodate hanging a dress or two which the first room did not. In fact, storage space in both bedroom and bath are minimal. There also seem to be a number of add on charges for some things--early check-in is one of them. You should also be aware that if you are on the south side of the building and over the alley, you will have the trash trucks to deal with sound-wise. Luckily we avoided that. In any case, they do not make noise all night like the gang from the clubs on Clark street.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the felix”
Reviews.Author: twoonie
Reviews.Content: my husband and i spent 5 nights at the felix hotel in june - well appointed room with all that we needed- nice toiletries, comfortable bed, quiet. my husband used the gym and i was too busy to get to the spa, but nice that it was handy! the hotel is in a great location and we walked everywhere or easily caught a cab out front. the staff were friendly (especially the doorman!) and the restaurant is fantastic. i highly recommend the ricotta french toast with crumbled oreo cookies - honestly! if we returned to chicago i would stay at the felix again - great price for 5 nights, super location, no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: SDes07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend and we both concurred that this hotel was one of the best we've been to - clean, comfortable and great for the price we paid. The location of the hotel is nice - short walk to the Grand metro stop on the red line. Right when you walk into the hotel, you're hit with intoxicating aromas and the ambience is lovely - calm and relaxing. Staff helped us with pointing out places we were looking for (though those at the front desk weren't the friendliest group of people). The rooms were a little small - but the beds were fantastic. Comfortable pillow-top mattresses with down blankets, feather pillows and light blocking shades provided us with great sleep in a noisy city. The bathroom was very clean and we loved the H2O products they provided for us. Definitely staying here when I come back to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: deych00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Felix June 22 - June 25 for business trip. Hotel Lobby and ammenities- I was very impressed by the overall decor and ambience of the hotel. It's very trendy and pleasant. There is a spa, fitness room, and business center with 3 desktops. I used a spa one evening for ashi massage. It was good, not the best, but I did enjoy it. You get $20 off coupon when you check in. So, the price was reasonable. There is also a restaurant Elate adjacent to the hotel. I went there for breakfast and dinner. All I have to say - WOW. Omelete was unbelievable, the best I've ever had, and trout in the evening didn't disappoint. Be prepared to spend at least $20 for breakfast and $50 for dinner. But it was well worth it. Rooms - Even though many people stated that rooms were small, I found them to be just perfect. After all, you don't go to downtown Chicago to spend your time in the hotel. That said, I can see how it could be tight for 2 people considering there is not much closet space but there are drawers under the bed so that's a big plus. Flat screen TV, free HBO, and free wi-fi is in every room. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was very big and finally, no tub. I loved the shower. Very contemporary decor, with light and dark colors and no more of that casino green/red/yellow carpeting. A couple of minor setbacks - bathroom sink was very shallow, virtually no room for hands under the faucet. With respect to cleanliness, the only reason I gave it a 4 was due to the fact that black carpeting tends to attract dirt and I could see some dirt scattered near the elevator doors. Hotel Staff / Valet - The hotel staff was super friendly. It took only a couple of minutes to check in / check out. Valet guys were always ready to assist. One suggestion, contact valet staff 15 to 20 min prior of needing your car. Otherwise, you may get frustrated waiting for it. The parking lot they use is 5 blocks away from the Hotel Felix. The cost is $42 per day with in and out privileges. I first thought of using adjacent parking lots but it didn't make sense due to only $2 to $5 difference in price. Final toughts - Considering the location, decor, ammenities, and friendliness of the staff, I highly recommend travelers to give this hotel a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Room, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dwodebit
Reviews.Content: We arrived and Benjamin met us out front. He was great and the rest of our stay was great. Benjamin greeted us as we got out of the car and took control of the rest of our check in - he took care of our car, our luggage, walked us to the front desk, and made sure we knew he wanted to help with any issues. The next morning, Benjamin wasn't on duty, but his replacement was just as helpful and competent. As for the room, it was comfortable and clean. The bed was the most comfortable of any hotel we have stayed in. The free high speed worked fine. The location is not on Michigan Ave, but the 6 block walk was quick, and many amenities are even closer. Best of all, the scale in the nicely equipped fitness center weighed us 5 pounds lighter.

Reviews.Title: “Low expectations----Surprisingly, we enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Paytons
Reviews.Content: At the last minute (1 day notice)we booked a 4 star hotel on Priceline. This was our first time trying Priceline. When we were told our hotel was The Felix, we were very upset----not at the hotel, but at the location. We almost didn't go and were ready to lose the money. Well, Sat. night in Chicago won out. What a surprise we had. Yes, the location is 5-6 blocks from where we would like to be. Yes, it is an old building and doesn't look like a 4 star hotel. We were ready to hate everything. Then we pulled up and the doormen took over. These guys were better than any 5 star hotel. Tim & Benjamin won us over. Very, very friendly, they had us parked at a reasonable rate and on our way to the desk. Again, extremely friendly , efficient staff, and our room was ready. After all the negative comments we were ready for the worst. Wrong again. The building is old but totally renovated. It was 90 degrees outside, but very cool all over the lobby, halls and in our room. Yes, the room is really small, but we travel in Europe every year----you haven't seen small! Also, we are not a fan of modern decor, but this was delightful. Everything was so new and clean. About the bed-----one of the best we have ever had in a hotel, extremely comfortable. We did not have glasses in the room, but when we asked they were there in 5 min. Housekeeping, top knotch. Off we went to see Chicago on foot. It was a bit of a hike up to Michigan Ave. but doable and there were many restaurants, bars, and music within walking distance of the hotel. I think we took a cab twice. Now it was 8pm on a Sat. night and we had no dinner reservations. Benjamin, the doorman, suggested a few places within a few blocks and we headed out. Yikes! Every place was packed and had people waiting in line outside. Back to The Felix. Benjamin made a few calls and got us in Sullivan's Steak House a few blocks away. This was the highlight of our adventure. Absolutely perfect! Fantastic room, food, and service.It will definitely go on our "best restaurant" list. Thank you, Benjamin! So, would we stay at The Felix again? Yes, depending on the price. Because of the small rooms, a 1 or 2 night stay is very doable. Probably wouldn't stay there longer only because of the size of the rooms. Also this property is not child-friendly at all, but would be great for the 20-30 yr.olds who would like to hit the bars and music scene.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: jpap10
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here June 9 and 10. The location is decent; you are close to the red line train and not too far off of Michigan Ave. There are numerous restaurants very close (1-3 minute walk). The self parking lot is right across the street and was easy to use. Bring cash for that ($35 per night - I've made other plans for next time). Our room had 1 queen bed and it was a small room. The space was well designed, though, and we felt comfortable. The fitness center was decent: 2 treadmills with televisions, some small weights, and some ellipticals. The room was very quiet. The wireless internet is free, but it was very unreliable when we were there. The hotel was very clean. The staff was extremely competent and friendly. The maid did the best job of any maid ever. We got an extremely good deal on this hotel. The one questionable policy is that hybrids park free (the hotel is very green). My vehicle gets better mileage than numerous hybrid models.

Reviews.Title: “The Truth About Hotel Felix Chicago”
Reviews.Author: honest_reviews032
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Felix in Chicago. We booked our hotel through a popular on line "hotel and travel discount site"......We have used this site before with moderate success but this was a disaster. Hotel Felix is listed all on sites as a 4 Star... there is no way this is a 4 star hotel. The rooms are tiny! The entire hotel in Tiny. Our room was no more than 10 x 12 feet. opening the door you stumbled onto the bed! Besides the size of the rooms there is no 24/hr room service. No coffee machine in the rooms. The resturant in independant of the hotel and has strange hours. Asking for wine glasses on arival, you would think we asked to be upgraded!!!! I could go on and on but needless to say. If you have an option. Dont stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wannabe but not quite there yet”
Reviews.Author: Essie2211
Reviews.Content: Nice little boutique hotel in a very good location for shopping, food and sight-seeing. The staff is friendly, especially the bellmen, and they do try to be helpful but there seems to be a lack of attention to detail. When a parcel arrived for us, there was no message from the front desk about its delivery. We had to ask before we received our parcel. The beds are very comfortable but there are a number of touches missing in the room. There are no coffee/tea making facilities and no fridge either, so it is rather inconvenient if you want to have a drink without resorting to room service. There were also rather strange housekeeping practices that kept us intrigued but certainly not amused. The day after we arrived, housekeeping left a fresh set of toiletries in the bathroom, presumably to replace what we had already used on our first day there. However, we did not start on the new set of toiletries immediately as we hadn't finished the original lot. Inexplicably, on subsequent days, one item after another disappeared from the bathroom. First the second tube of shampoo was removed from our room and then a tube of shower gel. In their place, we were given tube after tube of hair conditioner which we did not need or use! This made us think that certain items were in short supply eg. the shampoo and others were in abundance, eg. the hair conditioner and the housekeeping staff had to keep juggling to make ends meet. Despite these drawbacks, it is still a rather nice hotel and I would hope that the management would give attention to the shortcomings mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TEP77
Reviews.Content: I surprised my boyfriend last year with a trip to Chicago for his birthday. I read a ton of reviews and did my research. I'm so glad I didn't let the "small room comments" scare me. The Hotel Felix was fantastic. The rooms are definitely small - basically room for a king bed, 2 small nightstands, small desk, and flat panel tv. Everything was clean, the hotel staff were friendly, and the hotel is within walking distance of just about everything we wanted to do. If you stay there, you should definitely walk a couple blocks to the McDonalds, it's 2 stories with an escalator and tons of things to look at. There is also a great steak place nearby too. And if you want to do one of the city tours, there is a trolley stop just a couple blocks over which is very convienent!

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: JMA-JHM
Reviews.Content: We spent Memorial Day weekend at the Felix. Again, the service was above and beyond expectation . We arrived in town for the outdoor Chicago Antique Market and finished early because of the heat. We called the hotel at 11:30am to see if there was ANY chance we could get early check in. Although they couldn't confirm it on the phone, the front desk clerk kindly said there were a few early check-outs and he thought they could accomodate us. Worst case, we could leave our bags with the bellman and enjoy the city. We arrived at 11:45 and were promptly given a room... 3 hours and 15 minutes before check-in!!! We got a queen bed room on the 10th floor. Beautiful view toward River North. The room had just enough room on either side of the bed for the nighstands, but more space at the end for the desk, desk chair, and a sitting chair. For two people it was a perfect sized room. The bathrooms are fantastic... rainfall shower head, beautiful fixtures and tilework. Great flat screen tv with tons of channels and free wireless. Breakfast at Elate was the best I've ever had... the steak and eggs were unbelieveable. Modestly sized rooms... nothing else about this hotel is modest... everything is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: AlohaHawaii
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, comfortable bed, great great front desk employees ( especially Konrad and Pablo), they were extremely helpful. Only drawback- rooms are very very small and if you want to upgrade from a queen to a king or two doubles, it will cost you extra. A little far off Mich Ave, but good for walking... Try Yolk for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Would Absolutely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: SarahChi
Reviews.Content: Yes, the room is on the small side. Yes, the room is posh and comfortable. Yes, the hotel is GREEN. Yes, I'd absolutely recommend this hotel for a couple. Went for anniversary--hotel smelled of flowers and candles. Great decorations and luxury for such a bargian price. Awesome location in the Gold Coast. Beautiful restaraunts right outside door. Awesome hotel for the $.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_STL_MO
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk was less than friendly when we checked in. When we arrived to our room, we were shocked to see how small the room actually was. There was very little hanging room to hang clothing. There was no space for a dresser with drawers. Instead, you must use the drawers beneath the bed if you need drawer space. There was no suitcase stand for our luggage. The only place to put the luggage was under the desk, and it had to be stuffed under there (not very much space). Everything was newly renovated and clean. However, this room was smaller than any hotel room in Manhattan in which I have stayed. We felt very cramped and uncomfortable while trying to move around the room. The bath products were nice. The hotel is about 4 to 5 blocks from all the shopping on Michigan Avenue. The view from our window was hideous (large rusted pipe).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, Very comfortable rooms, WOULD RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: kevin_51_83
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Staff was helpful with knowledge of the city, rooms were clean, comfy, and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: npilot
Reviews.Content: The service was great and the bed was very comfortable, even though the room was small (we're talking only a couple feet on each side of the queen sized bed - although we got the cheapest room possible for our stay). Elate - the restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel - is incredible. We ate breakfast and dinner there and everything was absolutely delicious. I would recommend the creme brulee pancakes for breakfast if it is still on the menu when you get there. The Asha Spa located within the hotel is also really great. We were able to get a couples massage even though we only booked it a few hours in advance. Staff at the spa were very pleasant. The location is also very close to the Magnificent Mile for shopping. There are lots of great restaurants for all price ranges very close by. I love that the hotel is so "green" and if I stay here again I will definitely spend a little more to get a larger room that is on a higher floor in the hotel (for a little better view - ours wasn't bad, just not quite the romantic scene we had hoped for). Overall great experience!

Reviews.Title: “small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dethman
Reviews.Content: i booked hotel felix on expedia at about $80/night. small room with a queen bed, no storage space. it fit my needs, but people seem to have had problems with two bed requests. the hotel is modern, and the beds were very comfortable. fit and finish were good. i was a little worried about the housekeeping service as i found a number of hairs on the supposedly clean bed. all in all, a fair stay, decent for the price. probably about a 5 or 6 block walk to the red line, not a lot of buses run in the area. if you can find a good rate, you can probably find a more central hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star and service is bad”
Reviews.Author: shelly3433
Reviews.Content: The room is so small that my knees and shoulder are bruised from walking into the bed and hitting the tv. I am an average sized woman so being big is not the reason. The queen bed takes up most of the room. It has a flat screen that sticks out 6". My shoulder kept hitting the wall and my knee would hit the bed as the walkway was only 2 feet 3" wide. The 6" that the Tv stuck out made the walkway around 18". On the side of the bed near the window there was a very small area of 4 feet to put your bag. There were two pull out drawers under the bed to store clothing. This room is smaller than the rooms I have rented in Europe. The maid brought fresh towels each day but she did not vacuum or wash the floors. We asked for extra blankets for our child so she could sleep on the floor but they did not bring them. We actually asked for the blankets to be in the room prior to our arrival and again when we arrived. We didn't feel very welcomed as no one ever said hello or greeted us.

Reviews.Title: “Where COOL turns into COLD”
Reviews.Author: JaminHou
Reviews.Content: The prior contributor spoke volumes of this hotel. Dubious reservations practices, bait-and-switch mentality when booking through Priceline. You can get all the phone confirmations you want prior to your arrival. But the staff knows it's when you GET there that counts. And that's when they hit you up with non-availability of requested room types, tiny "Priceline" rooms that seem fit for a cruise ship, not a newly renovated hotel, and, oops, surcharges for two beds. GOTCHA! The only plus which the prior contributor missed were the fit and finish of the rooms. They are of very high quality, curtains shut to create a dark and peaceful (albeit tiny) environment. But the service at the front desk was a big detractor, and singlehandedly made COOL turn into COLD. There are much better (and hipper) hotels in the River North area. Skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: kennakenna
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation at the Hotel Felix through Priceline and I'm not even going to stay at the hotel because the service, prior to my arrival, has been so terrible. Like others, I need a room with two beds. When I called the first time with my request for a room with two beds I was told that my request would be put in the system. I called again to arrange an early check-in, which costs $40 but I thought would be worth the money considering how early my flight arrives in Chicago. I was told that they couldn't guarentee an early check-in but, if I was able to get an early check-in, there was no way for them to know when I would be able to check-in. Thus, I could end up paying $40 for a 7am check-in or a 2pm check-in (regular check-in is at 3pm.) I decided to go without the early check-in but didn't want to get off the phone before I had confirmed that my room has two beds. When I asked they they told me there were no rooms with two beds available. I hung up the phone and got online to see if the hotel's website showed availability for a room with two beds. It did. I then called the hotel again, under the guise of booking a new reservation, to see if there were any rooms available with two beds. A room with two beds was available and they said they'd be happy to make a reservation for me. I then asked if I could just make sure my current reservation could be changed to a room with two beds, since there was availability, and they told me that was not possible. I volunteered to pay an extra fee per night for a room with two beds and I was also told that was not possible. It seemed pretty clear to me that if I was paying full price for the room they would have been happy to accomodate me but, since I booked my room through Priceline there was nothing they could do. I've used Priceline to book rooms all over the country and have never been treated like this. If they don't want people purchasing rooms through Priceline then they shouldn't sell rooms through Priceline. I'm so frustrated I've booked a room in a different hotel. I'm a fan of getting a deal but I'd rather be treated with respect. Of course, now I don't want to use Priceline to book a room in Chicago again because I might end up with Hotel Felix. I'd rather pay full price anywhere else than step one foot in their lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: cab983
Reviews.Content: Unless you don't care about service, it is non-existent behind the front desk. I was staying at the Hotel Felix with my wife and 3 kids. "Can I have adjoining rooms?" "No sir they are all accounted for." "OK, can I have a room w/ two double beds that are near my room?" " No sir, they are all accounted for." " I am traveling with 3 kids, what would you like me to do? " No reply. All rooms that were left for us were one queen bed and no adjoining rooms. Meanwhile it was 1 pm and this was a very early check in. At this point we decided we could not stay and sat on the couch to discuss our next move. After another few minutes a woman who was also behind the front desk walked over to us and whispered, "I got you a King bed in one room and a queen in another and they are adjoining" "Wonderful, we will take it!!" The rooms were very clean and small, but that is to be expected in a boutique hotel. When we put the air conditioning on in one of the rooms it made a noise so loud that we couldn't hear our tv in the second room. We called down and a maintenance man was sent up. He said the problem was the condenser and there was not much he could do. He spent about 20 minutes in our room but could not fix it. He left and said he would be back in a few minutes. He came back and said that he could try to reset the unti. He spent another 1/2 hour with us and reset the unit to no avail. "Sorry, nothing we can do, but we could switch your room" Obviously not, it took long enough to get adjoining rooms. "So the unit cannot be fixed?" "Nope, but I can give you a free movie" Great, i have an air conditioner that is so loud that I can't hear the tv and for that inconvenience I can have a free movie that I won't be able to hear. GREAT! So my child decides to watch AVATAR. He blasts the tv in his room and then it is time to go to dinner so he needs to pause the tv. We go to dinner and then come back to the room and he tries to watch his movie again. Cannot find it anywhere to resume play. So, the hotel sends up the same maintenance guy. He spends another 1/2 hour with us to try to resume the movie. He cant figure it out. "You will just have to order it again" "ok, will that be complimentary?" "No, you will have to pay for that" Thats all I got. Had a fantastic weekend in Chicago. Stay there all the time. Have never had such poor service, which is very surprising giving the amount of competition that exists.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is clean, beautiful, affordable, comfortable, accessible, and perfect”
Reviews.Author: taurus212
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in April 2010. We travel a fair bit, so we have stayed in our share of hotels both good and bad. We were extremely happy in every respect with this hotel, and cannot recommend it highly enough. The location is excellent (whole foods 1 block east, Fogo De Chao & wallgreens 1 block south, centrally located), the hotel itself is beautiful and modern, with a clean and cool aesthetic, and there is a parking garage 1 block south that charges 23 dollars a day (very reasonable). In short, this hotel was perfect in every respect and there is nothing to complain about. The rooms are very cute and clean, with trendy furnishings. The beds are very comfortable, and the sheets are some of the softest we have ever felt in a hotel. The pillows, while squarish, are very comfortable and we did not feel the need to ask for more. The rooms are somewhat smallish, but they are perfectly suitable for a couple or two friends. Those with families may find them cramped, but keep in mind this a boutique hotel. You trade space for class, a good deal in our minds, and at 100 dollars a night this really can't be beat. Let me just address a few of the common complaints that I read when choosing this hotel. We had no noise issues whatsoever. The beds and pillows were great. The staff was very helpful. The walk-in shower is gorgeous, and the sink is perfectly usable (and cool!). The internet is free AND wireless, a common complaint with many other hotels.Even the complimentary shampoo and soap was very high quality. At 100 dollars a night, the value you get at this hotel is incredible. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fell in love with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatlyO
Reviews.Content: I try to make it to Chicago at least once a year and always booked on Priceline for downtown Chicago, most hotels to me were interchangable. From now on I'll be staying at Hotel Felix. Loved the atmosphere, the staff, my room and everything about it. The rooms are smaller but very well organized and quiet. I never heard anything from another room. The only thing I missed was a coffee maker but there was coffee and tea available a few floors down. I have absolutely no complaints about the hotel, location or staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here - the entire staff is incompetent and needs serious training”
Reviews.Author: Cruiser44
Reviews.Content: Don't go here - the staff is rude and incompetent I wish I could write a positive review but this is probably the worst hotel I've ever been to. First off, I NEVER write reviews unless I can say something nice. But I've been pushed too far not to share this with others so they don't suffer. The hotel needs to seriously train all their staff since no one seems to know anything about their jobs. The front desk doesnâ€™t listen to the customer, and will give you â€œattitudeâ€� if you try to clarify things (to minimize errors). The end result, errors in your stay, from wake-up calls to service charges. The General Manager can best be described in his own words, "I don't know how to do that", "I'm not responsible for that", "I'm trying to help, but maybe it's your fault". WRONG, WRONG, WRONG. The general manager is IN CHARGE. Accounting. Wow! One person. No one else has authority. Or so Iâ€™m told, but I know thatâ€™s not true since Iâ€™ve dealt with the hotel several times trying to fix billing errors from previous stays. Again, Iâ€™m teaching them, since no one seems to know anything, or care. I've been charged incorrectly time, and time, again. My corporate partners also have had similar problems. Trying to get the charges fixed is another frustration that is compounded by even more errors. I wish this was a one-time thing, but between myself, and my co-workers, we've never seen anything like it. Time is money, and the time I've spent on the phone with the hotel trying to fix Hotel Felix's mistakes is ridiculous. Billing: No one there seems to have any idea how to do what hotels do every day. The one thing they DO have down pat is billing. They just don't seem to know how to bill CORRECTLY. Worse yet, they don't know how to reverse those charges, resulting in compounded billing errors. My travel expense report is now sooooooooooo confusing with all the hotels errors, I canâ€™t even figure it out! Calling the hotel and getting someone on the phone in accounting is at best - 1 in a 1000. Only one person can access accounts, and that person is never at their desk. If and when HE does try to correct the problem, he does it WRONG. There seems to be no one accountable for anything, and worse yet, only one person can do one job, with no backups. Finally, (the last straw) the hotel personnel ask ME to do their work in getting information to fix billing errors from the corporate credit card company. Of course the Mastercard company is clueless why Iâ€™m calling them asking for information the MURCHANT normally (and easily) does every day, to reverse charges incorrectly applied. The rooms are small, and smell like cooking grease. The best thing I can say about hotel, is house cleaning does a nice job. Expect some smiles at the front desk, but also expect attitude. Not sure if that's a product of Chicago, or what, but the staff needs TRAINING.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific 5 night stay for mom & daughter”
Reviews.Author: travelinmomkc
Reviews.Content: Took my 5 year old daughter to Chicago for spring break week and booked for $70 per night via Priceline. It's just what we wanted - great location close to bus & train stops, very clean, comfy bed, and cheap enough that we could splurge on other things. Highly recommend for solo travelers and couples who don't mind cozy quarters. Will gladly book again when I travel to Chicago on biz, and hope the painfully slow WIFI will get an upgrade by then.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising find - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynn2
Reviews.Content: My first priceline purchase - a big hit. This is a hotel that I wouldn't have looked at twice - so glad I stayed here - will stay again, often. Beautiful rooms, not large but perfectly adequate size, comfy beds, really nice bathroom. Parking is free if you drive a hybrid! (I don't, but may borrow my daughter's next time!) Very friendly and helpful staff. Checked in late and left early so didn't get to explore the neighborhood. The hip music and lobby decor set the tone - a really nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “5 night hassle free stay”
Reviews.Author: thame_hoops
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the felix for 5 nights for a ridiculously low rate for a queen room so was quite sceptical on what the experience would be like. Before i visited i emailed the hotel with a request of being placed on a high floor and they responded by telling me they upgraded me to a King room at no cost. When i arrived i was told i hadnt been upgraded but they did it anyway so that was nice. My room was Big but i did sneak a peek at a queen room and it looked alot smaller. My room looked so much better than their website photos so i guess they dont really do themselves justice. Pros: Location Comfortable bed (mattress with a liner on top) HD TV with loads of channels Huge bathroom with a walk in shower and nice H2O products. Nice lobby and free coffee in the mornings Taxiâ€™s are always waiting outside so its easy to get a ride Cordless phone Free WIFI but see below IPOD dock on the alarm clock Crisp modern decor The doormen are all cool, very helpful. Arrived back to my room after the bars at 4am, 5am etc and there was always a doorman or someone on duty so it felt safe. Cons: Hmmmmmmmmm......front desk are a bit surly but it makes no difference to me Expensive to valet park, i got charged $45 for my friend to stay 4 hours The WIFI is so slow, at times it was worse than old fashioned â€˜dial-upâ€™ (im not joking) and they even gave me a wire and that didnt improve things. The sink is a bit strange, made it awkward to shave The closet was odd, not much room to hang stuff up or hide your suitcase away so it just stayed in my walkway Walls are quite thin so i did hear other rooms (god, i hoped they didnt hear me and my friend!) I assume the prices will rocker once it gets established. I didnt eat in the hotel so cant comment on the breakfast etc, it did look expensive though Iâ€™d say not to be put-off by the negative reviews on trip adviser, they seem mostly to complain about the Felix messing up group bookings but I canâ€™t comment on that

Reviews.Title: “A cool and comfortable new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elchie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and wish it were more. Chose the hotel because I got a great deal on the hotel's website. Saw some reviews that commented on the tiny rooms - my room was spacious and fit the queen bed, desk/chair, sitting chair and end table comfortably. Bathroom was also spacious and stocked with great products from H2O+, a bathrobe, and miscellaneous toiletries like cotton pads and q-tips. Decor was sleek/modern, bordering on funky. The bed and pillows were both very comfortable. Only negative was that the heating system was a little noisy when turned on. Free wireless internet was very convenient, but there is also a business center with free access and printers. The hotel lobby area is small, but both nights there were people lounging around the bar area. The entire staff was incredibly friendly. One negative was the area - hotel is a little more than "steps" from Michigan Ave. Hotel seemed to be a lot closer to great restaurants than great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, effective but”
Reviews.Author: MrFunkinDC
Reviews.Content: Working vacation. Exiting the cab I struggled with my bag. The doorman held my door but did nothing to help hold my bag. No issue check in. Nice lobby, two hotel bar one small and the other part of a nice bar restaurant looks very nice. Room-Small but effective to a point. Queen bed with nice linen etc...bathroom very nice 9 out 10. 32 HDTV room safe,. Storage drawer under bed. Free internet What is missing; lighting over work space is not there, desk lamp is a led which is ineffective. NO suitcase stand or a side chair beside the desk chair. I would equate the room to that of a urban condo master bedroom. I would find it difficult to share this room with a second person. Work out room- 2 elliptical, 2 tread mill, ball, bench and free weights. They had a spa which I did not explore. It was attended and dark with candles and offered a full range of services. Deal killers- For me I was disappointed that there was no refrigerator in the room, no coffee in the room and when I went down to get some at 5:30 am I received day old coffee heated up. I wish I would of been told this is the case and told that coffee serve would begin in 30 minutes. Do not give me bad coffee with out warning me.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, with everything close by.”
Reviews.Author: childbride84
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Felix for four nights while traveling to take the Illinois Bar exam. The hotel had absolutely everything I needed -- it was clean and quiet, close to transportation (I didn't have a car) and any number of shops and restaurants. There's a Whole Foods a block away. The bartender at the lobby bar was extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in the City”
Reviews.Author: tthur68
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Felix during a recent trip to Chicago. Priceline booked me here and you can't beat the deal you get the the Felix. Rooms are small, but this is an old building so you expect that. Everything inside the hotel is new and very nice. Flat screens in the rooms and comfortable beds. Service was great. Park in the lot across the street for $35 overnight. Can't beat that. When you're here, don't forget to hit Portillo's around the corner for a Chicago hot dog or Italian beef sandwich.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: chiguy77
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about the Hotel Felix. My partner and I decided to stay there for our ten year anniversary. I booked the reservation directly with the hotel , mentioned why we were coming downtown for the weekend, and the young lady I spoke with was so sweet. The people at the front desk were extremely knowledgeable and gave us a lot of great recommendations for food and shopping. Yolk was amazing for breakfast. The bathrooms in the hotel rooms are also stocked with excellent H20 products. My partner and I made sure to stop by the store on Michigan Ave. to pick up some stuff for home. All in all, we had a wonderful stay downtown and I would definitely stay at this interesting hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: CES51
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago to celebrate my grandaughter's 18th birthday. We had booked two rooms on Priceline. There was 5 of us and we knew we would need 2 rooms. We got there an the rooms only had one queen bed per room. We asked for a rollaway and they don't have any, they did say we could have extra bedding and someone could sleep on the floor. We went up and checked the rooms out. They were so small, you barely had room for the luggage let alone some one on the floor. So we had to get a 3rd room. These rooms are unbelievably small!! Roomservice was just as bad. One morning I ordered large coffee with 2 cups. No problem, I then requested extra cream, I never got it. The next morning I placed the same order but extra cream when I placed the order. Coffee was not a large but a small and no extra cream. We also called roomservice for wine glasses, they brought us tumblers. There were no wine glasses in the hotel, they were all dirty! Then the next night we asked for champagne flutes. We got the champagne flutes but they were dirty! Lipstick marks on the rims. We didn't get clean washcloths for the second day we were there. I don't mind using my towel again, but no way should anyone have to use their washcloths more than once! The staff wasn't helpful at all. When they asked us how our stay was and we told them, the front desk clerk just looked at us and said well I guess we won't see you ladies again! What happened to customer service? We are regular visitors to Chicago and never have we had such bad service!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: MMF78
Reviews.Content: I visited Hotel Felix this past weekend w/ my mom, two sisters, and teen age niece....this was the worst hotel experience we've ever had. We booked two rooms on price line and when we got there were told that they only queen beds available....we had 3 people in a room....they don't have roll away beds, but we could either get a 3rd room or they'd bring up extra pillows/blankets. The rooms are RIDICULOUSLY SMALL....there wouldn't be room for a roll away bed and that's why they don't have them. We had to get a 3rd room and my mom ended up by herself. Five people shouldn't need 3 hotel rooms! We were constantly bumping into each other--the rooms were smaller than my college dorm room. We requested wine glasses to have a pre-dinner drink and the entire hotel was OUT of wine glasses...how is this possible? They brought us plastic cups for our wine. Every time we ordered coffee from room service it was wrong and they'd have to come up 2 or 3 times to rectify it. They didn't bring any of us clean washcloths on our 2nd night....3 rooms and NONE of us had clean wash cloths. When asked at the end of our stay "how was your visit?" We explained everything that happened....the man at the desk said, "I guess we won't be seeing you here again." I just couldn't believe that they could have no regard for the poor service that we recieved and didn't do anything to make us feel better about our experience. I've never seen such AWFUL customer service in my life. We frequent Chicago on a regular basis and have never been treated like this before. Also, families should be aware of the small rooms....there wouldn't be room for a pack-in-play, or room for kids to play, no bathtub either just a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Timtravelsinchicago
Reviews.Content: When people say the rooms are small THEY ARE NOT KIDDING!!! I used Priceline and got an amazing deal ($50). When my son and I opened the door to our room we both just stood there in shock. It was smaller than a cruise ship room. Seriously. Maybe 9 X 11. We couldn't use the fan in the room either. When it turned on it made a loud screeching sound that was intolerable. I didn't complain to anyone because I know I got a 'good deal' through Priceline. Lesson learned. NEVER STAY AT THE HOTEL FELIX!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, stylish comfortable room: exceeded all our expectations”
Reviews.Author: kjayduck
Reviews.Content: This is a "green" hotel on the near north side, close to subway, bus routes, restaurants, and Michigan Avenue. There is no free parking by design, unless you have a hybrid vehicle: we were able to get everywhere by walking or by using public transportation, easily. We took a chance on this new hotel: location was the key factor, and we feared we wouldn't be able to find anything downtown for under $200. But we paid significantly less than that through a special on the hotel website. We feared it might be too good to be true- but it exceeded our expectations. It was a fantastic value! This hotel was nice enough for a special anniversary occasion, and we felt spoiled by it. The room was stunning and comfortable: great warm modern design, beautiful finishes. Very comfortable bed and nice H20 toiletries. Unlike some other reviewers, we did not find it too small. The room could have used a little more surface space for putting our things, but otherwise perfect. The hotel restaurant is very good, especially if you lean toward gourmet. We also had great meals at nearby Yolks (brunch) and Karyn's Cooked, which are both within walking distance. We will aim to stay here every time we travel to Chicago. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Service.”
Reviews.Author: rgardner
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Felix with my better half in February and had a great time. Their are so many restaurants and bars in walking distance. However the thing that stood out the most was the great staff and service provided by the Hotel. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. I would recommend this Hotel to Anyone. The only suggestion I would have is a better selection of morning papers.

Reviews.Title: “Beware, this hotel is a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: fewill12
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation for the hotel via priceline for two people (traveling with a friend). I called the hotel to make sure tow get a room with 2 bed (we're not that close friends :-) Besides being pretty rude, I was told that this would be an extra $40 (almost doubling the bill) and there may or may not be a room available. This makes planning ahead impossible since we will need a room with two beds. When I complained about that, the reservation agent got even more rude, referring to "company policy" (anybody who works in a large company knows what that means). Their blurb on the website about making customer service standards sounds pretty hollow. The bottom line is that after this kind a treatment I don't even want to stay there anymore - before I actually arrived. That must be record.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new hotel”
Reviews.Author: IowaCityHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: I read mostly good reviews about this place and I agree. I know, the rooms are small. So what? I guess they should advertise this on their website or something. Because of you take the room size out of the equation, everything else is above expectations. I mean even the room size is not a big deal, granted we don't have any kids and did not have a lot of luggage. But I mean if you go there and you know you most likely are going to have a smaller room then it's not such a big deal. From the moment you walk into the hotel you feel the difference, the smell, feel and look of everything is really well thought out. Check in was nice and quick. Our room was wonderful, it's nicely decorated, I loved the new bed and linen, I loved the desk and TV. There was something special about that room. The bathroom was again on the small side of things but still very nice. I liked it. They don't have coffee in the room but they have complimentary coffee in the lobby all morning long. If you're reading this review you know the hotel is in a good location. There is a parking right across the street on Clark street that is 23 dollars for 24 hours. Not bad for Chicago. I got this hotel on priceline but I will not hesitate to book it again without priceline in the future. I am looking forward to trying their spa with my wife. Go to the hotel Felix, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, though wouldn't consider it a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: dougie-w
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix is a fine boutique hotel in a great location, a few blocks from the Michigan Ave. shopping area, a CTA red line station, and great restaurants including Rick Bayless' famed Frontera Grill. We appreciated the hotel's commitment to the environment and its free wifi -- very nice not to have an upscale hotel soak us for up to $13 per day for Internet service! Web sites including Priceline consider this a 4-star hotel, but I think a 3.5-star or 3-star rating would be more appropriate. Our queen-bed room was one of the tiniest we've ever stayed in, tightly furnished with a bed, end tables, a desk and desk chair. Another chair would have been nice, but there was no room for one. Also, the hotel's "fitness center" was just a very plain room with two treadmills, two cross-trainers and a collection of dumbbells -- about as meager as what you'd find at a Courtyard by Marriott or Homewood Suites, not a 4-star brand such as Hilton or Sheraton. We learned while trying to take a nap that it was best to keep the heating system's fan going and not allow it to switch off, to drown out sound from the hallway that kept invading our room. Guests might want to avoid the hotel's overpriced restaurant, Elate. Our Sunday brunch for two, including drinks, taxes and tip, cost about $75! Our waiter suggested Bloody Marys, we both said yes, but we really should have asked about the price: a steep $12 each. We also were asked for our toast preference, suggesting that our entrees came with toast, so we both chose sourdough. When our meals came, one of us got sourdough on his plate, but the other got wholegrain toast on a separate plate. We decided not to complain about the error -- but were quite annoyed when the bill included a $3 charge for wholegrain toast.

Reviews.Title: “Very Contemprary and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: SpringfieldTraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very contemporary furnishing. Great for a single traveler or romantic getaway. Not good for families as room is small and storage space is less. I do not think this is comparable to other major brand four star hotels but if you get it off hotwire for less than $60 you should consider a good buy. Great location for restaurants. Numerous places incl Bartenelli pasta bowl, rainforest cafe and Hard rock cafe around the block. Some said try out the "yolk" a great brunch place around but could not go there. There is parking lot right across on Clark and Huron which changes just $23 for 24 hr and looks quite safe. Will be happy to stay here if I get for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room Ever”
Reviews.Author: AUMike77
Reviews.Content: I used priceline and paid $52 per night thinking I was getting a 4 star hotel. WRONG way WRONG!! The room was so small there was nowhere to put our luggage. You can't begin to understand how small these rooms are. If I had been bidding on a 2 star it would be different. The sink is so shallow you can' even get your hands in their to wash. However the room was very clean and would be ok for a single traveler and that is it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel vist”
Reviews.Author: kmarie88
Reviews.Content: tiny rooms, service was horrible, management not very accommodating

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: foleydav
Reviews.Content: The service at the Felix was garbage. The eight rooms that were with our party were a little loud but after we had warnings we lowered the noise volume. They charged us with a cleaning fee ($50) and a fee to clean up vomit ($100), when no one had puked in our room the entire weekend. They wouldn't give us room service, we had to ask for toilet paper and extra towels because they cut off our house keeping. The front desk staff should be working at Burger King rather than an alleged 4 star hotel. They were unprofessional, unfriendly and down right rude to our entire party. We paid good money to stay there and they treated us like we were low life scum. When I wanted to dispute the extra charges they told me to talk to their supervisor which conveniently wasn't there. I have stayed at numerous hotels in Chicago over the years and Felix is by far the worst. Do not give this establishment any business because they do not understand basic hospitality practices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: perrinjcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Felix for a weekend in Chicago for fun. The hotel is located about five blocks from Michigan Ave. It is a quick walk to shopping an dining options. The rooms are small but, I have stayed in other hotels in Chicago that are the same size. If you are coming to Chicago, are you going to be in your room all day? They also allow you to park for free if you drive a hybrid. We have a Prius so that saved $42 a night for valet parking. The rooms are comfortable but, the walls are a little thin. Again, nothing I have not experienced at other hotels. Overall, a great stay at a great little hotel. If you want to stay in Chicago and want to be within walking distance of a LOT of stuff, keep the Felix in mind.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places we have stayed in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: katespade
Reviews.Content: As a frequent visitor of Chicago, I have always found my accommodations pleasant. I am WELL aware of most space issues of downtown hotels, so small rooms don't scare me off. I always get my rooms off Priceline for a steal and have never been disappointed. Hotel Felix was charming. Very modern and comfortable. Beds were great. Bathroom was roomy and clean. Even the little bar area downstairs was very quaint (tip: order a drink and get something off their $3 bar bites menu and sit by the fire). The location was wonderful, just a few blocks from Michigan Ave. The service was great. Don't let the reviews of the small rooms deter you from this little gem. They made sure to make use of all space and think of every detail.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: OrlandPark_ILBella
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire so we didn't know exactly where we were going to stay until we booked. It is wonderful and exceptionally clean. Service was very good. Enjoyed the lobby meeting other people. The beds are wonderful as well as the pillows

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: eatsleepski29
Reviews.Content: Chic hotel in a great location just a few blocks from the Mag Mile. Our room was small and we could hear the people in the room next door occasionally, but I would expect this of any city hotel and it really didn't bother us. The room and bathroom very were clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. I got a great deal there through travelzoo which included breakfast at the hotel restaurant. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mjamgb22
Reviews.Content: Room was average sized for a business traveler, but big enough for one night and two guests. It was very sumptuous, from the bed to the lighting to the decor. Very luxurious linens on bed. Liked having the Ipod dock. Hotel staff was very helpful, friendly. Location was close to everything you could need for a great night in Chicago. Parking across the street was $23, which was very reasonable. Didn't eat in restaurant but it appeared very relaxing and inviting. Great atmosphere. Got a great rate on hotel website and that made it even better. One issue noticed was that once floor in shower got wet, it was very slippery and there was no mat.

Reviews.Title: “Felix means "happy" and we were !”
Reviews.Author: TexasToddness
Reviews.Content: This wonderfully remodeled and renovated hotel is only 4 blocks from Michigan Ave. and is in a perfect location. The hotel staff especially Charles, Tim and Julian are fantastic people that care and assist you with all your questions and needs. The hotel is very clean and the housekeeping is outstanding. I was impressed by the linens (USA made), the bath products, and the furnishings. This place is Leeds certified and tries to avoid waste and needless energy consumption with various equipment and ideas. It used to be the old Wacker Hotel and was built in 1926. It went through it's complete remake just last year with new HVAC, electrical, plumbing, elevators, fire systems and interior. The Elate restaurant and bar and the small bar in the lobby are perfect and the meals and happy hour specials are great. The food is chef prepared and the bartendresses are pretty, smart, and professional. Don't be afraid of the ratings complaining of room size, we had no problem with a bit smaller room and it was very cozy. At one time we had 8 of our friends in the room for a few beers and snacks and it was crowded and fun. You will love the fact that Trader Joe's, Whole Earth Foods, Walgreens and other helpful retail is just around the corners. We ate at the Mi Luna cafe in the old Howard Johnson's motor lodge just one block away for great breakfasts and fast lunch. This little cafe is not a looker but it is a classic and the food is classic Chicago. At The Hotel Felix, the high speed wifi, hi def flat screen tv, free local phone calls, and bottled water are free. There's even a great free coffee bar set up each morning in the lobby. It also has easy access to I90-94 for scooting around the Windy City. I could not find a thing wrong with this place. It's my new "go to" hotel in Chicago from now on...don't change a thing please. This is Chicago downtown at it's best. I love the fact that the entire hotel was "recycled" and saved in such a cool way. Also there is ample surface and garage parking next to the hotel and if you drive a hybird vehicle your valet parking is free for your entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for shopping and a one night in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: purpletreegirl
Reviews.Content: After flying into Chicago Ohare on our way back to Michigan my husband and I stopped over for one night. From check in to the the room to check out all was smooth and efficient at the Hotel Felix. Our room was small but comfortable. I appreciate the green efforts. I like the modern decor. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: adfd
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Felix on Hotwire for $104.00 (plus tax). Upon arrival we were a bit confused about parking, but there is a parking lot across from the lobby entrance that I believe was around $30 a day (could be wrong). As for the room - the rooms are NOT as small as people are making them out to be at all. We found there to be plenty of space. However, if you have a lot of luggage, then it may feel a bit crowded. The rooms are very pleasing to the eye, the bed and bedding were wonderful, and it was very clean. We had a great view but our window was very tiny and in the corner and the outside of the windows clearly had not been cleaned in a while. As for the bathroom, it was spotless, and I liked the shower (no bathtub). However, I found the super shallow sink to be annoying (could hardly fit my hands under the faucet) but it was tolerable. We did, however, get two towels that once opened, were full of clumps of long, black hair. However, it was obvious the towels had been washed and this was just an oversight when they were folded, and we had plenty more to use. The bathroom was well stocked with q-tips, cotton balls, makeup remover and h2O products. The hotel was quiet at night, and we found the front desk to be polite. The bartender went way out of her way to aid us in finding good places to go - super helpful and better than any concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to Magnificient Mile. Small room.”
Reviews.Author: PacoO
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days at this boutique hotel off the Magnificient Mile. Rooms are quite small and in fact there is only room for a bed and a small desk with chair. There can be noise from the street traffic that at night can be bothersome. The place was very clean. Free internet in the business centre. Wholefoods close by. Overall a nice place to stay for the price paid and good value (under $100 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Christmas Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dbuschini
Reviews.Content: Like most of these reviews state..the rooma are VERY small...like really..u do need to sit on the bed and let the other person walk by you...seriously...and the sink..its a dumb design...you really cant get your hands under the faucet...put those two things aside...this Hotel is VERY nice..GREAT location...a few blocks from everything......I would recommend....(paid just $65 plus tax on priceline)....I would also suggest parking across the street for $23 per night rather then the $45 for valet....

Reviews.Title: “Four star? Who came up with that?”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago many times a year and have stayed in about 20 different three - four 4 star hotels there. Hotel Felix should NOT be considered a four star. Not even a 3 1/2. The Pros: Nice walk-in shower Nice towels and bath products Excellent TV w/ great high def reception Free internet 'Whole Foods' down the block Trains relatively close (abt. 5 blocks) The Cons: No closet EXCEPTIONALLY SMALL ROOM!!! No extra chair. There was JUST the desk chair for sitting. Anyone else had to sit on the bed. Pillows were all the same - and very THICK. Complimentary one-size-fits-all robe appeared to be a women's size 10. No coffee maker in the room. No surface space to put anything, especially suitcases. No dressers. There are four large drawers built-in to the bottom of the bed. This worked OK for us but older folks might find the bending and kneeling to be a challenge. When the drawers are open they are major obstructions and no one can pass by. If someone was sitting at the desk, you nearly had to crawl over the end of the bed to get around them! No light on the clock for night-time viewing. Very few outlets for charging cell phones, etc. The heat was hard to control and noisy. When it cycled on, you would get a blast of cold air in your face, even though the vent was on the opposite wall. I rarely write a bad hotel review on TA. In fact, most of the time I am delighted with our room. The Hotel Felix, though, was disappointing in so many ways. I guess the smallness of the room was the worst aspect. Three days of climbing over the bed to get around the ONE desk chair in the room did not create warm-fuzzies. Other folks wrote about how welcoming the staff was. No one ever said one word to us. Not a "Hello" or "Welcome". Nothing. But that is no big deal. I only mention it because it is in sharp contrast to many other postive comments about the staff. While we were there, a man came to the front desk saying that the room he was just assigned was already occupied. I read about this happening in other traveler's posts, too.
