Apparently there is free coffee in the lobby in the morning. We weren't told about this but over-heard reception telling another guest about it. When we went downstairs for coffee at 8:00 a.m., there was only decaf remaining. I would not want to stay here again. The room seemed too small for even one person to move about comfortably. From the hotel pics, it looks like there are rooms with a desk chair plus another chair. At least ask for that when booking a room. But the TV was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: jjminneapolis91
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago for a fun weekend and decided to stay at the Hotel Felix as you could not beat the price, especially for that location. We had a terrific experience. The staff was as polite and helpful as could be. The room, while small, was immaculately clean and comfortable. I will definitely consider staying here again on my next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hip boutique hotel with an attitude to match”
Reviews.Author: nolongereastla
Reviews.Content: Last month, I stayed at Hotel Felix with my parents and young daughter. The newly renovated hotel boasts cool, modern minimalist decor and floor to ceiling windows in the lobby to witness the young and hip swing their way through the rotating doors. The rooms are beautifully simple, the beds dreamy (as though I was sleeping a giant pillow). Front desk staff were friendly, knowledgable, accommodating (suggesting local restaurants, early check-in). Unfortunately, the young, spacey bartender within the hotel was preoccupied with entertaining her 'cool' personal friends and brushed off numerous attempts of my parents ordering drinks. Lost business.... The adjoining restaurant has a great ambiance similar to the hotel. The evening waitstaff friendly (although a slight bit 'green', he didn't know much about the beer or the premise of the restaurant), the food delicious (their burger with creamed leeks and applewood smoked bacon was one of the best I've ever tasted), the drinks well mixed and strong. The morning waiter was the only one working the busy breakfast crowd. He was able to handle it well and did a great job. The only downfall was the snotty 'don't-you-know-we're not Starbucks?' reply my friend received upon asking for a vanilla latte. This was soon followed by more high-and-mighty tone of the 'local' and 'organic' products served at the restaurant. I was witness to this the night before, too, sitting at the bar alongside the owner who, from conversation, thinks that 'local' and 'sustainable' make him exclusive and important. For those of us who frequent restaurants not only for great food but for unpretentious service, I would have to think hard if I would patronage this place again for the snotty attitude.

Reviews.Title: “good value if you want location”
Reviews.Author: USinEU
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via hotwire - aka we took a gamble - and it was great. The room we had was very small (as in tiny), but very clean and nice. Nothing to fancy but you felt very comfortable there. Our greatest need on our 3 night stay was location. And this was located pretty close to the Mile which is what we wanted. I would not have paid their normal prices online as that would have been too much, but if you find a cheap deal then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and a lot of bang for my buck”
Reviews.Author: definerost
Reviews.Content: I had a great rate on this hotel through Travelzoo that was $99 per night and included breakfast for 2 and free parking for my Hybrid vehicle. Parking is normally $42 a night and the breakfast for 2 would have been $22 based on menu prices. You can do the math. The hotel itself was modern and fantastic. Great location, very clean, great service, great restaurant. The only concern for many seems to be the size of the rooms. Yes, they were small, but that was no concern to me and it wasn't as bad as people make it out to be. I slept well there in a clean comfortable bed. I wasn't intending to have a hotel party. For the price I paid, you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool and Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: titoslack
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in the Heart of the River North Area. Rooms are small, but the hotel is worth it if you can get past the room size. It's Chicago, who hangs out in the room anyway? Great Location within walking Distance to almost all the Major Chicago Sights. Plenty of Restaurants and Bars very close by. Try the Clark St Ale House or Angels and Kings for some great nightlife, both are Literally 1/2 block away for the Hotel. The Front Desk people were extremely nice and accommodated all our Requests. My GF visited the SPA and had an similarly excellent experience. We had a amazing Long Weekend at this Hotel and with the "EL" station a very short walk away, Chicagoland was at our Doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “This place is cool!”
Reviews.Author: Dabrador
Reviews.Content: Had to travel to downtown Chicago for business. I wanted something different and in a great location. The Hotel Felix was perfect. It's got a contemporary and "hip" feel to it. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in. The bathroom was large and the shower was a true walk in shower with one of those large "rain shower" heads. It is a boutique hotel and despite what others have said, the rooms are not tiny or small. I had a room on the 10th floor with a king bed and it was perfect. ALL of the staff were attentive and extremely helpful. This is definitely my new "go to" hotel in downtown Chicago. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views of Stunning City”
Reviews.Author: aberdeen74
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel Felix in Chicago when we had a quick layover on the way to new York. Had never heard of hotel before so took a chance and wasn't disappointed. Near Chicago's magnificent mile, this place had great views. Room was spacious - I keep forgetting how big American hotel rooms can be! Staff was courteous throughout. Didn't have a chance to eat here unfortunately. I spent a bit more than I normally would, but definitely worth the treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Swennie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Felix in October - visiting our daughter for Parents Weekend at DePaul. The hotel staff was very friendly - and while the room was small, it was clean and the bath products and bathroom facilities were nice - love the H2O products! It is a few blocks to the EL stop and downtown locations. Try the restaurant YOLK for breakfast/brunch - about a block away, fantastic!. There was a great discount code on the DePaul website, so it was a bargain for the two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good things come in small packages”
Reviews.Author: breathing4mel
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel close to everything! We knew ahead of time that the rooms were small, and our room was no exception. But the bed was oh so comfortable, room temperature was perfect, and the decor very nice. I was a bit taken aback at the "closet" and lack of luggage rack (made my own out of the ironing board). The H2O products in the bathroom were great. We found a deal on the Chicago tourism site for $99 including breakfast- after tax it was $115. Our breakfast at their restaurant "Elate" was wonderful. Service was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Alohamousey
Reviews.Content: I was in Hotel Felix four nights for a conference. The hotel is located in a nice area of Chicago, and there are plenty of things happening around this area, including several nice restaurants and a Whole Foods near by. When we arrived apparently they had overbooked so they offered us two separate rooms instead (we had four people and we asked for a room with two double beds) which is an extremely nice gesture and responsible thing to do. Now this is a boutique hotel, and for those of you who do not know what it means...the rooms were small. Regardless, the rooms were immaculately clean and the recent renovation was very apparent as everything looked incredibly NEW and spotless. They offered a nice bathrobe and boutique line toiletry so I was extremely impressed with that. The TV was a big flatscreen and the bed was soft and very, very comfy. The fitness room was nice, however I was hoping for some more weights. Breakfast (continental) was complimentary with nice choices of fruit and a variety of pastries. Business center was nice to use and you can use the color injet printer and computers for free. Wireless internet was free and fast (faster on lower floors). Bellman opened the doors for you and you do feel like a small royality staying at here. The bar in the lobby looked nice although I didn't have time to try it out.

Reviews.Title: “We thought the Felix was great”
Reviews.Author: GaylenL
Reviews.Content: Everyone there was extremely nice and helpful. Yes the rooms were a bit small but I wasn't going to live there.The best thing is how clean everything is.We would stay again and also recommend The Felix to anyone staying dowtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slamma
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly upon arrival, they welcomed us at the door! The rooms are small, but well worth it. Centrally located and easy to walk to from anywhere downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Only a so-so bargain”
Reviews.Author: tennismom710
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to go to Chicago for the weekend to visit our son, who is attending school there. Most of the downtown hotels were very expensive -- over $300 a night -- so we decided to book through Hotwire. The result was a two-night stay at Hotel Felix. There are several nice things about this hotel, most notably the friendly and helpful staff. The common areas are very nice, and the hotel is clean and well-kept. The location is good -- on the corner of Huron and Clark -- with easy access to the Magnificent Mile and a short cab ride or long walk to the cultural attractions. There are also several shortcomings: the rooms and the bathrooms are the size of postage stamps -- really tiny, with very little space for hanging clothes or sitting to read the paper (one small barrel chair). The clock does not have an illuminated dial, making it difficult to see the time if you happen to wake up some time during the night or early morning. The amenities are second class -- rough toilet paper, meager towels, lousy hair dryer, etc. The Hotwire price for two nights was $488 including tax and related charges, compared to $740 at The Talbott, my favorite Chicago hotel. So the savings is considerable -- enough to cover the outrageous amount we spent for transportation while we were there. Also, the elevators are really small, not adequate for the volume of transport during the busy times of the day. We often had to wait for a second or third elevator. And the wifi didn't work at all. So -- I am not sure I would ever stay there again. It really would depend on how many nights -- for one or two, I would bite the bullet and stay at a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay- would never stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Moman2000
Reviews.Content: So I booked this hotel through priceline. The price.. about 225.00 a night. A lot ? yes! Especially when I stayed at a hotel for that price nearby with a huge suite. The room was so small, I was nauseated. I felt completely ripped off. The bathroom had a stupid curtain not a door, and the sink was this little tiny thing with low flow. The place was extremely loud. The room would either get hot or cold, and I could hear elevators going up and down. Somebody tried to enter my room on more than one occasion. Thank god for the other locks. I would never stay here again and I warn everyone else looking for a hotel to stay at to stay clear from this disaster.

Reviews.Title: “not happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: marccmh
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint was that the airconditioning was very loud. I was unable to open the window and the room got too hot without airconditioning. They also messed up when giving out rooms and gave my room to another person so I had somebody try to enter my room around 9pm. The manager called and apologized.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay at Hotel Fleix!”
Reviews.Author: dc_flyer
Reviews.Content: Arrived and was greeted immediately at reception. My room was on the 6th floor, and was very nice. The bed and bedding was very comfortable. Directly in front of the bed was a large flat screen LCD Television with cable stations. The bathroom was good size and had everything you needed when you're away from home. The hotel location is ideal. Staff was available when needed too. CTA subway (Red Line) is a few blocks, along with Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location but could be better”
Reviews.Author: PaulQuinn
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location. Close to Michigan avenue, and about a mile away from the shore, which is good for an outdoor run. The hotel room I stayed in was quite small. There was a double bed which almost took up the entire room, with a small open wardrobe. The hotel did offer free wireless internet access which is always good, especially for business and personal use. There isnt a restaurant or breakfast area for the hotel, however a restaurant which shares the location with the hotel offers a discounted rate for hotel guests. The bar area and entrance area is quite small. All in all decent hotel, would stay here again but would say you could probably get a better hotel for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jadunlap
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a night at Hotel Felix in celebration of our anniversary. It was fantastic. We had a super-clean king room -- perhaps they are bigger than the queen rooms reviewed by others or maybe some folks need a lot more space. We thought the size of the room was fine. We brought a bottle of wine to drink and the bartender at the hotel's restaurant was very gracious in loaning us two glasses. Room was well-equipped with iPod docking station, stylish fixtures, a wonderful bed, and cool bathroom / shower with robe. Well situated in the city but also very quiet at night (a/c was just fine for us). Staff was great. The only tiny negative I can think of had to do with the narrow hallways -- would be nice to clear out the bins and carts that often were around. We'll for sure be back!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe in NY”
Reviews.Author: Zeeserellie
Reviews.Content: The room is tiny...I'd be embarrassed if I walked in here with another person. I come to Chicago every month and have stayed at many hotels that may not be my style, but I'd much rather return to one of them. I love the look of Felix and found the bed very comfortable, but the room is a joke. The bathroom is also tiny, with no place to put anything. There was hardly a window and no natural light. Fortunately, I'm here for work and exhausted by the time I reach my room and basically just sleep there, because it really feels like a sleeping closet. On the plus side, it's very clean and the people here are very nice and helpful. But room service offerings and times available are very limited, nothing before 7am or after 11pm and no dessert. The location is okay. I liked the nearby Whole Foods, but with the many great choices you have in Chicago, why come here?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff, small rooms, strong aircon.”
Reviews.Author: roryandmichelle
Reviews.Content: As others on this site have already mentioned, the rooms in this hotel are quite small. Storage space is very much at a premium with the wardrobe just a curtained-off rail on the wall. I think that a bit more imagination could have helped solve this. However, the bathroom was fine in our room, bed very comfy and we didn't mind trading some size give the very central location. Staff were very helpful and all their restuarant recommendations were great. We walked everywhere and found the hotel easy to get to. The only other downside is the aircon, which is very strong and loud which meant that we sometimes had to turn it off. The fan speed said low, but it felt like there was an engine running in the room. Other than that a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! 4 star? Ha! Ha!”
Reviews.Author: mbarkMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Save your money! This is the smallest hotel room I have eve stayed in! It is extremely tiny by NYC standards! Queen size bed with 12 inch tables on each side - that's it! Bathroom sink is so shallow a man's hands cannot fit under the facet! No clost - a very short rod with a curtain. Very noisy! No restaurants except McDonalds or Subway in immediate area. Room Service has only 4 breakfast and 5 lunch selections! One of my worst hotel experiences ever! Staff portrays it as "boutique Silver LEED hotel". What an excuse! You can have it!

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination and is at most a 2 1/2 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: leah7653
Reviews.Content: This hotel calls themselves a "boutique" hotel. That translates to extremely tiny rooms. The closet consists of a very short rod that can be covered by a curtain. The bed takes up 3/4 of the room and navigating around the bed is very difficult, especially in the dark. You can hear everything coming from the hallway. The bathroom sink barely holds any water and if your hands are normal to large, they won't fit beneath the faucet.

Reviews.Title: “comfy bed but very small room”
Reviews.Author: twavlr
Reviews.Content: booked through hotwire and stayed for 1 night. nice & friendly staff. eclectic style hotel. stayed on the 10th floor. indeed, the room was small (but big window). good for 1 or 2 person. bed was really comfy. clean room. limited space for luggage. nice flat screen tv. bathroom was nice & clean. behind the bathroom door was a hanger that has a note & said something like this, "enjoy our complimentary robe...." - but there was no robe. overall, i like the hotel. just the rooms were small, even the hallway was a bit narrow. i guess its their way of going green. if you're a big person, you probably would not like the room. hotel is about 5-6 blocks away from the mile. valet parking overnight was about $42, across the street was $33, & the parking garage was $23.

Reviews.Title: “Small but lovely rooms, great location to explore Chicago”
Reviews.Author: rachelopps
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Felix through Expedia at a reduced rate (approx Â£75 per night) which seemed like a fair rate for what I got. Breakfast wasn't included but the hotel is in a fantastic location. The rooms are small, but as a solo traveller this didn't really matter to me. Felix is just a few blocks away from Michigan Avenue, and walking distance to many sights - John Hancock Centre, Water Tower, Sears Tower etc etc. I even walked back late at night one evening on my own and the neighbourhood seemed pretty safe. Staff were helpful, particularly the front desk who gave me directions and helped me book theatre tickets. Only one small problem when I got there to check in, they gave me a key and when I used it to access 'my' room there was a man's case and clothes in there. Lucky he was not in the room (or the shower) at the time. So I went down and told the front desk, they promptly moved me to a slightly larger room. I was happy with that but later on that evening two guys tried to get into my room. Turned out that they had been given a key for the same room! I was in bed at the time but luckily (thank goodness) I had dead bolted the door. If not, it would have not been a good experience. They had to go down and let Reception know - so I wasn't overly impressed with how the rooms are allocated. That aside, I really liked the hotel. It's small but very functional and as it's a boutique the rooms are decorated very nicely. It was very comfortable and the location meant that I was right in the heart of the Windy City - perfect for a first-time visitor such as myself. It's a great base for exploring the city, if you're not planning to spend 24/7 in your hotel room then you probably don't need loads of space anyway. There's actually an Aveda spa on site and although I didn't get time to visit it, this is a nice extra touch if you feel like some pampering. Not sure that I would pay the full Â£150 ish a night, but I was happy with what I got for what I paid. I think the hotel will do well and the fact that it's eco-friendly just adds that extra something.

Reviews.Title: “Itty Bitty”
Reviews.Author: CardiffChrisB
Reviews.Content: After much research, I choose the Felix Hotel in Chicago for a 4 night stay. There are so many places to choose from, I will not make this choice again. The room, although well appointed (especially the lovely bathroom) was TINY. Think queen bed and about 18 inches on either side. We had to ask for much needed luggage racks (three times) as well as an ice bucket. I had a problem with my bill as I checked out - someone was to contact me according to the desk clerk - but there was no manager on call when I had to leave for the airport. It has been 1 week and I have not been contacted. Maybe it takes 3 tries as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great room if you want to relive your college days in the dorm”
Reviews.Author: JandJIndiana
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Hotel Felix late on Friday night for a four night stay. I had booked the room through Priceline where it was listed as a 4 star hotel, recently renovated. The pictures looked nice so I was excited to go. We arrived late, around 11 pm. We were greeted by the valet/bellman/doorman who helped us unload our luggage and parked our car (valet parking was the only option at more than $40 per night which isn't really unusual in Chicago) Check in went smoothly, but they wanted an additional $35 per night for a king size bed. Seemed a bit pricey so we decided to try the queen room. There was no one to help us up with our bags so we took the luggage cart upstairs ourselves. The elevator was so small it barely fit the cart and and two of us. It should have been a sign. The hotel was nicely decorated and very clean. We stayed on the 8th floor. When we opened the door to our room, we both almost died of shock. The room was so small I couldn't believe it! My freshman door room 20 years ago was bigger! There was one bed, I am not sure it was even a queen size. No closet, simply a bar sticking out of the wall on which to hang your things. You could pull a curtain over it to close the "closet." There was an in room safe on the shelf in the closet which was a nice feature. There was an iron, but no ironing board. There was no dresser. The bed was a platform bed that had two drawers that pulled out of the foot of the bed. You couldn't open the drawers and walk around the bed at the same time. There was a narrow desk with a very nice flat screen TV above it, but it was to the side of the bed so you either had to lay side ways or not see the TV. There was no place to unpack your luggage or even stow your luggage after you unpack. The bathroom was nice, but the sink had no vanity space for makeup, etc. The shower was nice and the toiletries were high quality but there was no body lotion, only shampoo, conditioner and body wash. The hotel had an ice machine and Pepsi machine on each floor which was convenient. The ice bucket had no plastic liner so I had to use the zip lock bag I brought. There were no drinking glasses to use other than two bathroom ceramic glasses, very small in size. Dont count on any type of view from the room. We looked out onto another buildlng under construction, wrapped in plastic that whipped in the wind. The bed was a pillow top and very comfortable. However the bedding was a sheet, heavy comforter and another sheet. We melted under the comforter or got cold under just the sheet. The air conditioning was inconsistent. We set it to 67 to try not to sweat through the night, but the fan would turn on and off so we went from hot to cold all night. The first morning, we had a Do not Disturb sign on the door as we wanted to sleep in. That didn't stop housekeeping from knocking three or four times. When that didn't work, they called us. I sense they may have missed the point of the sign. We didn't eat in the restaurant as it seemed to have a limited menu. There is a Whole Foods grocery store about a block away and it was a great source of breakfast (although we had to eat on the bed as there was no other place for us to set the food) We also found a great place for breakfast about four blocks away called Yolks. Try the breakfast burrito and go with the fresh fruit. It was yummy! Overall the Felix was nicely decorated and clean, but I am not sure how it was a four star hotel. I expect a bit more for the price and star rating. For example, would have been nice to have a loaner umbrella when it unexpectedly rained, but they did not have any to loan. Alas, it was a nice location, an easy walk to great restaurants, but a tiny, tiny room!

Reviews.Title: “noisy room”
Reviews.Author: lcprieto
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was great, and the room looked great, but unfortunately the room was too noisy. The main source of noise was the air conditioning, that has a very loud fan, but you can also hear every time someone in a close by room comes back to the hotel.location is great. we had brunch at the restaurant and it was preaty good. one thing, if you do decide to stay there, be carefull with the bed corners as stick out quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected surprise...”
Reviews.Author: reyledda
Reviews.Content: We did not book the Felix. We had meant to stay at the Whitehall Hotel but were told on arrival that we had been transferred to the Felix due to some problems. I'm glad they did. The Hotel Felix was an unexpected surprise. The location is near all the places we wanted to get to in downtown Chicago. The rooms are small (the "closet" is literally a curtained hole in the wall) but the bathroom was big, and the shower was luxurious. The amenities were H2O Essentials, and the bed was comfortable. There is a (small) bar downstairs, and a convenient self-park across the street that has reasonable rates for overnight parking. It is also close to a CTA station if you want to take the train. Oh, did I mention that their rates are very reasonable?

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, mod hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shes_Electric
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, it's true. But they are incredibly well-designed and make the most of the small space. The bed was incredibly comfortable and everything was impeccably clean. I only stayed one night and was not able to take advantage of the business center or restaurant. The staff was friendly and helpful. I will definitely stay at the Hotel Felix again the next time I'm in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel; Superb location..just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: bluepointToronto
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I had a great stay at Hotel Felix. It could not have been better. We arrived early and we had no delays checking in. The lobby and room decor is very hip & modern. The rooms are quite small, but very well appointed. We lacked for nothing. The beds are very comfortable & the sheets are top notch. The bathroom and shower is both beautiful and functional. Great H2O products! The staff were amazing, from front desk to the lady who filled the coffee urns. Yolk restaurant on Wells is great for breakfast and you have got to try Mexique on W. Chicago Ave. for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, sorry service”
Reviews.Author: Michigan02
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but the design is terrific, and the building is charming. But the hotel needs a serious reassessment of its customer service. We checked in at 3:05, and didn't get a room until 5:00; and they never called to notify us the room was ready, as they said they would. We called ahead to retrieve our car from the valet; 40 minutes later, no car, and the message had never been relayed to the valet. We needed aspirin; no luck (they sent us to a drugstore down the street). No coffeemaker in the room. No general acknowledgement from the staff that there were flaws in their service. For the price, you'd be better off somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room !”
Reviews.Author: LonelyTraveler4Life
Reviews.Content: The style of the was amazing for a solo traveller. They dont have microwaves in the room, or coffee makers, but there is coffee everyday in the lobby. If you need an Iron don't forget to ask for one, because they don't have one in every room. I like the style it was perfect for just me and the bed was really comfortable. Get your I-pod if you wanna use their I-Home as your alarm clock. The staff is accommodating and the door man has yet to suggest a place to eat that I didn't like. Try getting a top floor room if you are a light sleeper, because the city hustle can be disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here! This Is No 4 Star Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: flyingflirt
Reviews.Content: YOU'VE NEVER SEEN SUCH SMALL ROOMS. When I say this is a TINY room, take it SERIOUSLY. I had to sit on the bed for my boyfriend to walk into the bathroom. And I concur with a previous reviewer, they treat Hotwire customers like garbage. The entire staff is trained to parrot the line, "We are a boutique hotel" - well I have traveled all over the world and stayed in hundreds of boutique hotels here and abroad and I'm telling you that the rooms are UNBEARABLY small - not to mention WITHOUT ANY DISCERNIBLE AMENITIES. A tiny ledge is mounted to the wall called a "desk" with a small chair. The "closet" was a 2 foot cut out in the wall with a curtain hanging in front of it. The bathroom consisted of a a tiny sink (NO COUNTER SPACE), a toilet, and a small standup shower. Believe me folks, an RV has more room than this. Also, they knew we were Hotwire customers and treated us as such. Our room looked out into an alley. They wouldn't even let us pay more money and upgrade. There must be some mistake because this IS NO 4 STAR HOTEL. It's barely a 2.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay at Hotel Felix”
Reviews.Author: NeroFlash
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felix has small but well design modern rooms. Location is near attraction/metro/clubs/restaurant. The staff is friendly and helpful without requesting tips. The business center have 3 fast PC and the gym have 2 treadmills/2 elliptical/weights and bench. the rooms could use a small fridge and a coffee maker. ~H2O+ product in the bathroom was a nice touch as well as the shower design.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel around”
Reviews.Author: OSUjules
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel's I have ever stayed in. I loved that it felt so chic just being in the lobby. The rooms are super clean & simply designed. They are small though as others have said...but not uncomfortable. The staff is 110% amazing. The doorman never forget your face & they are so helpful. One of the guys (Dave, I think) was just walking around the lobby asking people if they needed anything & introducing themselves. These employees seriously understand what customer service is all about and actually like their customers - which is more than I can say for the airline I came in on.

Reviews.Title: “ok IF you get a good price”
Reviews.Author: YadiDadi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Felix in July. We booked this hotel because we got a special rate on Expedia.com of $109/night. I have to agree with the previous reviewer that this hotel absolutely does not deserve a 4-star rating (it is listed as a 4-star on Expedia as well). I would say it deserves 3-stars, 3-1/2-stars tops. We had a corner room and it was probably the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in in my life. The negatives are: -There is barely enough room to walk around the bed. -The sink in the bathroom is so poorly designed that you can barely get your hands under the faucet (and the people I traveled with range from small to medium in size). It baffles the mind that anyone would design something in this manner. The positives are: -The hotel is in a good part of town as you can be on Michigan Ave within 5-10 minutes walking -The staff is very helpful in pointing you in the right direction if you require help finding things. Every time we left, we were asked if we knew where we were going. -It is newer, so everything inside is very nice I would say if you can get a rate closer to $100 for this hotel, then by all means it is worth it. The others we traveled with purchased their room for $189/night. Definitely many better options for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: renee419
Reviews.Content: The location is great - walking distance to major sites, bus stops and train station right there, many restaurants around....the staff was SO nice - friendly and always willing to help...overall great place for the price!

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations in every respect”
Reviews.Author: noriboy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix achieved the unbeatable combination of great value; comfortable, immaculately clean and well appointed rooms; friendly, helpful staff without a trace of stuffiness; and cozy, inviting lobby and bar. We loved it and would absolutely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The bed embraced me”
Reviews.Author: ladybugrina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Felix a few weeks ago at the end of June. I was a little nervous because I had booked on Hotwire and I knew the hotel was new. All worries went out the window from the time I was greeted at my airport shuttle to get my bag. I had a great time in Chicago and the hotel was wonderful. The bed was AWSOME, the blackout curtains were great, the location was ok -- I would have preferred a little closer to downtown but not really a complaint, the room size was fine for me (I traveled solo). My only complaint was that the bathroom sink was small, the basin was in a sufficent size. But that's my only real complaint. The staff was very courteous and helpful. I would defintely stay here again. The hotel is beautiful and I loved that it's a GREEN hotel. I also recommend folks going on the architecture tour, one of my favorite parts of the trip besides hanging with my friends who showed me the city through their eyes. P.S. free internet

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel Stay!”
Reviews.Author: djr09
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felix is a fabulous hotel in a great location. My family spent four days at the hotel and we enjoyed it immensely. The staff (Errol, Julian, Conrad and David) was awesome - customer service at it's finest. Very knowledgeable of the city. As some guests have stated, the rooms are somewhat small, but they worked just fine for us. If your needs require larger rooms, call Hotel Felix before booking.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is well worth a try.”
Reviews.Author: WDMJ
Reviews.Content: The Felix has only been open a short time and sadly the restaurant was behind schedule so we had to eat out. It also meant that only tea and coffeee were available in the mornings.That said however the hotel is well situated for access to the city and there are plenty of eating places within easy walking distance. Would suggest YOLK on Wells for excellent breakfasts. Rooms in the hotel were perfectly adequate, comfortable and well air conditioned. Staff were friendly and helpful and the bar, though small, was no bad place to come back to at the end of the day. In all, we spent ten days there and were we to visit Chicago again would certainly not bypass The Phoenix. Dennis Johnston

Reviews.Title: “Haven't even been, but already dreading my stay!”
Reviews.Author: hollybry
Reviews.Content: I will be staying at Hotel Felix in two weeks and I'm already dreading my stay! They were just so rude to me on the phone, and they made me very aware that b/c I'm a Hotwire customer I'm a second rate customer. I made a mistake I'll never make again: I booked a room at Hotel Felix through Hotwire. If you're clever with Hotwire, you can pretty much figure out which hotel you'll get during the booking process. I was initially very excited to land a room at the Hotel Felix ... then I called them and it was all downhill from there. I've been a big fan of Hotwire for years: I like an adventure (never know exactly where you'll stay until your credit card is already charged) and in these times we all needs to save a few bucks on a hotel - hey, I'm a librarian, and we don't exactly roll in the dough! I've never had a problem getting a two bed room for two people with a Hotwire reservation (I usually travel with library colleagues): make your reservation via Hotwire, call the hotel to confirm and select your room type, and you're good to go! Not with Hotel Felix. I was told my reservation was for a single queen bed hotel room and they would not honor my request for an "upgrade" to a two bed room. Per the Hotwire terms of service, Hotel Felix informed me, all that they had to do was provide me with a room that would accommodate two people, and that could even be just a full size bed. Basically, Hotel Felix conveyed that b/c I made a reservation via Hotwire, I'm a second rate customer and eligible only for the smallest, least popular room type. I inquired about availability of two bed rooms and was told that there were plenty, but they wouldn't be "upgrading" me b/c they didn't have to. I called Hotwire, and they just referred to their terms of service: "Room type will be determined by the hotel based on the number of guests provided at time of booking. All reservations are booked for stays in non-smoking rooms (subject to availability). Hotel room assignments are determined at check-in and upgrades are not available." A Hotwire agent, Don, did try to contact the hotel but they were unwilling to budge. Don let me know that I might be able to "upgrade" when I arrive, but not to count on it. There's fine print, and then there's customer service, don't you think? So now Hotel Felix has my money and Hotwire has its fee and I'm arriving in two weeks and just dreading it. Both Hotwire and Hotel Felix have forever lost my future business as well as that of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, but very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: holiday092
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix is brand new. The room was quite small, with two double beds, and not much room to put suitcases, (i wouldnt recommend for 4 people, two is okay though) however the bed has built in draws, which were excellent. The beds were very very comfy. staff were very friendly and there's free tea and coffee in the bar of a morning. Very clean also. The location was great, we walked from the train station and back to the airport was a $35 cab ride. We walked to areas all over the city including millenium park and the Mag. Mile shops. Best value to get the 3 day $14 transport pass which does buses and trains. The air con was a little noisy from time to time, but not enough to complain. Chicago tips: hire a bike from North beach and ride along the lake shore, Lincoln park zoo is free and excellent, and eat at Maggianos (Italian), its absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable, and accessible”
Reviews.Author: laratada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a great deal to stay at Hotel Felix for a long weekend. We were impressed with the sleek, eco-friendly design as well as the friendly, helpful staff . STAFF: The staff was responsive and always greeted us with a smile. The front desk was always willing to print out directions to local restaurants and attractions. Housekeeping was friendly and always did a great, thorough job. LOCATION: Hotel Felix is only a walking distance from the Chicago brown and red L lines just outside of the Loop. There is a Whole Foods and 711 within a block of the hotel and the Magnificent Mile is only a few blocks away. A few more blocks past that is the lake shore. Millennium Park is only about a 20 minute walk from the hotel with lots shopping and restaurants on the way. ROOM As in most big cities, our room was pretty small, but extremely clean and comfortable (especially the fluffy, queen size bed). There is a flat screen HDTV with cable and an alarm clock radio complete with an ipod dock. The room is designed to be space efficient with storage drawers under the bed, a small alcove to hang a few clothes, shelved night stands and a cabinet in the bathroom. The bathroom was also very modern looking with a well sized shower stall complete with a rainfall shower head and nice variety of H20 bath products. The room was noise proof and we never heard neighbors or people in the hall. FACILITIES The funky lounge was a great area for guests to hang out or enjoy coffee and tea in the morning. There is also a small gym on the 2nd floor and an Aveda Spa. We were pleased that the hotel offers free wi-fi, but found the connection to be very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: KrisKP
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great! Everyone was so helpful, and nice, and full of information. This is a new property, and the only silver LEED hotel in Chicago. The restaurant is not open, but there is everything that you could imagine nearby within walking distance. So, have very comfortable shoes. The room was small, but very comfortable. No tub, but a very large shower. Can't wait to return!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Euro design with relaxing tones and modern decor.”
Reviews.Author: Gquad
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix had recently opened, they were still hanging their marque when I arrived. I entered a small lobby with two conversation lounge areas and bar near a fireplace for intimate socializing. The decor was a soothing eco-friendly setting for a professional or trendy meet place. The front desk staff was very friendly and were especially accommodating to all of our requests, as were the bellman (who even ran to the store for me). I only experienced single rooms, which were quite small but efficiently designed for storage & comfort. The feel of the room was modern with earth tones for a relaxing atmosphere. The queen size bed had drawers built into the platform, eliminating the need for a dresser. There was soft cotton bedding, fluffy pillows and a duvet comforter on a very comfy mattress. The bathroom had a roomy stone tile stall shower with no tub, with a modern basin, non harsh lighting, thick cotton towels and hotel toiletries. To keep the room uncluttered, the flat paneled TV was wall mounted, a reduced size club chair was placed in a corner. The only horizontal place to put things were the compact desk area with wifi, a small modern table next to the club chair and two night tables on either side of the bed. The closet was compact but adequate for the single room. I missed out on the fitness room and spa (tight schedule), but I used the business center, which had free internet service and a printer/fax. There were also several meeting rooms, which looked comfortable when I peeked in. As far as I know, my group very satisfied with the hotel, with no memorable complaints, except one who had trouble navigating around the platform bed. Donâ€™t miss the restaurant ZED451 just one block away. Itâ€™s a wonderful eclectic mix of American, Asian and Mediterranean choices for a one price, serving up a variety of inventive flavor infused, dry rubbed and aged meats plated in a Churrasco serving style. Very chic multi level decor with some seating extending from a fire pit. Bring an appetite, since the food doesnâ€™t stop until you realize that there is no more room to experience another bite.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic, very new, very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aggiemo08
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Felix through a conference I was attending in Chicago. This was my first time to Chicago, so I had no idea on ideal locations, but the Felix was perfect! It was within walking distance to almost everything I wanted to see, and if something was too far to walk, the doormen were eager to assist me with either a cab or instructions to the "L" Trains. As others have said, the rooms were small, but for a single traveler, they were just perfect. I was there for eight days and never felt cramped. The bed was possibly the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on. The rooms came with free Wi-Fi which was nice being there on business, and included HD TV's and iPod docking stations which was great. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and all of the doormen were excellent. Most of the time I was there, I dealt with Julian, and every time I went somewhere he took the time to ask where I was going and if I needed directions, and every time I returned he asked how each specific experience was. Each doorman remembered my name after asking it only once. The housekeeping staff was always around when I would leave the room, and would always ask if I wanted service or if I wanted them to wait. I was extremely impressed with the entire staff. My overall impression of the Hotel Felix was definitely a positive one, and if I ever return to Chicago, I will be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “small rooms, few amenities, but still great”
Reviews.Author: robinet
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just stayed at the Hotel Felix. It is true that the rooms are small but we really only were there to sleep. The bed was super comfortable so we slept very well. There are not a lot of amenities at this hotel but this really doesn't concern me. I don't typically eat at hotel restaurants or go to hotel bars. Now the staff here are superb. Not just the doorman, or the front desk staff....all of them. Because the hotel is small you tend to get a much more personalized level of service and it makes you feel very welcome. This hotel was also extremely clean. This probably has a lot to do with the young age of the hotel but the staff seems to do an excellent job of keeping it looking like new. Definitely a great looking hotel with great staff but the rooms are a little small.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Outgoing and Attentive Staff”
Reviews.Author: sjoe83
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so cozy and clean. My wife and I enjoyed sitting in the lobby and since the bar was closed the doorman went out and bought us a bottle of wine while we sat in front of the fireplace. Ben the doorman was so outgoing and helpful. He gave us 5 star service. Also Daniel at the front desk was great. He knew so much about Chicago! Every restaurant we wanted to go the week we stayed he got us into or gave us information about every restaurant. All the staff was so great through. We will return for sure. The rooms were small but romantic. Breakfast was fine too. Thanks for the great stay and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: mayanprincess
Reviews.Content: my husband and I booked on line and got a great rate for two nights. The staff were all very friendly and hospitable. The free breakfast included waffles, fruit, bagels, etc. The lobby was very warm and cozy and will be really nice once their bar opens. I left a comment card the first night saying that a clock in the room would be nice and voila, there was a clock radio there the next night. We didn't mind the small room since there were only two of us. You should let them know if you want a room with a bathtub though because our room just had a walk in shower. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! Every staff person we encountered was fantastic. The front desk was quick with check-in and also went the extra mile to help us find a personalized birthday cake. The doormen were great and very fun, even giving us all umbrellas for our trip back to the airport. The location was excellent and I would highly recommend this hotel. Our room was immaculate (along with the rest of the hotel) and the beds were incredibly comfortable. The only downside I can even think of is the rooms are a bit small but even with four adults, we managed just fine. I'll definitely be returning!!! Thanks Hotel Felix for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, friendly and helpful staff but tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Traeth
Reviews.Content: Hotel Felix had only been open for a week when we stayed there, and a few teething problems are to be forgiven. For example the bar hadn't been installed, but what was there looked like it will be fine. The staff were very helpful (directing us to a good local restaurant for example), good free internet access & a basic but OK complimentary breakfast. The location is convenient for a 5 minute walk to the Water Tower and Michigan Avenue. Good restaurants are nearby (Quartinos and Fogo de Chao for example). However, one thing that can't improve with time is the size of the rooms. Our bedroom was tiny, with hardly any space to walk around the bed. Two open cases and it was mostly used up. If you travel light, then it might be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: cateyesinthemoon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Felix is a newly remodeled property that just opened for guests in March 2009. The location is excellent, just a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue (Magnificent Mile) and near lots of popular sites. The hotel has a modern slightly European decor. The rooms are small and a bit cramped, but the space is utilized well. The small rooms are not really a problem for most people because you're probably not coming to this part of Chicago to hang out in your room. The staff were attentive and helpful. Our room had no bulbs in the lamp and a non-functional phone when we checked in. These were fixed immediately. The beds are very comfortable. The hotel is trying to be green, so valet parking is free if you have a hybrid car. Otherwise it's a very pricey $42/day. There was a little confusion at check-out. I'd already pre-paid on Hotwire, but was asked to pay again. The problem was solved however and not really an issue. Overall this is a nice place, with a great location in the heart of Chicago.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Felix
HotelInfo.Address: 111 W. Huron St., Chicago, IL 60654
